Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveHSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Banks Mansion 31/3/12 for my wife's birthday, we arrive around 10am expecting to leave bags at reception and look around Amsterdam, but were told our room was ready and we could check in, great start to a short weekend! Staff could not have been more helpful, providing maps, and organising trips we required. the breakfast was outstanding, and the free bar in lounge was perfect to unwind after a day out and about. Most comfortable bed I have slept in. A great hotel, would return again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for your Amsterdam visit”
Reviews.Author: mellanderHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my grandmother at the Banks Mansion Hotel from April the 5th to April the 8th. We arrived at 11 am, so we were prepared to wait an hour to get into our room. Very friendly concierge told us, that our room was already cleaned, so we were able to leave our luggage there and start to enjoy our trip. The rest of the hotel staff were just as nice, and every time we asked for something they were really eager to help us with our problem. We had a room with a canal view, though the hotel is now under restoration, so the view wasn't as excellent as we had expected. The location of the hotel is perfect, it's just between the Museumplein and the centre of Amsterdam. Also there's a tramstop almost in front of the hotel with two or three different tram lines. The only problem with the trams is that they are quite loud, and you can hear the traffic to some rooms, so if you're not a heavy sleeper, it's a good idea to bring earplugs. The room was big and clean, as was the bathroom. The bed was excellent, and they even had a pillow menu, where you can choose your like from 5 different pillow types. The breakfast fullfiled all our dreams. There was a cook who made fresh omelets and pancakes, fresh bread and many kinds of cheeses. Also there was a free self service drink bar in the lobby, and during the evening little snacks, like cheeses and candy and waffles. All in all, we definitely recommend for you to stay at Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in all regards”
Reviews.Author: hans harald m
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotels in all regards. Great rooms, good location, absolutely great staff helping you out with everything. We loved our stay and would probably come back if we return one day in Amsterdam. Clearly, hotel is not cheap. But I think Amsterdam is generally a very expensive town. So, no suprise on this.

Reviews.Title: “The Delightful Banks Mansion Hotel-Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: happycamperLoughton
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for a short break in amsterdam. The location is great, the rooms and bathrooms are very clean and spacious, and the reception staff most friendly and helpful. There is the added touch of a free self service drinks bar in the reception area, and a complimentary mini bar in the rooms. We travel to amsterdam every Easter, and will defintely be staying at the Banks Mansion next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SashieZ
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel last week and have only good things to say. It is in a great location..walking distance to everything. Great staff, clean, comfortable room (212) with big bathroom (separate shower and large tub). Breakfast included - nice selection with made to order eggs and pancakes - more like crepes but delicious. Nice to go back to the hotel after walking for hours and have a glass of wine with some appetizers. And the wine was not bad! I had initially wanted to stay in a canal house to really get the flavor of the city but wanted one that included breakfast and couldn't find that. I also usually stay in a smaller, more boutique style hotel. However, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abby L
Reviews.Content: An unexpected treat! Upon arrival we were granted a free room upgrade- to the third floor corner room overlooking the Herengracht canal. The hotel was perfectly located for exploring the city on foot. During our stay in Amsterdam the weather was quite chilly. Since this hotel was so centrally located we were able to stop back into our hotel in the middle of the day to put on more layers, warm up, and enjoy a free espresso or cappuccino from the 'living room' of the hotel. At night we would relax in the 'living room' with a free drink and a snack that the hotel provided. At the hotel we were also able to buy tickets for the canal tours, Anne Frank House, trams, etc. The room was excellently clean, the bed was comfortable, and there was a a menu to order pillows to your liking each night. This hotel is also very close to a stop for the tram which is a quick ride anywhere in the city, especially Centraal Station. The staff was warm and welcoming each time we entered the hotel. The breakfast was delicious each day, and the staff in the kitchen was also very friendly. I suggest this hotel to anyone traveling to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GMoore_11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is located half way between Dam Square and the Museum area, very convenient to the main tourist sites, yet far enough away from the noise and tackiness of the Red Light District and the area around Central Station. There is even a tram which stops right outside the hotel. The room was comfortable and very clean and despite the fact that we were on the ground floor with a tram running outside the window, there was very little noise at nighttime. We also liked the "all inclusive" facilities of the hotel, namely the DIY free bar and cheeses offered in the evenings - a very nice touch. The staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. Probably not the cheapest option in town, but well worth the extra money - I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: patriciaDubai
Reviews.Content: Spent one weekend there with my husband and had a great time. Amsterdam has so much to offer and certainly Banks Mansion helps to enjoy this wonderful city. Our room was a typical european size room, small but clean and with a wonderful via of the canal. We specially enjoyed the free drinks on the lobby. Would come back again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept but I don't think I am coming back”
Reviews.Author: singpat
Reviews.Content: First time I've been to a kind of "all-inclusive" business hotel. The striking feature is clearly the free drinks policy in this place. Did I like this? Well, of course it is nice to have a beer or two on the house but it pays for having a small and at max 3 star level room (for a 4-5 star price). I also didn't really liked the "open litre carafes" for the hard booze on the room. Not that I am an alcoholic but if I would be one, it would be too tempting. It gives a cheap Turkey all-inclusive appearance. The breakfast was so lala in a Formule 1 styled room in the basement. Clearly not matching the price tag. In all, not my style but others may like it.

Reviews.Title: “VERY POKEY ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerFirst
Reviews.Content: I have always applauded and embraced Hotels that dare to be different and was really looking forward to something quite special here. I was disappointed. Not with the service or concept but the size of the bedroom which was very bijou and made me feel that I was retiring for the night in a dolls house rather than a grown up persons hotel room. I checked in late to find the front door closed and a sign that suggested I ring the bell. I was soon spotted by a male member of the hotels staff who buzzed me in and welcomed me by name, guessing that I was who he thought I was. A nice touch. He then explained that the hotel was a full service concept where guests were encouraged to treat the hotel like a home away from home as he showed me the lounge area with bar, all of which he assured me were 'included' in the price. I was tired. I realised that my iphone charger plug wouldn't work in Amsterdam so asked him for an adaptor. I was offered a large assortment of 'free' adaptors, none of which would work adapting an English 3 prong plug or, I could purchase, rather than borrow, an adaptor for 9.50 euros. A bit cheeky I thought and proceeded to my room on the first floor. My first impressions were that the Art Deco inspired room was very clean, but VERY cramped and I felt boxed in. Although small, the room was well appointed in fairness, good quality fixtures, excellent bed, pillows and cotton bed linen and a Nespresso machine which is a nice touch. I retired for the evening too tired to ask for a room move. Shower water pressure was not great either which was a pity because the shower itself is impressive to look at, I have the same shower head at home as it happens. The breakfast offering was good with the added bonus of ordering something cooked to order which I did. The Omelette didn't look pretty but tasted OK. All in all the experience was let down by what I consider the unacceptably small bedroom and the added value freebies, which I didn't use were not compensation enough, at least for me. Not sure I will rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Jarr_mich
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay. Hotel is well located with decent sized rooms. Breakfast was delicious. Staff was very professional and friendly. very relaxing! Thank you! We definitely plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: lizpani
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone, so I wanted a nice place and centrally located. This was a great place. I arrived early, but they gave me a room right away! It is right on the Herengracht Canal. I was a street level on the street, so there was noise into the night. It is right by the Bloemenmarkt so there is alot of traffic and foot traffic. You might want to be off the street or on a higher level maybe. The room was nicely appointed and breakfast was good. The location was perfect. It is walkable to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum and the Heineken museum/tasting place. It is also walking distance to Jordaan - my very favorite part of town. Anne Frank house is very close to that area. If you are going soon, it doesn't look like the pictures, it is covered with a cloth of some sort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: TexasJpr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey, but worth it. First hotel I've been in where the liquor was included! The staff is super, the food was very good and the room impeccable. The hotel is on a canal on a main road. There is a Lott to see within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: James M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quite simply this is an amazing hotel. We loved every second of it. From the moment we checked in (very early) and were given a room straight away and the offer of breakfast to the minute we handed back out iPad and checked out, the staff were brilliant and could not do enough for us. The rooms are maybe a bit on the small side, but its Amsterdam, so that is to be expected. They are in no way cramped though and have everything you need for a great stay - free mini-bar, bottles of spirits, bathrobes, slippers, the lot. There is even a pillow menu so you can choose the one that is just right for you! The location is brilliant - right in the heart of everything, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be peaceful. You can easily walk everywhere. the only time we took a tram was to/from the train station when we had our cases, but we could easily have walked! The 'home from home' concept is perfect - everything is included and you simply help yourself to the tea/coffee/snacks/alcohol/juice that is available in The Lounge. Sitting by the fire after dinner with a drink in hand, reading one of the many magazines made available was a very civilised way to spend an evening! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Garth59
Reviews.Content: A very very nice hotel, in the middle of everything. Great service, lovely atmosphere, wonderful breakfast. We have stayed all over the world and this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really really relaxing break at a very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sibloo01
Reviews.Content: A hotel designed to relax and unwind in. From the lovely roaring fire (very welcome on the cold afternoons and evening) to the nice touches like the open bar, cheese board, computers and papers to just relax and enjoy whenever you want. The beds are super comfortable and the bedding luxurious and the canal view was a real treat. The hotel is ideally situated for great walks all around Amsterdam. We visited the Koh i noor indian restaurant and the Stoop and Stoop...both of which were excellent value for money and superb for food and atmosphere. The ladies on reception are very attentive and do all that the can to help. Tip.... dont get a taxi from the airport here (it will cost you around 45 euros)...Get the train to Central station (9 euros for two people)and either a brief taxi journey from there or a fifteen minute walk will save you a fortune. Have fun...i'm envious of anyone going here...we were there for three days and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but beware the person charge”
Reviews.Author: cuculan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights last week. I booked it through a trip advisor "special". The rate I was quoted was 146 euros a night. Sounded like a great deal as it included breakfast, drinks, snacks internet etc. However when I booked I neglected to check the tab that there were actually going to be 2 people in the room. Upon check in I was asked for another 40 euros a night. Given that my partner does not drink this meant a pretty expensive breakfast. I objected but as I had booked for 4 nights I was stuck. It was clear from the staff at check in (and from conversations with other quests) that they were well used to clipping the 40 euro addition. I can only surmise that this is a classic "bait and switch". Buyer beware. Otherwise hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for a cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ1612
Reviews.Content: This is an ugly place to stay. The decor was more old fashioned and dated than retro, the bedrooms disappointingly small and the general quality felt more like a hostel than a hotel. One is invited to relax in the rather oddly decorated lobby, yet there are very few seats. We gave up being stared at by other guests and retired to our room. The Walls were wafer thin, the beds were very small, and water pressure in the showers made rinsing my hair virtually impossible. The water temperature was also difficult to control. It is well situated, and worth two stars at a push, but not four. As a result of these issues we felt it was overpriced. We will never stay there again. Do not pay in advance. Be very wary of all the positive trip advisor comments. The manager was very anxious that we wouldn't post negative views, and asked us what she could do to prevent it. Don't blame her, but it made us realise how manipulated reviews can be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie123England
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend for 4 nights after winning a competition, the location is absolutely brilliant, just walking distance from the center. We arrived too early so our room wasnt ready, so the receptionist told us we could stay in the lounge area and help ourselves to drinks and nibbles, they had loads of spirits and also soft drinks, all free!! Then we went to our room which absolutely beautiful, there was even a menu with a choice of different pillows!! Not forgetting bottles of gin, whisky and brandy, all free again! I must say I got very drunk everyday, there was even a telephone in the toilet, just in case... Staff were all brilliant and cheerful, breakfast was delicious and cooked to order, I absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Just_warmed_up
Reviews.Content: Not even through the doors and the staff sprang to assist us! After a killer 11 hour flight we were pathetically grateful for their many kindnesses! They had all the info anyone could need and were very knowledgeable about their area as well as the city. We must also express our delight with all the included "treats" - excellent coffee and cakes, wine or alcoholic beverages, sparkling water- everything we had to pay extra for in other places. The room was also a lovely surprise -the pillows and duvet beckoned immediately! It was hard to get up! The following morning the breakfast included every possible configuration -too much selection! And again -excellent staff. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, and have already told fellow travellers about this wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: packed2go
Reviews.Content: Agree with all comments left by Trip Advisors (thanks). Simply first class hotel with impeccable service standards. The free glasses of champagne for our wedding anniversary were extremely welcome. Many thanks! Tip- best rates are available from the hotels own website http://www.carlton.nl/banksmansion/

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING hotel”
Reviews.Author: NVDDS
Reviews.Content: I stayed as a single traveller for one night. I arrived early and they happily accommodated me in a lovely room right away, and they also offered me free breakfast that was not included in my package! Their breakfast was amazing and fresh. Not just good for a free hotel breakfast, a breakfast I would have happily paid for. Hotel is a smaller property, but not small by any means. 1. Superb Service, friendly and helpful. I even emailed them before arrival how to get there from airport and they emailed a detailed explanation of how to get there by taxi, car, train/tram. I was able to arrive easily via train/tram. 2. Everything in included... Every been to a hotel that charges you for every little move. This is NOT one of those: I have never been to a hotel that gives everything happily for free. Free Minibar (yes REALLY free minibar), free bottles of liquor in the room, free beer and bottles of wine/liquor in lobby, free coffee (actually good coffee - not cheap crap), free breakfast, free wifi (even in your room). 3. Location: close to everything worth seeing in Amsterdam. And close to Tram that allows you to go anywhere else. 4. Luxury: Everything is nicely setup, very high-end property. Never felt cheap for a moment. Every little fixture felt luxurious. They even had a pillow menu... you could select which type of pillow you wanted and they would send it up to your room! I can't say enough about how nice this hotel is. and I must also compliment the TripAdvisor community for recommending it to me. ONE IMPORTANT NOTE: wouldn't recommend for kids. Is definitely a mature hotel. Im not even sure if kids are allowed (what with the free liquor and all).

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could possibly want and so much more”
Reviews.Author: Reebi
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended this by friends so knew it was a good hotel. We've stayed at a number of hotels in Amsterdam and for location and service this was the best so far. The welcome was very warm including a glass of champagne. All the staff we met were so helpful, particularly with restaurant bookings. As our room didn't have a bath we asked to upgrade - 16 euros a night for canal view room. This proved worthwhile as we were allocated an executive room with a great view. The rooms aren't huge but don't need to be, you have everything you need and the heating is very effective so makes the rooms very snug and cosy when it is -10 degrees outside. The lounge area is a great place to relax, don't think we've ever spent much time in the lounge area of any hotel but here it has everything. Snacks throughout the day, tea, coffee, soft drinks and spirits available all day and wines come out around 4pm. It is also very sociable - if you want it to be. And the 2 computers are really useful if you need to print anything. This did cost slightly more than one of our favourite 5 star hotels in Amsterdam but as it is all inclusive it is well worth the extra. As it is so central it is lovely to be able to keep popping back to the hotel to relax in between shopping trips, museums etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisChapman80
Reviews.Content: I'm not one for writing reviews but Banks Mansion deserves a word or two. We stayed in the hotel for one night but wished we could have stayed longer. The staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for us. They took care of everything from showing us around the hotel to organising trasport for our trip. We were made to feel comfortable as soon as we arrived. Everything was included in the price; drinks (a wide selection of alcoholic and non alcoholic bevarages) and snacks in the lobby, the mini-bar in the room which included more snacks and three decanters. The lobby area of the hotel was not like any I have ever come across. The "help yourself to anything you like" concept really made you feel part of the hotel and created a great and unique atmosphere among the guests and staff alike. The rooms were excellent, no noise could be heard from either of the rooms we had at the front or the back. The decor was to an extremely high standard with a sort of art-deco theme. Smart and luxurious offering free movies and even a "pillow menu"!. Breakfast was served downstairs (this was also included in the price) where there was a wide selection of cold foods from cereals to meats, not to mention a breakfast-chef on hand to russtle up anything from plain eggs to pancakes!! This really is a great hotel and i can't reccomend it highly enough. Needless to say we will be returning in the near future!! Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the Flower market”
Reviews.Author: JacobOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excellent hotel for a weekend. We were warmly welcomed and even offered champagne at check in. The hotel offers a kind of all inclusive service. This means complimentary drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcohlic), coffee/tea and snacks in the lobby bar area 24/7. You are also offered cheese in the afternoon. Breakfast was great too with a selection of bread, marmelade, yoghurt, cheese, cereals and fruit as well as local specialties and a chef who can satisfy your desire for omelettes. Breakfast was of course also included. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable with complimentary minibar and your very own Nespresso machine. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIrelandAlan
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time as a guest at Banks Mansion, were made to feel very much 'at home' with much more than you would expect from any hotel........espresso machine, cognac, whiskey, gin and mini bar all included in price. Excellent breakfasts and open bar plus wine and cheese in evening. Great rooms, great location and warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Maria E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous both for its architecture and for the interior design. It's 10 mins walking distance to the city center and facing the canal. Very close to the flower market as well. Everything there was so comfortable and warm. Such a great atmosphere with a lovely fireplace and very efficient and kind staff. The thing I enjoyed the most was their "feel at home" concept. They basically have a 24/7 open bar in the lobby where you can help yourself with food and drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) as you please, just like you would do at home. This is absolutely amazing. I also enjoyed their breakfast service, with local specialties and a chef who can satisfy your desire for omelettes right on the spot! Our room was absolutely perfect. There were 3 different types of pillows, very comfortable and soft (including memory foam). The room was very clean, beautiful view and perfect quiet acoustic. We also had complementary drinks in the room and free wi-fi throughout the hotel for the entire stay. In one word: FANTASTIC. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Poor Policy”
Reviews.Author: EndlessSummerCaptain
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Banks Mansion after an arduous flight from the US. Landing winds in excess of 40 knots made it exciting. Took the Connecxion from the airport to the hotel -- best value! We arrived well before check-in time but they had our room available. Dropped our gear and had breakfast before setting out to explore this wonderfully amazing city. The hotel room was very appealing and had amenities anyone would ask for: complimentary liquor, mini-bar, and forest rain shower -- a great prelude to our African safari. Only two negative points: (1) reservation rate was made when Euro was stronger; the manager would not reduce the conversion to the current level and (2) we had breakfast upon arrival and asked this to be used as our inclusive breakfast instead of the day of departure as we would be leaving before breakfast was served; we were denied this $34 request. Other than those two issues, this is a grand hotel and you are treated as if you are home!

Reviews.Title: “New Year Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Bedford
Reviews.Content: My fourth time here now, and still truly excellent. Staff so kind, great nibbles, lovely bar, close to everything and my favourite hotel in the world. And I have travelled!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NGG186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Banks last weekend and will return. Almost do not want to write a review in case this place gets so popular we will not get a room in the future. This place has got it right. Nice touch with complimentary drinks in lounge area along with nibbles. Also complimentary mini bar. Room was very good ( 210 ) large and vey comfortable. We also knew our room was cleaned properly everyday. Only had breakfast one day as the room was so comfortable we had a very late lie in but wished we had pushed ourselves to get up as breakfast was excellent, great choices. All staff were so helpfull with recommeding restaurants, transport and site seeing. It is well located too, just far enough away to be out of the busy areas but close enough to walk everywhere. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and although not 5 star it is better than some of them.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: katescottage
Reviews.Content: Looking forward to our next stay at this fabulous hotel, wouldn't consider anywhere else, great location, friendly staff, just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Special place”
Reviews.Author: OJ13
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with friendly staff. Hotel is very comfortable and rooms well furnished if a little on small side. Very comfortable bed with vast selection of pillow types to suit all! Room had free minibar and decanters of gin, cognac and sherry all included in price. Wine, cheese and snacks also served from 5-10 pm in living room area next to lobby. Excellent breakfast included in price. The lack of a restaurant was not a problem since there are many good restaurants in immediate area. I would have no hesitation in returning and using this as a base for future visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with free bar! 5*”
Reviews.Author: JL_and_DLSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banks Mansion on New Years Eve whilst in Amsterdam for one night. Â For this popular time of year, hotels in the centre were quoting Â around Â£200 for a double room. Â Banks came in at Â£250, but we were drawn by the excellent reviews, free cooked breakfast and more importantly the free bar!! Â The hotel did not disappoint! Â We have never seen anything like it for a city hotel. Â We were told on arrival that "anything you see is included in your stay!" this included decanters of whiskey, cognac and gin in the rooms, anything from the mini bar in your room, and anything from their bar in the reception area (which had a large variety of your popular spirits, beers, wines). There are also plenty of soft drinks too. Â At different times of the day they also provide nibbles (cheese and biscuits, chocolates, sweets, doughnuts). It was definitely worth paying the extra Â£50 to stay there. Â Rooms are 5* in luxury. Spacious, luxury pillows and duvet, double shower, safe in room....I could go on. Â We were a little worried that being on the ground floor, and facing the road we would hear a lot of street noise, but even being NYE, this was kept out using triple glazed windows. Â Slept fine. Â Would thoroughly recommend is hotel if, like us, you love the extra special touches and luxurious quality but not at silly expense.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, loved it”
Reviews.Author: claire_fowler
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again any time. Beautiful art deco hotel, with great staff (very friendly, willing to help) Free use of iPad / internet in the hotel Loved the 'full service' concept - all mini-bar and lounge bar drinks free, plus a delicious cheese trolley every evening Breakfast included and was delicious - pancakes and syrup worth going back for! Beautiful bathrooms with nice products, big bath, and drench shower Only downside was the room was rather tiny, and had a very small window with no view. Oh, and the lift makes a very scary noise!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TheExpatresse
Reviews.Content: Husband had business, so family tagged along. We got the corporate rate through the business colleagues, so that made it even better. But specifically: In looking for hotels in Amsterdam I saw many stories of horrible customer service by hotel desk staff. I was worried. I should not have been. Other than telling me there was space in front of the hotel to unload our bags (I specifically called ahead and asked . . . "Sure," desk Dude said. "You can probably get a few minutes before the police chase you away." But there was not even room to double park.), the desk crew all went above and beyond the call of duty. Very, very helpful. Always cheerful. Always professional. Recommended a restaurant (and a good one, too--felt like we were locals). Showed me where the ice machine was. Explained how to park outside the city center and how to take the tram back. Free minibar/snacks/ in the rooms and drinks in the lobby. As it should be. Very nice breakfast with someone there to make to-order omelets or pancakes or French toast. (Note: a "Dutch" pancake is a crepe . . . I was expecting something like a popover.) Great location for the walking tourist. We walked to Anne Frank's House, the Van Gogh museum, the Rijksmuseum . . . through the 9 Streets area. Tram stop right in front for easy tram-ing about town. Husband was back in Amsterdam for work this week--stayed there again. I will definitely consider it on my next stay (unless we opt for a houseboat experience . . . but who wants to self-cater, really?) Pillows were ample and good quality. And if you did not like them, there was a Pillow Menu! Website said WiFi only in lobby, but this was not true--they recently changed to WiFi (free) throughout the hotel. Again: this is what a hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJane25
Reviews.Content: Spent the new year at this hotel and was not dissapointed. It had everything you could need from friendly, attentive staff to superb facilities and lots of complementary stuff from a IPAD2 for use during our stay to drinks and snacks in your room or in the living area. The breakfast was great with as much as you could want to eat . Its location was ideal to explore the many delights of this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: NilsFromNorway
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with an exellent location in Amsterdam! Free minibar, free drinks and finger food in the lobby, nice, clean rooms, and a very helpful staff. What more do you need? :-) A nice effect of the free drinks and food in the lobby is that its very social. People wind down in front of the fireplace, drink wine and share experiences and plans. Quickly you end up with new friends, having a ball in Amsterdam...:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: 23cherry
Reviews.Content: If you like staying in a boutique hotel with fantastic personal service stay here! They offer an inclusive service which gives you complementary drinks and nibbles throughout the day with a complementary mini bar which is topped up daily - great if you fancy a coffee and liquour after being out all day or for a glass or two of wine before going out of an evening! Breakfast was exceptional with a great choice of freshly cooked waffles or French toast. The staff you couldn't fault, a credit to the charlton group. Personal touches which you don't get, even in many top hotels, like remembering your name as you left the hotel, wishing you an enjoyable evening at the restaurant we had reservations for - how do they remember!! The only reason I haven't awarded 5 stars is that our room wasn't the best (312) - no view, small window, a leaking shower door which soaked the floor each time you used it and slightly crispy toilet tissue - not befitting of a quality hotel - change your provider Banks Mansion!! Apart from those fussy points we would recommend any one to stay here, thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel with friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: Beescheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on past reviews and what we wanted from our stay over Christmas. I can truly say that this was the best choice by far and was not disappointed! All the staff where very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room was fantastic and was very clean. Breakfast was lovely and had a good selection of foods. The open bar was a fantastic and unique idea with lots of choice. Overall, very happy visit and will be coming back. Strongly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Aitchaitch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Banks Mansion in June 2010 for 4 nights. The idea is simple, ALL inclusive. On arrival we were immediately upgraded to a canal view room on the top floor. The room size was very good and well appointed. Spirits in decanters in the room, no extra charge, mini bar, no extra charge. All beverages and nibbles in the ground floor lounge - free (all day and night). Breakfast cooked fresh, just for you every morning. The staff were extremely knowledgeable and always friendly. Centrally located and within easy walking distance to anywhere in beautiful Amsterdam. Tasteful decorations... we just want to go back. It felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GandBHaveFun
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel entirely from the TA reviews and comparing a few others. The all inclusive concept and great location were deciding factors. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Banks Mansion. We arrived very early in the morning after a long day and night of transit from Africa. The kindest words we had ever heard were "We have rooms ready for you now" quickly followed by "and please feel free to join us for breakfast". Our room was lovely and very comfortable. I'm rather confused by the comments that say the all inclusive isn't worth the extra cost. I get so tired of $7 bottles of water sitting in hotel rooms, mini-bars that charge if you even touch any of the contents and $20-$30 charges for breakfast. We and our friends appreciated that water, soft drinks and snacks were available in the room, as was a Nespresso machine. In the lobby were comfortable chairs, a bar with soft drinks, juices,coffee, tea, waters, wine, beer, liquor and mixers. The cheese board was brought in around 5:00 p.m. and had a selection of cheeses, sausage, crackers, breads, olives, nuts. We enjoyed relaxing with our friends in the friendly ambience that we shared with other guests. Very nice. Breakfast was nicely presented and included fruit, juices, breads, pastries, cheeses, meats both cold and warm, cereal and of course the made to order omelets. I wanted to provide detail on this as some reviewers have left the impression that it didn't amount to much. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, great location - Not worth the extra cost for all inc!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_david
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I arrived at Banks Mansion for part of our Honeymoon trip... We were not disappointed with the location as the hotel itself is a stones throw away from Remembrantplein, and a short walk to Dam Square. We opted for a Canal Facing room, and had requested a bath upon our arrival if available, as not all rooms have this option. After notifying the hotel that this was infact our honeymoon break it would have been a nice touch if we were not infact charged an additional cost for the bath at 32 Euros for our two night stay. We were already paying 'over the price' for a Deluxe Canal Facing room because of the all inclusive option, that is frankly over rated. The cost for a 2 night stay, inlcuding the bath and city tax was Â£500.00 and was a lot really for what this hotel had to offer. The all inclusive option was a quirky feature, as you have cognac, whisky and gin decanters in the room, but as other reviewers have stated you can only drink so much alcohol! Despite my Husband enjoying a few shorts in the Evening, this accompanied by the small cheese board did not really meet our expectations, and left us a bit disatisfied with the hotel. The rooms were tastefully decorated, as was the Lobby (Living Room) and Kitchen area. However, we found the Conceirge and Reception Staff Customer Service very hit and miss... When we arrived our room was not ready (as expected as check in is 3pm) however, we were left with our cases in the lobby! We had to ask to have our luggage stored, which we thought would have been an obvious task to help us with. Amsterdam is an amazing city, however we would look at other hotels options next time as Banks Mansion price is too expensive for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FSMorecambe
Reviews.Content: Good location and friendly staff. The only criticism I have is that the hotel had incorrectly recorded my booking as December 2012. Fortunately a room was available but I did note that an earlier comment on this site suggested this was not the first time this had happened. Apart from this I would have given the hotel five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: littleidiotmoby
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Really friendly staff and extremely comfortable bed. The "complimentary" drinks and snacks added to the relaxed atmosphere. Perfect location for a short break in beautiful Amsterdam. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps offer a choice to not pay for everything?”
Reviews.Author: tadboys3
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay in early October, understanding that the price included paying for all the drinks (wine, soda, juice), snacks (Pringles, peanuts, etc.) and breakfast, regardless of whether we consumed them or not. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves: the hotel was centrally-located, the free internet use was helpful in quickly checking emails, the accommodations were cozy (read: small) but clean, and the young, friendly personnel tried to be helpful with our requests (e.g., book a transfer to the airport, etc.) We were able to check in on the morning that we arrived, without having to wait. The room had a nice view of the canal. It was also beside a busy street and despite double windows, you could sometimes hear loud passerbys. It was cold (rainy in October!) and windy and if you had the windows open, the draft would lift the ceiling tiles in the bathroom - it was really freaky until we understood what was going on! The breakfast was disappointingly limited although the omelet was nice and the orange juice was fresh. The limited menu, and the basic wine selection and peanuts in the lobby were not commensurate to the full price that one pays. Perhaps, the hotel should offer the option for room only, as there are many places nearby to go for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Overall, it was a satisfactory stay but if we have to go back to Amsterdam, we'll check out other hotels to see if we can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant again”
Reviews.Author: Hairy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Second visit in 6 months. Staff so friendly - the breakfast chef is a star - facilities are great from cheese board 5-8 pm and unlimited refreshments Best hotel in the Dam and ive stayed in a few!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic boutique hotel with a modern touch”
Reviews.Author: katea07
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Banks Mansion in late October and had a thoroughly enjoyable and relaxing time. I wanted a unique experience in Amsterdam - a hotel on a canal with modern amenities, a fun atmosphere, and within walking distance of all the attractions. Banks did not disappoint! The hotel retains its classic design but has the modern amenities we all love. I paid close to $400/night for a canal view room, but the amenities that came with this rate were well worth it. The staff were on point, helping with nightly dinner reservations (and not steering us to the normal tourist traps), making delicious made-to-order crepes and omelets each morning, and helping us book fun excursions (the Reypenaer wine and cheese class was an unexpected highlight). Although the rooms are not huge, they are nicely appointed and the bathroom/shower is great. The bed is extremely comfortable and free WiFi is also an added bonus. The best part of the hotel is the lobby and you could tell that all the guests loved this part as well. After spending the day walking around Amsterdam, it was great to come back to the hotel and relax by the fireplace. There is a complimentary beverage and snack area with some nice wine and local cheeses, salami and olives. The hotel is great for friends or couples traveling together, but I also noticed some families at the hotel and loved that they were hanging out in the lobby reading and playing games together in the evening. The location can't be beat and is within walking distance to all the sites in Amsterdam. I never used public transportation or taxis while staying here because we could easily walk everywhere. The hotel is located on the Herengracht canal, which in my opinion is one of the most beautiful canals to walk along in Amsterdam. The Banks Mansion is a good combination of hip, comfortable and welcoming. If I find myself in Amsterdam again, the Banks Mansion will definitely be my home for the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Tse Wing Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Banks Mansion when I went to Amsterdam recently for a business trip. Although it was only for one night, the experience was most certainly unforgettable. My flight arrived in Amsterdam from Singapore in the early morning, and I was totally exhausted. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by the friendly staff at the counter, who was able to allocate a room to me immediately. Moreover, she allowed me to have breakfast on that morning. The standard of the breakfast was very good, and I was able to get some sleep after the meal. I really appreciated their wonderful arrangement, and I was very impressed with the service provided by the staff during my stay. I would most definitely book this hotel again when I next travel to Amsterdam, and I would highly recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location Boutique Style Hotel with added extras”
Reviews.Author: 186300Steph
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately We only stayed one night while visiting a Trade Show. Arriving at about 5.30pm we where quickly checked in and shown extras included, so after putting bags in our room - came down and made cup of tea - rapidly followed by glass of wine and selection from cheese board. Luckily our evening Restaurant was only a short walk away!! Good breakfast - eggs to order whatever you fancy. A short walk from Flower Market and Foam. Wished we where staying another night and would definetly go back. Ideally located within walking distance of alot of museums and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frizzante
Reviews.Content: we spent a fantastic weekend in this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are well equipped and the beds are particularly comfortable. The complimentary cheese and olives etc that are available early evening were delicious. The bar was superb. A particularly nice touch was the big pots of sweets. Great location. Everything in walking distance.Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; great amenities included in the price!”
Reviews.Author: BranNewareAtl
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion certainly lives up to the great reviews. We had read them prior to booking and were not disappointed. The price is reasonable for everything that is included- nice breakfast with cook-to-order omelets, scramble, pancakes or french toast, stocked bar in the lobby available 24/7. They also have stocked decanters of gin, whiskey in the rooms. They really promote this "all-included" idea and they do it well. We had a nice 3rd floor room with a view of the Herengracht canal. The hotel and rooms are decorated in an art-deco style with influences of architect Frank Lloyd Wright. Great location and an 15-20 minute walk to Centraal station. There is also public transit stop nearby. The staff is very nice and professional; handled typical hotel requests like restaurant reservations, transportation to the airport well. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic hotel & even better service!”
Reviews.Author: STMcDonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for a birthday treat. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The hotel is in a great location within easy reach of Dam square and the museum district. The rooms were fully equipped with an espresso machine, access to an iPad and a free mini bar! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Booked and paid in advance. Bounced to a sub standard hotel elsewhere at check-in.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirepeeps
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£424 in advance for two rooms for a one night treat with friends. On arrival at 10.00 am we were glibly told that due to routine overbooking there were no rooms for us, and we would be staying in another hotel down the street. Appreciate this is not a review of the other hotel which was frankly like a travel-lodge with mood lighting and knocking shop air freshener so will stick to describing what we paid Â£424 for and didn't get. Number 3 hotel on trip advisor Canal side location Air conditioning Fully inclusive drinks in the lobby. (alternative didn't even have a mini-bar, never mind a free one) Free use of the in room entertainment Free wi-fi To top it all - whilst we were in the lobby they continued to check other guests from across the Atlantic. Did they refund the difference between what we paid and the â‚¬89 a night rooms we got? No. Disgusting. Don't bother booking. You'll be let down on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lovefrance35
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here. Brilliant and wished I could have stayed longer. The bath and shower are great and a v comfortable bed. Very helpful staff and the free bar is great. Only disappointment was breakfast kitchen in the basement. Shame to miss out on the view of the canal. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Laurennface
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Banks Mansion Hotel and can't fault it! Arrived just before 12pm which was 3 hours before check-in time, however, we were able to check in but had to wait for our room to be ready. We went for a walk around Amsterdam centre and returned just before 2pm to find our room was ready. We entered our room (number 9) and were amazed by the decor and gadgets! We had a cosy room with a TV, DVD player, Nespresso machine, free mini bar and 3 decanters containing Whiskey, Gin & Cognac. After our first night in Amsterdam we returned to the hotel and sat in 'The Living' which consisted of comfortable sofas, complimentary Internet access, snacks and a wide selection of spirits, beers and soft drinks. Next morning we went down for breakfast and helped ourselves to juice and continental breakfast items before discovering the chef who made omelettes, fried eggs, French toast and Dutch pancakes on request. Very friendly man and great at advising what to put on your pancakes! After booking this hotel we thought the price was too good to be true but it was genuinely an incredible place to stay! Planning on returning very soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and good location with Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: jtssea
Reviews.Content: The philosophy of the hotel is to be a home away from home with many included amenities. Included in the rate is a Full breakfast with made to order items, a refrigerator in your room filled with complimentary beverages (beer, soda ,water energy drinks)and a daily candy bar and tiny can of pringles, and the lobby had complimentary self serve beverages, beer, wine , cocktails and tiny bites. It was a nice touch. They could have had few more snacks in room or at lobby. The hotel is quiet and small. The rooms were smaller and vary in size and shape so ask to see your room first. Our first room was dark and had mold in the shower....we were moved to a room with larger Windows and a bit larger on size. It was very clean. The rooms with huge bathrooms had much smaller bedrooms and in my opinion were less desirable. If you can get a hood rate I would stay here as it is quiet and close to things. Big tip....if you like high end craft cocktails: a world renowned speakeasy named door 74 is right behind the hotel. Amazing. Ring the bell on the unmarked green door and pray you get a seat at the bar....or email them in the morining to request a reservation. Pricey but yet a bargain for what you get. Carve out 2 hrs for cocktails in a relaxing spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: failler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Amsterdam and, after many trial and error, I have found this hotel. Here is why I like this hotel; 1- centrally located: Close to the flower market, by walking distance to the Rijksmuseum, Dam square, etc..., 2- Fantastic staff, 3- very good breakfast and, 4- reasonable price. On top of this, bar is free. By all mean, I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommend to all!”
Reviews.Author: jodiewild
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing, we needed a peaceful base as we were running our first marathon and this place ticked all of the boxes. Really handy to be able to go to the bar and help yourself to tea, coffee, waters, juices, beers, wines and spirits etc etc. Also a great selection of cheese and salamis to sample. Breakfast was also amazing and the staff could not do enough to help and make our stay as wonderful as possible. Great location. Recommend fully and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Free Mini Bar!! What's not to love”
Reviews.Author: Spanish_Tutor
Reviews.Content: As the title of this review suggests the Banks Mansion has a free mini bar. This includes spirits, beer, wine, soft drinks, red bull, spirits, chocolate and pringles!! But there is more than just the mini bar to love. The staff were very friendly and made my stay a pleasure. The rooms are small but well furnished. Breakfast and an all day snacks bar are also highlights. It's small and has a boutique feel, it's also centrally located and opposite a lovely canal. The wifi is fast and works!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: melzerko
Reviews.Content: The view is great, it's centrally located, plus you get free alcohol- what's not to love! That was my thought when I made the reservation. When I got there the staff was great, little did I know how wonderful they would be. I hurt my back soon after arriving and was in awful pain, I mean really bad pain, and had to ask for a doctor. The staff was absolutely wonderful in helping me out. All of the staff asked after me. I'm sad to say I never got to see Amsterdam but if I had to stay in a hotel room for three days recovering, I couldn't have picked a nicer one! One day I will be back to actually see Amsterdam and I will stay in this hotel! Please pick this hotel- you won't regret it. Thank you again to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the kindness and location!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our stay at the Banks Mansion after reading all the good reviews. The location, closed to almost every spot especially the flower market was great. At arrival the receptionist was really kind and helpful; she recommend us a very nice Italian restaurant. Our room was great with an amazing view at the canal. The full service concept, drinks&appetizers, minibar, breakfast, fast WiFi connection and use of an iPad was really awesome!!! We will definitely stay here again, well done to the banks staff!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & dirty”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: Be warned: the outside of the hotel looks much nicer on the website than in person. The rooms are fairly small, dirt marks all over the walls and carpeting, and the hotel has a eclectic style. The included all you can drink was great, but the "appetizers" they supposedly have all day are nothing more than cheese and crackers. As for breakfast, make sure you get there around 8 am, because by 10 am it is completely picked over and they do not replenish. For the price of the hotel, we expected much more. This hotel is definitely overpriced. Also, the front desk staff had no idea how to ship something we bought to our home - which every other hotel in Europe was able to do without a problem. However, it is in a good location. The only redeeming quality of Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing for Price”
Reviews.Author: barbara C
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to some luxury after a rustic boating trip in Turkey and booked this at 269 Euros per night. The first room we were placed in was so dirty that I asked to be moved. The walls were scruffed, marks on an unclean rug, and it looked like the shower ir simething else in the bathroom above had recently flooded! We had to carry all are things to the lower floor room they gave, which I think might have been smaller. Slighter cleaner but not luxury that's for surer. It still could have used a thorough rug and wall wash. The staff, location and buffet breakfast were all great, but the overall experience was a big dissappointment for our 20 anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and the 'all inclusive' will save you a lot of money”
Reviews.Author: popjoy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit on the small side, but nicely furnished. The room we had was 'no smoking' but still smelled heavily of cigarette smoke - but it's Amsterdam and I'll bet most hotel rooms smell of 'cigarette' smoke. One side of the hotel faces a main road, the other faces a canal. It's at the outside edge of 'old Ametsrdam', but also that means it is excellently situated for the museum area. However, the real 'killer application' is the 'all inclusive' policy. A really good breakfast and afternoon snacks included. All soft drinks, coffees, teas, hot chocolates, spirits, water, wine and beers in the very nicely apointed self-service lounge-bar were all free. The entire contents of the room mini-bar (chocolate, beer, soft drinks, crisps, mixers) were all free. Decanters of gin, whisky, brandy in your room - all free. Internet free. Plenty of newspaper and magazines in the lounge area - free. Amsterdam is not a cheap city - but staying at the Banks tips the balance. The service was very good - umbrellas available for guests (it rained all the while we were there). Also, they were quite hapy to let us use their lounge service even after we had checked out (our flight wasn't until late afternoon). I may never return to Amsterdam, but if i were I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved their concept! Good location! Definitely one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: NiinaE
Reviews.Content: We were staying there for a weekend last May. Open bar was like a living room. We were enjoying ourselves and sometimes chatting with other guests. Nice staff who spoke excellent English. The other guests seemed to be mostly from the States and Canada. Everyone I talked to was pleased with the hotel. the room wasnÂ´t maybe so large but the steam shower made it up! You could walk to every main attractions. Good restaurants, nice neighborhood. I wasnÂ´t expecting much from Amsterdam but it sure was a nice surprise! Canal cruises were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam experience, warm atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: letsgogirl22
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, safe, clean, comfortable. Lovely reception/sitting area with drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “central, nevertheless quiet and friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RialtoBE
Reviews.Content: central, nevertheless quiet and friendly & helpful staff internet, snacks, bar, coffee etc. included tastefully furnished

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome place to stay. Open bar in the lobby and free mini bar in the room and breakfast downstairs in the kitchen. All included in the rate. You can also serve yourself cheeses, crackers and sausage while you drink in the lobby towards the evening. We came out of Los Angeles for the first time and loved it. We picked this hotel after reading many good reviews here on trip advisor. It was completely accurate. The hotel is in a great location. You can walk 10-15 mins in any direction and find all the best hot spots to visit and hang out at. Dam square, Liedseplein, Red light etc.. I'm sure you've read many reviews on here that more or less say the same thing. I just want to give back to trip advisor reviewers and people that might think about staying at The Banks. I read the reviews and picked this hotel and it was the best. Me and my fiance returned 4 months later because we loved amsterdam so much. Unfortunately we decided to try a new hotel "NH Grand Hotel Kranspolsky" (Dam Square). Not the best decision. I do recommend a bike tour and then rent bikes yourself. It's the best way to get around but do a bike tour first to learn the routes. Anyways, hope this helps. The Banks is great!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: A perfect location, great service and pleasant rooms make this an excellent choice. The only issue was the depth of the enclosed glass shower, which made it cumbersome to enter the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter51_10
Reviews.Content: The many great reviews are justified. We loved this beautiful hotel. Lovely Art Deco theme in public areas as well as the rooms. The breakfast was very good. It rained a lot during our long weekend but the hotel was conveniently located and we kept popping back for a quick coffee or something stronger in the evening. The various freebies (wifi, films, papers, sof and alcoholic drinks, nibbles) were a real treat. The staff were friendly and helpful. Couldn't really ask for more. Defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hughgoodheart
Reviews.Content: Well thought out art deco design, charming helpful staff, perfect location, and wonderful extras made the Banks Mansion a wonderful choice for our visit to the Grachtenfestival. My girlfriend says this is her first hotel with the kind of lighted vanity table a woman wants. The breakfasts were excellent, especially the made to order omelets. The self service bar in the lounge has on demand cappuccino, latte, or coffee all day long with an assortment of snacks. In the late afternoon there is a table with sausages, cheeses, fruit, and a memorable nut and fruit bread. Juices, soda, beer, and wine are available all day, there's a minibar in each room, and there's a small table with decanters of whiskey, vodka, and cognac. All of this is included in the price. Every major site in Amsterdam is within a 20 minute walk of the hotel; most are closer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for location and quality”
Reviews.Author: lnstorm
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL & SERVICE Can't fault it, the staff were lovely and always smiling and helpful. We were amazed with the complimentary drinks in the lobby and in your room, and the complimentary cheeseboard in the afternoon was great. Breakfast was really good with choice of eggs freshly cooked (fried/french toast/scrambled)! The location was perfect, no more than 15 mins walk to everywhere you would want to go. THE ROOM We booked less thank 24 hours before we travelled so we didn't get the best room choice but even though it was next to reception (number 7) and on the road side it was pretty quiet. The room was a nice size, not massive but plenty big enough. The bed was AMAZING with great pillows and a choice of others if you wanted to swap them!! ADVICE This is the reason I gave 4 points instead of 5... Nothing to do with the hotel itself but the only complaint would be that we booked the hotel's airport shuttle to the airport on the way back for 12.15 pm (15 Euros each which we didn't mind as we thought it would be less stressful than public transport... ha ha!) and it didn't turn up until 12.50pm. We weren't impressed and got to the airport in such a panic and missed all the seats together so travelled apart on the flight :( My advice would be to get the number 1 tram to Amsterdam Centraal station and then the trian to Schiphol from there. Costs less too! Real shame as we'd had a great holiday and it made us really stressed for the return home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: frenchroots0103
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with beautiful and convenient location. Delicious breakfast, complimentary drinks and light snacks in the evening are especially nice. Comfortable and inviting lounge/lobby. Staff friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: csmart
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel convenienty located near loads of shops, bars and restaurants. Included in the room price, the hotel provides complimentary wireless internet in all rooms - (you can also send emails direct from Outlook on your laptop, rather than having to use webmail like some hotels where there is no smtp) and in the lobby, complimentary inhouse movies, complimentary minibar - with softdrinks/water/1 can of beer/cognac/gin/whiskey, in the lobby there are complimentary drinks: water/softdrinks/spirits/wine/beer, and snacks: cheeses/salami/olives/raisin bread/etc, and complimentary buffet breakfast: continental (cereals, bread, cheeses, cold meats, pastries; and hot breakfast (bacon, sausages, eggs cooked to order). The staff are very attentive and pleasant. Room sizes are good, the bed is firm and a pillow menu is offered for four different types of pillows. The bathroom has a large rain shower. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Great location, chic decor, and a very friendly and helpful staff. We loved the self service bar and coffee machine in the beautifully decorated lobby. Even though our room was on the ground level overlooking the street, we had no street noise and actually enjoyed a little peole watching from our room. The most amazing thing...stupid me, completely forgot about $360 in cash in my room safe when we checked out. We left our luggage with the front desk staff to do some more sightseeing, and when we came back to claim it (still not realizing my error), the receptionist recognized me and said "room 8, right?" I wondered why she had remembered such a detail but the she told me that they had discovered the money in the safe after we left and proceeded to hand it over to me. I felt like a dolt but was VERY grateful for her honesty. I guess I'll blame it on the jet lag. Anyway, we would definitley use this hotel again if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: lucus82
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice lobby, staff was very helpful and attentive. Room was a good size for Europe. Great location. The lounge was comfortable to seat in and have complimentary drinks or snacks. We would recommend this hotel and we will stay at their other hotels in the future. Good value. Amsterdam is a great walking city, we like it very much. The only draw back was the amount of litter in the streets, water bottles, cigarettes, paper..

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: voguekitten
Reviews.Content: I was initially hesitant to book such a pricey hotel, however am so glad I did. Excellent friendly staff, deluxe breakfast every morning with eggs, omlets, bacon, sausage links, crepes, french toast (my favorite), fresh fruit, dozens of bread choices and croissants. The list goes on. We arrived very early, around 9:00am, but were immediately escorted to a room, which allowed us to rest and avoid any jet lag. Also, we were invited to have breakfast which is typically reserved for those who have paid a night's stay. I cannot say enough good things about Banks Mansion. We were welcomed by all of the staff, provided excellent referrals for dinner and much enjoyed the extras included in the room price. The self-serve happy hour with wine, cocktails and excellent cheeses and sausages was a treat. We rarely had to eat a meal out. The room was a bit small and not terribly lavish, however it was comfortable and the overall hotel experience was excellent. I do not know if our travels will bring us back to Amsterdam, but if so, we will stay at Banks Mansion and refer anyone we know to do so as well.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations....”
Reviews.Author: GranBeba
Reviews.Content: I had looked so forward to our stay and the Banks Mansion after reading all the positive reviews. I am afraid that the hotel did not meet my expectations. I did appreciate all the "included amenities" and think that is a nice concept. However we found the hotel to be a bit "rough around the edges". Three examples have had a major impact on my overall view of the hotel. First, the ice bucket in the room. The bucket has no liner or a plastic bag that prevents any kind of infection, etc. The bucket in our room had some clear liquid in the bottom when we arrived! Yuck! We assumed it was melted ice.... but who knows. I called the front desk and informed them of this and they apologized and said they would send a replacement. One never came. This spoke poorly of the guest service staff. The second thing is that the stairwell was literally quite dusty and needed a very thorough cleaning. I did not use the stairs but used the elevator but my husband did on several occasions and was agast at the dirt. And third, we asked for a recommendation for a nearby restaurant. We indicated that we wanted something close by, maybe Italian. I use a cane and didn't want to walk very far and said that closeness was more important than gourmet standing of a restaurant at that time. We were directed to go along the canal for some distance in the opposite direction of an Italian restaurant that was just moments away on the same street. Thankfully I had done some research on Trip Advisor and knew we could find something closer... So even thoogh the room was small we did enjoy the canal view. The room was really quite small and it was difficult to move around with our luggage. I did not feel we got our money's worth as the room was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Essexblogger
Reviews.Content: I knew nothing about this hotel before I arrived because I was taken there for a birthday break and had nothing to do with the trip booking. As expected because we arrived several hours before check-in the room was not available but we were able to get a coffee in the lounge then leave our bags while we went out for lunch. When we got back the room was ready and our bags were in the room. The room was a deluxe and very comfortable and clean. We were on the main road side of the Hotel and as I expect in a city it is obviously noisier than my home in the countryside, so if like me you are a light sleeper take earplugs for the first night, by the third night I was used to the traffic sounds and slept well without them. The hotel breakfasts are excellent and the breakfast room is clean,cool and smart. The free drinks in the Lounge are all named brands (I have seen a review saying they are all no-name brands) and the coffee from the machine is excellent. The lounge area by the reception has a very relaxed feel and we stopped for a coffee there before going to the room each time we returned to the hotel and a wine before going out for dinner. All the staff are very efficient, polite and helpful. We will definitely return to the hotel if we are in Amsterdam and I have already recommended it to friends who are considering a long weekend to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: shelbygirl315
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few luxury hotels in Amsterdam and this is by far the best. There are only 2 things I would have liked that it did not have. But even with that said, I LOVED this place and we will be back again and again. The location is great. You can walk every wear. It is a clean with the nicest beds and softest sheets. We had a wonderful view of the canal and large windows that opened to give that very romantic feel. The rooms are small (But if you have been to Amsterdam you know most places have smallish rooms due to space) and there is no bath tub, but the rain shower is great fun. Your room has a few varieties of free liquor in it which is always nice. The breakfast they offer is beyond amazing. Such a variety to chose from and the staff is so wonderful every morning, I loved coming down to them in the morning. Now, for the part that makes The Banks Hotel the best of the best. The lobby. Where do I begin? The hotel staff is wonderful, remembers your name and is friendly with out being intrusive. They offer 2 stocked fridges in a beautiful home like area that has a variety of liquor to chose from. One fridge is full of a variety of beers from all over the world as well as small bottles of wines. The other fridge is full of cold fruit juices, teas, soda's. They have a cappuccino machine that is super easy to use as well as hot flavored coffee's and hot teas. The offer cookies, crackers, cheese, fruit, chips etc. All are free and there 24/7 for when ever you wish it. Every evening they have wonderful warm appetizers that are delightful after a day out. I personally loved the lobby and felt so at home there. We would go out all day and come home around 3 or 4. My husband would go up to the room to nap and I would go to the lobby with a good book, get a cappuccino and a munchies or two, sit by the fire and read for hours. While we were there they had a rock band staying for a few days who were playing in the area. They had security with them and fans who wanted to see them, but since you can not get into the hotel unless you are a guest, it was peaceful and quite yet exciting to be around all that. The bottom line is this place is amazing. Can not say enough great things. I am a person who likes the finer things in life and I don't mind paying for them as long as they are what they say they are.This place will make you feel like you are a rock star....!

Reviews.Title: “totally recommends this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: proudberkeleymom
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 4 nights and we thought this hotel was awesome. the room is on the small side but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom big. location is perfect - we walked everywhere - museums, shopping.. the staff members were great - breakfast is also included as well as drinks in the hotel room and downstairs at the lobby are.. soda, water, alcohol.. will definitely stay at this hotel again. we totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikedespo
Reviews.Content: All the reviews I read about the Banks Mansion were positive and I understand why. The hotel was fantastic. The "concept" is unique in that they offer an open bar (which is well stocked with licquor, sodas, waters, etc.) that's in the lobby and that guests can access themselves without any charge. It's part of the hotel/room price. And it's available 24/7. Newspapers in both English and Dutch available for guests in the main lobby along with two computers which were for guests to access without any charge. Free wireless internet as well is available through out the hotel and rooms. Chairs and sofas with a fire place all in the main lobby. The rooms themselves are comfortable, clean, with flat screen TVs, and large bathrooms. Bed is comfortable. There was free bottles of cognac, whiskey,a dn other alcohol in your room that costs nothing extra. A mini bar is also fully stocked in your room and free of charge (part of your room rate). Comfortable robes and slippers. One minor problem. When we checked in, we paid in advance for a room with a view of the canal. We were given a nice room but no canal view (which cost extra). I mentioned this to the front desk, they saw my copy of the reservation, and they looked in their system. They saw the error and admitted it was there fault but no canal room was available. They offered a discount on the room which is what they should have done. They advised if I wanted ... to call the next morning and they would switch us to a canal room for the remainder of the stay. I took them up on that and called the next day. The hotel offered to give us a canal view in an upgraded room with extra perks in order to not have to offer a discount for the first night foul up. That was reasonable and I took them up on that offer. All in all ... mistakes happen and the hotel acknowledged it and did everything they should to rectify it without any attitude. Breakfast is served in the morning and offers a wide variety of food....again a plus. No fitness center or real restaurant in hotel, but the hotel was just such a great place that these negatives don't even rank against the hotel. One block walk to the flower market and two block walk to canal boat tours. Easy walk to train station, but don't walk it with luggage people ... pay for a cab. It's not that close to the train station and don't struggle on the cobblestone streets with the madness of bicycles and tons of people on the street. The hotel is in a great location, close to everything, but also in a good location in that the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam eases up at night near it so its not loud. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “great service but living area a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Stanley2008
Reviews.Content: we arrived early at about 7am and it was great that they had a room avaliable for us without charging us extra. however the room was quite small. the room was pretty dark even with all the lights on. the room felt like it needed a lick of paint. however the bathroom was excellent. it is very big almost as big as the living quarters! big tub and a shower. floor tiles looked new with no cracks. bathroom looked new and very bright. such a contrast against the living area breakfast, wifi and minibar were included. breakfast was ok. not a great selection with other breakfast deals we had before. wifi was speedy and worked unlike some other hotels we stayed in. minibar was good. nice selection of drinks including whisky and gin and tonic! also in lobby you can have free drinks and snacks! looked very cosy and even had a fireplace! staff were very friendly and helpful. during our 4 nights in holland we found the dutch people very friendly and helpful and have excellent english! the location is a bit away from red light district and the dam. the dam is walkable or you can get the excellent tram service. just buy tickets on board and they give you change! the hotel is very close to the flower market and is nearer the van gogh museum. the hotel is in a quieter part of town. taxi from amsterdam central station to hotel cost 15euros but from hotel to rail station 9euros (weird) without the breakfast, wifi, minibar and excellent staff we would give this a 3 as the living room was disappointing or average i guess. we were expecting a larger brighter living area especially after reading the positive reviews and staying in other 4 star hotels. however a good 4

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: AussieGreggie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated a 5 Star and deservedly so. Although the rooms were your basic hotel room the bed was extremely comfortable. You have the pillow choice available to you. The staff at reception are very helpful and friendly. The room rate has an 'all inclusive' package including a free mini bar. Don't get to excited the fridge was small and had only one beer, soft drinks and water, no wine but they did have 3 large decanters with Gin, Whiskey and I think the other was Brandy. That is if you are into that. The foyer down stairs has a lounge which has an open bar at no cost. The only issue we had here was the fridge was not always re-stocked when getting low and the bar area was always messy. It needed someone to keep an eye out and keep it clean. The breakfast downstairs was sufficient to start your day. They do not have a restaurant for lunch or dinner but you can walk to many restuarants close by.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: RunninAllOver
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion is in a great location for discovering Amsterdam, making most of the city easily accessable by walking. The lobby provided a great area to relax after seeing the city, good internet access with snacks and beverages included. There were some signs of wear and tear in the room (carpet & footstool). I was not a fan of open decanter bottles of liquor in the room, I would not touch those. Front desk staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: Katiek14
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night mid-August for a business meeting. Fantastic location, and absolutely excellent service. Positives: Full service hotel - free mini bar, drinks in foyer, breakfast included in price etc. Service - excellent. Friendly and really knowledgeable staff Minibar - nicely stocked Room - large room, big bed, nice bathroom, desk area for working Breakfast - selection of cold stuff and option to have eggs cooked however you'd like Bed - comfy and selection of pillows Negatives: (if I had to pick something) Temperature - the hotel is very warm - BUT the air con in room is brill and easy to use TV - not near the bed, so you can't watch from there. BUT own armchair for viewing. All in, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The all-inclusive hotel”
Reviews.Author: tillyhorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room for 3 nights in early August 2011.
