The hotel is centrally located, right around the corner from Rembrandtsplein and about 10 minutes from the Red Light District and The Dam. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful; all speak fluent English. The room itself was a generous size and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and a 'pillow menu' is offered allowing four different kinds of pillows to be ordered. 3 movie channels and an adult channel were availble on the TV. Decanters of gin, cognac and whiskey were avilable in the room as well as soft drinks/water in the mini-bar. Air-conditioning and a safe were also present in the room. The bathroom was very large with a full-size bath, separate walk-in shower (enough room for two easily), toilet and basin. Complimentary toiletries were present. As the hotel is all-inclusive all items from the mini-bar in each room as well as the communal, self-service bar in the foyer are free meaning trips to the supermarket are rather redundant. Snacks are also provided throughout the day. The breakfast was impressive with toast, bacon, sausages, cold meats, rolls etc... provided. Pancakes, scrambled/fried eggs and omelettes were cooked freshly to order. The level of service is unprecedented: a) the hotel staff make excellent restaurant recommendations; b) on my birthday the management arranged for a couple of complimenary gifts to be delivered to our room; c) on our last night in the hotel when I fell ill, the night staff arranged for a doctor to call my partner. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, good location but ask for a bath in advance if you want one.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights. There was a bit of a kerfuffle at the beggining because there was no bath in our room. Be aware that most rooms do not have a bath in them. As a result we were upgraded to a junior suite, which was really nice even if it didn't have the best view. The Hotel is clean, the beds are good, the location is ideal and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is fee Wifi and access to PCs in the lobby. I wouldn't say that the place was charming but there is nothing offensive about it either. Value for money I would say that we got a great deal because we were upgraded but otherwise I would say its OK.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Retired098
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days after our cruise in Amsterdam and stayed at the banks Mansion which overlooks the Herengraht or Grand Canal. We arrived directly from the cruise ship and were told that our room was ready. Although a single room it was very large and consisted of 3 balconies. The breakfast prepared by sam, the chef, was an excellent adition to the excellent variety of foods already there. His Dutch pancakes are fantastic. We have been to 56 countries and this is the first hotel where all beverages of any kind are included all day long, whether in your room or in the library in the lobby. The location is excellent to walk to the Flower market, the pedestrian street or even take a canal cruise. The staff, especially Ester, were a great help showing us places on the map that we may be interested in going. Their room prices are very competitive for Amsterdam. Every evening there are snacks in the lobby and the area in which the hotel is located was so well situated that we walked day and night and felt very comfortable. They even offer free high speed internet service which allowed us to keep in touch at home, but also print out our boarding passes. With double doors to the balconies, it was very quiet at night. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “small, fine, excellent, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jubilo49
Reviews.Content: We spent "Queens Birthday" at the Mansion and enjoyed the very competent, friendly, cheerful and helpful staff providing us with personalized service from reservation to check-out. Lobby with a good selection of beverages at guests' discretion make a stay even more attractive. Good breakfast buffet in a surprisingly nicely arranged basement. Most of the rooms are furnished and decorated with taste, but clearly undersized. A certain lack of continuous maintenance can be felt. Furthermore, we find it a pity the hotel cannot afford a glass for the teethbrush, instead it is an ugly, cheap oneway plastic cup - but that is a detail.

Reviews.Title: “One of our greatest hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: want-to-go-rtw
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Banks Mansion before we joined a 21 day river cruise. This is one of our best hotel experiences for several reasons but the main one would be the super friendly staff that really made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived with our mountains of luggage. The concept of mini bar, lounge drinks, breakfast etc all included is sensational, nothing better than being told no extra charges when checking out. The lounge is a great place to have a drink after all day touring/shopping, and a great place to meet other guests staying at the hotel. Our rooms were a good size and bathrooms excellent. Location is good, easy walking to just about every site, we also caught the tram when feeling a little lazy, there is a tram stop just across the road from the hotel. If you can't decide where to stay in Amsterdam book the Banks, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sae56
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel! Helpful staff, excellent location, clean, comfortable rooms and all-inclusive concept. Our room was large for a city centre hotel with a superb bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice and eggs freshly cooked while you wait (for just a minute!). We will certainly return to this hotel next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff, amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Tamarah23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after arriving early in the morning from Australia on a very long flight. The staff were amazing and allowed us to check in early and have breakfast. The breakfast is all inclusive and the best breakfast I have had so far on our travels. We stayed In a canal view room and it was very nice and clean. Would stay here again and will recommend to anyone I know who is going to Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WATravel65
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip advisor and all the reports about it are true. Ths staff at the front reception were very helpful with everything and spaek good English. The free mini bar in your room, which includes Gin,Scotch and Congac to the free drinks in the evening down in the lounge. This hotel has everything for you to enjoy your trip. The breakfast is also of a great standard with heaps of choices. If you stay here then ask for a canal room as it gives you more space and you even get a coffee machine to. Would recommend this hotel if you are staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming establishment”
Reviews.Author: ritarita44
Reviews.Content: Lovely art-deco hotel, well located, excellent accommodations and facilities, efficient and friendly staff. One very minor irritant - perhaps guests could be given the option of the free bar in the room, or tea and coffee making faciities in the room. The lobby bar is delightful. Breakfasts very good.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: NeilJGlover
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew our stay would be an excellent one. Hotel staff so friendly and welcoming. Concept of all inclusive drinks and snacks in the lobby is brilliant as with the mini bar in the room. Breakfast selection was and quality was superb. Neil Glover & Tiffany Sherratt When staying in Amsterdam again we will consider nowhere else - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and concept!”
Reviews.Author: philc128
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights. Hotel is in a fantastic location close to all the sites. The hotel itself is immaculate offering everything you could want. The staff is extremely friendly and always available for advice on tours and restaurant recommendations. The lobby offers a coffee bar with sodas, waters, teas, etc. and is available 24/7. Loved returning to this oasis after a long hot day of touring. The room was nice, a little on the small side but standard for a European hotel. Bed was very comfortable, free wi-fi connection and free mini bar with waters, sodas, snacks and as mentioned in the other reviews, free cognac, gin and liquor. Bathroom was spotless with a rainshower and hand-held massager. My only comment regarding the bathroom is a CAUTION. The hot water is extremely HOT so be careful or you can easily scald yourself. There should be a warning posted in each room. The kitchen breakfast, included in the rate was wonderful. Cheery staff willing to make any type of omelette, pancakes, etc. All types of cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, juices, etc. are available. Wonderful concept! I will definitely return to the Banks Mansion whenever I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Love the inclusive food & booze!”
Reviews.Author: kristen0930
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel in an old historic bank. The location is convenient, and the hotel has a wonderful sitting area with a fireplace and computers/printers, where you can enjoy the included wine/beer/spirits and the afternoon charcuterie platter. The room was nice, with comfy beds and squishy bedding. they also ofter an assortment of pillows to suit your needs. There is a mini bar in the room, with a fridge full of drinks (pop, red bull, water, tonic) and treats (Pringles, Toblerone), and 3 crystal decanters with gin, whiskey and cognac. They restock everything each day. The bathroom is massive, with a big soaker tub (complete with bath salts), and a separate shower. The shower had great water pressure. The free breakfast in the morning was amazing. You can get omelets, scrambled or fried eggs, dutch pancakes or french toast. Plus they have assorted cereals, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, bacon and sausages. Coffee, espresso, cappuccinos, hot chocolate, juices and water are also available. The staff was pleasant, and the housekeepers were great - never bugged us when our Do Not Disturb was posted until 11am, yet always had a clean room when we returned home in the afternoon. I would definitely recommend Banks Mansion to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here”
Reviews.Author: MeganDMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you would expect for the price - exceptional service, great location, beautiful decor. Situated on the Herengracht (canal) and on a tram route it was very easy to get around Amsterdam from here. The thing that makes the Banks extraordinary is that everything is included in the price, and I mean everything - breakfast, minibar, internet (wifi and 2 computers) and "The Living" with comfy chairs, gas fire, coffee machine, and in the evening an open bar and a range of snacks. Staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. We felt so at home here we didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyAndLearn
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending one night in this hotel in route back to Boston. It is a beautiful, well managed property with wonderful amenties (a 24 hour coffee/tea/wine/beer/liquor in the lobby and carafes of gin/scotch and cognac in rooms). The breakfast was also terrific.This hotel is very clean and well located to all of the major sights, I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: IanMelMall
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful and have a true love and knowledge of the city. The hotel rooms are a good size by European standards. The breakfast is fantastic, especially because of the chef who is wonderful, warm and inviting with a sole objective of keeping his guests happy. The open bar downstairs provides a warm and welcoming environment where guests can meet and share their tales of Amsterdam, providing great tips for those who have just arrived. We loved it and when we're next in Amsterdam will be staying there - absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but greatness from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScumdogLuvsTraveling
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more happy with this excellent hotel. This is one of those few times I could write a long post commenting how wonderful my stay was, but instead I'll just state the main points. Check-in was quick and easy, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I got a room facing the canal and had no problem with street noise, since they have double windows. The room was large, comfy and clean, as was the bed. The bathroom was also good size and had one of those showers you just don't want to get out of. There was a flat screen TV, well stocked mini bar that was refilled daily, decanters of Whiskey, Gin and Cognac, iron with board, digital safe and many other room amenities. However, its the complimentary services of this hotel that really helps pull it all together. The breakfast offers a wide selection of everything from cereals, meats & cheeses, fresh fruit, baked goods and made on the spot meals. All was very good, but I loved the Dutch pancakes with jam. Up in the lobby they have an open bar which offer alcohol to water and later in the day a spread of several meats and cheeses are brought out, which again are all complimentary. The lobby is quite and relaxing with free computer access, several comfortable seats, reading material and a fireplace. It was a nice place to relax/read when the weather turned foul or I was just tired after a long day of sight-seeing. Now the location. This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of many of the sights, but is far enough away from the seedier areas. Though, its next to Rembrandt Square, which offer many places for your eating, drinking and smoking needs. The Three Sisters Grand Pub is located there, along with Smokeys Juice Bar. In short, as long as I can get a room I will never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam, but the Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Winnerpegescapee
Reviews.Content: Were a little hesitant to go to an "all inclusive" hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel was excellent and friendly, having acess to free internet, full breakfast (omlettes, fresh croisants etc) was a great way to start the day. The open bar was nice to come back too and relax before heading out again and then nightcaps. The higher price was easily offset by the location (near everything - walked everywhere) the internet, drinks and food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, Warm Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wizard6818
Reviews.Content: In the center of most the places we wanted to go to. Small hotel but very nicely appointed. Lobby area (Living Room) very comfrontable with free drinks (Wine, Beer, Alchohol, Mixers, Bailey's, Expresso, Capuccino) and some snacks (mix, nuts, chocolate). Staff very friendly and helpful. Can buy Van Gogh tixs at front desk (saves time). Breakfast in lower level is excellent, try the Dutch Pancakes (Crepes). Many very nice restaunts a 2 minute walk to Rembrant's Square with plenty of street entertainment and great people watching. Had a canal view jr suite that had a opening window and great canal view. A/C worked great and A/C fan noise helped to drown out bust street noise. If you want to rent Bike call and reserve in advance as they book up. Heiniken experience was excellent, included is a sort of ride simulator (you get brewed) complete with bubbles, splashes, and drops. Excellent value. No pool or spa. Great high rain effect shower and comfrontable bed and covers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great concept”
Reviews.Author: davin
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Banks Mansion May 26-30th.Terrific location and we were able to walk everywhere.Amsterdam is very easy to get around and the hotel is centrally located to all the major tourist attractions,eg museums,Anne Frank House,canal cruises,Jewish quarter etc.Travelling with my inlaws who had limited mobility the hotel was excellent as we left them in the lobby/living room where they could drink coffee/beer/wine to their hearts content while my wife and i explored the city.The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful in suggesting restaurants nearby.Nice little touches with appetizers at 4 and snacks during the day.Great to wander around come back for a drink,freshen up and explore some more.Highly recommend the hotel for future visits.Oh yes free computer was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Dixie999
Reviews.Content: Great room, well furnished, choice of pillows, mini bar always restocked, very friendly staff always willing to help. Good comfy seating area in Living , snacks , coffee and anything stronger you want to drink. Watch out for the bikes when walking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: csebec
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. Yes, it is higher priced than others but the service, rooms, breakfast, alcohol and apps, "home" feeling, location.....I could go on and on. The service was really the best. Everyone was so nice and helpful. I asked them to get us a birthday cake for our friend who was traveling with us and they came back with the most beautiful and delicous cake from the best bakery in Amsterdam. They gave us a tray with plates, knife etc. Then after getting home, I realized we had left one of our shopping bags of souveniers in the lobby. I sent them a email asking about it and they had it and shipped it to us in the USA.. I had to sign an authorization for them to charge my cc but I completely trusted that they would box my items safely and they all arrived in perfect shape. The breakfast was great- chef to cook to order omletes, eggs, pancakes and typical European buffet items. Free mini bar and alcohol in room and a complete bar and snacks in the lobby. Great mingling place with your travel partners or to meet others. LOVE LOVE LOVE Banks Mansion!

Reviews.Title: “extremely good service”
Reviews.Author: yumyumdiner
Reviews.Content: We spent an extremely comfortable weekend at Banks Mansion. The reception staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful. The rooms we had as a party of 6 were differing in size despite being the same price. The two rooms on the upper floors were light and airy but the room on the reception floor was quite dark and small which wasn't helped by the fact it was at street level by the tram line so the blind could not be opened. This however did not spoil the 'banks mansion' experience. The open living area and bar are an excellent concept, the bathrooms with their spa showers were a dream, the breakfast room with its 'own chef' who freshly cooked omeletes, pancakes etc an inspired idea. Despite its slightly higher than average price, we felt that it was good value for money.The hotel is in an excellent central location for sightseeing, shopping and local bars. We would recommend this hotel to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: sas014
Reviews.Content: Great service and location. Short walk to shopping and restaurants. Nice rooms. If we were going back to amsterdam, we would have stayed here again. Free drinks in the room and in the livingroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Concept Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiraBeauty
Reviews.Content: When in Amsterdam, brighten your stay in the grey & windy town by staying at Banks Mansion. In walking distance from everything & a short tram ride from the major museums, this is a travelers haven. The gratis bar & snacks, the smiling service & great restaurant recommendations make it so easy! A wonderful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovif
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a European vacation which included Amsterdam. We stayed for 3 nights at the Banks Mansion. It is a lovely hotel - very well located, helpful staff, great "living room" lobby. We particularly enjoyed the open bar and late afternoon snacks in the lobby. The weather while we were in Amsterdam was not particularly nice (chilly, overcast and often rainy), so we didn't hang around outside or just randomly stroll as much as we would have liked. As such, we spent more time in the hotel than we did in Paris, for example. The lobby area with the beverages and food was great for this. My husband loved sitting near the fire place, sipping wine and reading. The breakfast buffet was nice - I've been in hotels that had more and less in the breakfast buffet category. This was in the middle and was certainly adequate. The computers in the lobby were very helpful in terms of checking e-mails, etc. The only comment that I would make is that the room is rather small or more specifically lacking storage. We had a superior, canel view room. It wa very nice and comfortable and quiet. The only criticism I have about the room is related to storage space. The wardrobe is not that large and there are no drawers in other pieces of furniture. My husband and I left half of our stuff in the suitcase because we weren't going to use it due to the weather - if we had needed to unpack everything we would not have had anywhere to put it however. The bathroom was great - particularly the very large shower stall. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and we were very pleased with our selection. I would certainly recommend it to other travelers looking for a very nice, well located hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, amenities and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: frank4000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Banks Mansion for six nights. The hotel reception staff were always helpful and pleasant. They gave excellent suggestions for local restaurants for dinner. The amenities such as free mini-bar in room as well as drinks in the lobby made the hotel atmosphere very welcoming. Free wireless internet was also a bonus. Breakfast was more than adequate. The room beds gave us the most comfortable sleep we have ever had in any hotel in the world. No hesitation in highly recommending this hotel. We had a most memorable time in Amsterdam and Banks Mansion was a significant factor.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lifeisforlearning
Reviews.Content: Not the most inexpensive option, but worth it. Look for a deal here or on the hotel's web site. Located mid-way between, and easily walkable to, the historic center and to the museum district, close to the flower market and the hopping Rembrandtplein, and a 15 minute walk to the equally hopping Leidseplein and the restaurant district. Lovely and clever furniture, multiple languages on multiple HDTV channels, comfortable bed, and a huge bathroom with an extra-large tub (the Dutch are now the tallest people, on average, in the world). Only concern was some mold at the base of the shower stall. Sumptuous buffet breakfast (but watch out for the cut fruit, I'm afraid). Have the crepe-like pancakes,a Dutch specialty. In addition to breakfast, all-day coffee and drinks are included, and heavy hors d'oevres in late afternoon. The staff was great. I bought a large bouquet of tulips (so cheap at the flower market) to put in my room, and they gave me a large vase to put them in. I accidentally left my prescription sunglasses, but when I called in a panic a few hours later, they said, no worries, we've got them and will mail them to you in the US (for a fee). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: zzzusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at this hotel and it was terrific. The location was perfect. The rooms were very comfortable with great beds and terrific bathrooms. The breakfast was great with a much larger choice than many hotels. The man who cooks was always very nice and food was prepared perfectly. Every staff member works very hard and is always pleasant even when they are being treated badly. My room was on the side of the hotel with the busy street and trams. I never heard any noise when the window was closed.

Reviews.Title: “A Split Decision”
Reviews.Author: Susan10536
Reviews.Content: After six nights at Banks Mansion I have to say itâ€™s a split decision. Iâ€™ve just read a number of the good reviews here on TripAdvisor and agree with much of it. That said, I read most of the below average reviews and agree with almost all of them. First, not trying to be mean but this is not by any stretch of the imagination a four star hotel. The size of the rooms alone make it three star tops. Donâ€™t be overly swayed by â€œfreeâ€� drinks and minibar. Theyâ€™re included in the room price and the room price is slightly high for what they offer. The positive: A very good location. Decent restaurants nearby. Walking distance to almost everything, minibar items, wine and liquor is included in the room cost, most of the staff is very very nice and helpful, OK beds and bedding, news available on the TV in several languages, free computer use if needed, complimentary map of Amsterdam, light blocking curtains and sound-reducing windows. A reasonable offering of breakfast items. Plenty of hot water. Safe in the room. Comfy lobby with ample seating, magazines and newspapers. All in all, OK. The negative: Small rooms (even for Europe) and I really know what Iâ€™m talking about after nearly four decades of travel. The carpets and furniture show considerable wear. It has only one very slow elevator and filthy stairwells as an alternative - an issue at a totally full hotel. A tiny wardrobe closet with three hangars provided. Two shelves to unpack clothes. Barely room for a couple to store two suitcases and still move in the room. "Room Service" is practically non-existent. They serve three things. The lighting in the rooms is poor unless itâ€™s daylight and the curtains are open. OK, so you get free wine and liquor â€“ but we don't drink hard liquor and who wants to drink from open heaven knows-what-bottles of liquor in your room? The wine offered downstairs is free but very cheap quality. Our room was never properly cleaned. Not vacuumed once that we could see. My husband had to ask that it be dusted on the fifth day. I wrote my name in the dust on the desk! Likewise the bathroom sink was cleaned but never the floor. I left something on the bathroom floor to monitor if it would be cleaned up and as each day passed, dirtier and dirtier â€“ the halls as well. I'm sorry to be critical but this is true. The VERY negative: Be careful! Their booking policy as was experienced by a friend there at the same time who came from another city to meet us. She booked four nights at their â€œbest buyâ€� price (a 20 euro per night reduction for paying in advance) but had to change her plans before coming. No changes they said. Once there, it was obvious that they could rent the room for the two nights she wouldnâ€™t be there. We all spoke with ***, one of the managers who was hostile and rude. It seemed to be a simple request: charge for the two nights she would be there with the 20 euro discount per night re-added to the room charges and then rent the other nights to someone else â€“ hotel loses nothing. Still, the very nasty "duty manager" said no. She charged my friend for all four nights and rented the room again to others the last two nights. Double profit for Banks Mansion. I was surprised by their outright greed and unwillingness to be accommodating when they would suffer no loss at all. There is just no need for this. We would have understood no deals if they could not rent the rooms - but they did!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: JoeandSandra
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Banks mansion our last was for our 5th wedding anniversary 2 years ago so another anniversary stay to coincide with Queens Day was always on the cards. We booked a canal view room again and we were allocated at corner view on 3rd floor, this room was larger than the room allocated on our last visit, it was clean bright and well maintained. We arrived at 9am on 29th April and were immediately given access to our room by the friendly and efficient reception staff, we were then allowed to have breakfast as it finishes at 1030 (11am on Sunday). You are given an excellent cooked breakfast which is another reason we returned here. The minibar was reasonably stocked and replenished daily, as were the drinks decanters. The lounge at reception is like a living room it has a well stocked beer fridge although only Beck's, which was ok and a disgusting concoction called Hoegaarden Blond on offer, honestly it's like drinking partially diluted scouring powder, actually thats doing Ajax or Vim a disservice this stuff is that vile. An abundance of various wines, spirits and soft drinks is also available so no complaints from me apart from that rotten beer. Nibbles and cheese boards are occasionally offered as well. Another bonus is the 2 desktop PC's in the lounge giving free internet and printer services. Queens Day was brilliant yet again, its one giant carnival with everyone dressed in orange. The streets and canl sides were packed by 2pm as 800,000 visitors walked into the centre. Its a long day but the weather was good and it's great watching the various boats on the canals, some bedecked in variety of colours and others simply for partying, it's nigh on impossible to get on a party boat though. We were better prepared this time and made sure we had orange tops etc this time, although the hotel did give you a T shirt as well. On 1st May we had our anniversary meal at the Saturnino Italian restaurant just around the corner from the hotel, its turn right as you leave the hotel, cross the road and turn immediately left at the travel agent/KLM office. The restaurant is about 300 yards along this street on the right. We can confirm that it's good reviews on Tripadvisor are well deserved. The hotel is mostly used by US, Canada and UK guests so English is widely spoken and everyone is very friendly, we met some very nice people. Just like previous reviewer MJBNY, whom I believe we had the pleasure of meeting, we would not consider anywhere else for a return to this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “So repulsive, I could not stay the night! Shocking price for such a place.”
Reviews.Author: CascadianP
Reviews.Content: I am honestly shocked by all of the positive assessments of this place. We ended up here because a change in onward travel plans required us to stay in Amsterdam an extra day, and after much searching, were told this was the only hotel room available in the city that night. For $450, we were told we would have a "deluxe" room, quietly situated away from the street. Upon arriving at the noisy intersection where the hotel is located (on a busy cross street with a tram line and many motorists on one side, the canal on the other) we were glad at least we would have quiet. The staff were pleasant but made a great big deal about the hotel's complimentary bar... great, we thought, until we saw what was on offer: in the room sat a bedside tray of spirits that had been decanted into large bottles labeled only with little plastic signs "whiskey" "gin", etc, as though one whiskey is equal to any other! Clearly the "free booze" is an attraction to many, as the lobby was full of sloshy pickled-looking folks sitting in the cheap and chaotically decorated lounge, imbibing liberally in the no-name booze. The room itself was barely bigger than the bed and reeked of smoke that had been doused in vast quantities of perfumed room-spray. The one tiny window opened onto a blast of noise from the street behind the hotel. The bathroom was as big as the room, but what good is that? Every surface was gross: vinyl wallpaper, "wood" laminate on all the furnishings, loud patterned carpets... everything the epitome of the cheapest hotel decor. After having spent three lovely days in a bright, airy and tastefully decorated canal house for half the price, the strange alchoholic-zombie funeral home feeling of this place was too much to bear. I decided to go on to Antwerp rather than spend another minute there, and left my travel companion who had to catch a train out of Amsterdam the next day, requiring him to stay. Honestly, if you have any modicum of taste or standards, there are many exquisite places to stay in Amsterdam. This is, appallingly, considering the price, NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “What a FANTASTIC PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: dwbjd
Reviews.Content: OK. So, I read all the reviews and did a lot of research on hotels in Amsterdam, and couldn't be happier I decided to do my homework. In the end we didn't have to settle for something that would have made our stay any less enjoyable in this beautiful city. Here was my basic list: Good Size Clean Room Clean Bathroom Air Conditioning Smoker Friendly Located in the middle of everything Free Wi-Fi in the room Let me just say after doing countless research hours into hotels in Amsterdam that this was one of less than 5 that met all these needs. Trust me. The hard match for us was the Smoker Friendly part with nice amenities. For people interested in something away from a smoking environment this is for you as well, as the top floor is set aside for smokers, so it in no way appears smoking friendly or hinders others stay. Brilliant. Aside from that point, I couldn't say more about the staff and housekeeping. Both are very friendly, pleasant to stay with and accommodating in every way. For example, after one day of not being out of the room for the housekeeping's usual routine, the staff adjusted their schedule seamlessly without asking as to when would be the appropriate time to do their work. I thought this was a really great touch as I had to say nothing. This gave us the comfort of not worrying if we were in the housekeeping's way. As well the reloading of the mini-bar came with intelligence as we preferred some of the free beverages they had in the lobby as opposed to what was available. Once again, we didn't have to ask, they just made the adjustment. TOP NOTCH! Anytime we needed help as to the location of something or just general assistance the staff could not be more helpful and friendly. In particular Anna-Loush was fabulous(i apologize for the spelling) as she seemed to overlap the times we were in and out or answered the phone anytime I called. Here are some bonuses that I found overlooked in previous reviews: The ice from the ice machine---AWESOME. I think Americans could appreciate this as it is very similar to Sonic Ice! Yes. Sorry if this makes no sense. The bathroom is HUGE for a hotel, especially one in this small cramped city. Separate Rain Shower with plenty of pressure and Separate Dutch People height tub. For 6'+ er's! An absolutely beautiful bathroom with endless hot water. We tried, trust me. Adjustable Air Conditioning. We were there this month in May and the temp did change enough from cold to hot that this feature was highly appreciated. Also had an opening window to get fresh air when needed. ;) All the inclusive drinks! Whether in the room or downstairs you have free every kind of drink. Decent liquor, sodas, coffee, juice, etc. This stuff adds up in Dam. A 7oz coke at 1.50-2.50 Euro at an average restaurant vs. free all day. We just stocked up before we left each day or hopped in for some. Well you get the picture. Although we were strictly on a 420 tour with sites mixed in, the free-liquor could have really added up had we even wanted or could handle a sip. Looked tempting everyday. Big Plus for some of you! Free REAL FULL breakfast every morning or Delivered every morning for 5E. Enough said. Of course this has everything great others have mentioned: IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING- Museums, Coffee Shops, Dam Square, Shopping, Anne Frank, Bike Rental, Canal Trips. We literally walked to everything. Clean, well-maintained. Professionally staffed from head to toe. The all inclusive home-vibe. Free Wi-Fi. Saw a complaint about that on Trip Advisor as if they baited one into paying for internet. It's Included! Bottom Line, there is a reason this hotel is ranked in the top 8 in Amsterdam. It lives up to and then some of what it presents as its product. Would never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. WORTH EVERY PENNY!

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: holidaybod
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome from the super staff who made our visit most enjoyable. The room was excellent and the facilities made it a very very comfortable stay. Even when our flight was delayed we were welcomed back to the hotel, even though we had checked out, and offered the facilities until we were ready to leave a lot later than anticipated. We would highly reccommend this hotel. Thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “It really is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mjbNY
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here based on Trip Advisor reviews. Glad I did. It was a great place. Perfectly located - we walked to everything. Did not need to take a tram or taxi anywhere. The room was comfortable and had ample space for 2 people. The breakfast was lovely and provided enough variety for our week-long stay. The staff was great. Very helpful and friendly and spoke perfect English. The Living was definitely a high point. Great place to relax after a day of sightseeing or make a quick pit stop during the day. Being able to grab something to drink (all sorts of coffee, water, juice, soda, beer, wine, harder stuff) whenever I wanted to, while may be a small reason to select a hotel, really added to the over all experience of staying there. It was also fun to meet other people staying at the hotel and chat with them. If I ever go back to Amsterdam, and I hope I do, this will be the only place I will even consider staying.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Travelyesplease83
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay here based on tripadvisor reviews and I have to say that the hotel exceded all expectations. Welcoming staff on arrival, we had arrived early but there was no problem leaving our bags in storage and using the facilities in the lobby to have a welcoming drink and nibbles. Our Bedroom was perfect ( we booked a Deluxe Room) and the complimentary mini bar in the room was welcoming after a hard days shopping/sightseeing. We really enjoyed breakfast too,there was plenty of choice in both hot and cold options and we found the gentleman working there very pleasant. Also the location of the hotel is key to getting around to all the sights that the city has to offer. There are some great restaurants near the hotel too with a range of styles to suit everyones palate, would definately stay at Banks Mansion again

Reviews.Title: “Well-located hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: FromNYCtoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located on a picturesque canal in central Amsterdam. Can't beat the location. The staff is helpful, and in the lobby there is a plethora of magazines, newspapers, free beverages and some snacks on offer. However, the hallways to the room feel like they should be in a chintzy motel, not a 4-star hotel, and there is no parking (be prepared to find a place on the street for â‚¬40 / day). All in all, a good stay, but not quite 4-star quality.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RichardnRachel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business trips. The staff are very helpful (and speak perfect English), the rooms are clean, well furnished etc. The bar is free! The mini bar is free and stocked daily. The breakfast was fresh and comprehensive. The only thing that let the hotel down was not having a restaurent for the evenings but reasonable location to several great ones locally. Free internet available in the reception bar only

Reviews.Title: “Added to the Experience of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: arrtx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We thought the location was perfectly situated for all visiting all areas of the city. We traveled with our infant, and the hotel was nice enough to upgrade us to a larger room to accommodate the baby bed they supplied for us. I really thought that the concept of "home away from home" was excellent. We really took advantage of sitting in the lounge and having a beer or enjoying a bite from the nice selection of cheeses, meats and other treats. Since we had to be in early most evenings, due to baby's bedtime. It was nice to be able to have a place for my husband or myself to go chat with people. I was also surprised to find out that the snacks and drinks in the room were also complimentary. It was nice to be able to take a few things with us for the day since I was never able to find a market or grocery store. The staff were very helpful - we had to bug them regularly for bottle sterilization and they never seemed bothered. The best part was the chef. He really made our trip memorable. If you have children, you must go down for breakfast every morning. He is so friendly and really comes around to greet you and make your children laugh. It's a great start to the morning. Oh, one last thing. Has to be one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on at a hotel. Wish they could all be that way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: llamacalmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights over Easter, with husband, and two 17 yr old girls (if the hotel staff read this they were the two slobs in Room 7 - sorry for any mess they left behind!!). Hotel is very central and you can easily walk to Dam Square and Central Station. The staff here are exceptional - always cheerful and friendly, and willing to help. Most things have been said before. Free 50 mins of internet a day, plus the use of two computers in the lounge area, complimentary drinks in and out of your room, nibbles throughout the day, and a very high standard of housekeeping. Breakfast was good with eggs and pancakes cooked to order, plus sausages, bacon and the normal buffet selection. We had ground floor rooms facing the road, and didn't have any issues with traffic noise. The concept of having drinks included was one of the reasons we chose this hotel, and it was lovely to get back to the hotel after a busy day sightseeing, and helping yourself to a few drinks before going out to dinner. It was also nice to have a coffee and port before retiring for the night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hairy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel- has free bar, complimentary food, free mini bar, helpful staff, cooked while you watch breakfast,excellent location, free internet, 100% recommend it. Not cheap at Â£240 a night but totally worth it Will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Not much more to say..”
Reviews.Author: tono1968
Reviews.Content: Had a tremendous weekend in Amsterdam and one of the highlights was of course staying at Banks Mansion. From the minute we entered the doors we felt like home. Arrived late friday evening and were greeted with a smile from the staff in the reception. Checkin went smooth where we were informed of the free minibar, breakfast in the Kitchen, bar in the Living etc etc. First night we stayed in a standard room that was surprisingly large (the rooms are individually sized so I guess we were lucky) and nice furnished. Very quiet (not facing the road/canals) so we slept like babies. :) Next two nights we stayed in the suite, that was brilliant. Very large room, with separate sitting area. Huge kingsize-bed, coffee-machine, jacuzzi etc. Good view over the streets/canal, but therefore also a little bit noisy (especially saturday night), but not worse that one could fall asleep. Breakfast was superb. Maybe not the biggest buffet Ive seen, but everything was fresh and the room had - as the whole hotel - a tranquil atmosphere. Far from some large hotel buffet-restaurants that sometimes have felt like a school-kitchen. And we should not forget the lobby..called the Living. An excellent spot and somewhat the heart of the hotel where you could relax with a drink and a magazine before going out. During the whole day you could serve yourself a nice cup of coffee, a soda, juice or a cold beer. In the afternoon there was wine (red/white/rose/sparkling) and some cheese/salamis to enjoy. All in all we couldnt ask for more. The only complaint I can come up with is that the floor in the bathroom was partially flooded when taking a shower with the nice rainshower..but that is really a very minor detail. Yes, the hotel is at the expensive side..but the friendly service, the ambience and the extras really makes it worth every penny! Would I stay here again? Absolutely! The sooner the better! :) Would I then choose to stay in the suite again? No, I dont think so. Its really nice, but so was the normal room as well and as you dont spend that much time in the room I guess its not worth the extra money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Place to Stay in Amsterday”
Reviews.Author: MWR1948
Reviews.Content: For our one night in Amsterdam before our Tulip Time cruise, we picked Banks Mansion based on reviews here on Trip Advisor, and we were totally pleased with our selection. Friendly staff; nice lobby with free wine/beer/cappuccino/etc, newspapers, two PCs with free internet; free mini-bar in the room; free caraffes of whiskey, gin and cognac in the rooms; close to the tram lines (and they will give you an excellent map); nice free breakfast. When I added up the value of all the freebies, it made the Banks Mansion very competitive with the other hotels. We were told that if we called the hotel directly, they will equal or beat any other price (such as Expedia). When we go back to Amsterdam, this is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel, comfortable, wonderful staff , great location on a quiet canal”
Reviews.Author: danTA100
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay in Amsterdam , highly recommend for people wanting a great location but a little away from the crowds. Staff very friendly and efficient. The "extras" are great : comfortable lobby with round the clock free service - coffee, wine and cheese bar etc, etc. Great place to relax in the evening after a busy day , opportunity to meet other guests or just read a book next to the fireplace! . We thought the rooms were of good size for amsterdam, very comfortable bed, pillows the best ( and you had a "menu" of options) . Bathroom was large, with a bath and shower ! Loved the style and feeling. Worth the expense , we got a good deal through shopping around the tripadvisor links .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Breakfast and Drinks”
Reviews.Author: dkhay
Reviews.Content: Due to it's locaton, we were able to stop at the hotel in the middle of the day to drop stuff off, and because drinks/snacks were included in the price, had beer and cheese, crackers & salami after a long sightseeing day. Also able to purchase from the front desk all-day tram passes for the tram system, of which one line traveled right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SEGA_MARK
Reviews.Content: Hotel, Very Comfortable & Room very cosy. Staff, outstanding. Perfect Location. Free Minibar, choose your ideal pillow from the pillow menu - You'll feel looked after here - will I stay here again, YES, 100%. Highly recommended. Go for it and enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel & Customer Friendly”
Reviews.Author: kenPatti
Reviews.Content: It's everything you would want in a small wonderful hotel. Once you walk through the doors everything is included in the price. All drinks, mini bar, fast wifi and a made to your order breakfast. There are great down duvets on the beds! Be sure to buy your museum tickets from the hotel for the Fast Line entrance. It is right on a canal and centrally located to all museums and delicious restaurants. Have the reception recommend restaurants for you. Enjoy your visit! Patti

Reviews.Title: “Supreme!”
Reviews.Author: GoJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Deluxe Room at Banks Mansion for four nights in March 2011. My room was immaculate on arrival and was kept to a high standard of cleanliness by the housekeepers throughout my stay. It was very cosy and had plenty of storage areas for my belongings. When I booked my accommodation, I noticed that it had a shower instead of a bath. I prefer a bath to a shower so I was a bit unsure of my choice, but the shower turned out to be luxurious with plenty of space and a drench option which was perfect for relaxing under after a busy day of sightseeing. The furnishings in both my room and the communal areas were elegant with a stylish, rich colour scheme. My room was ideal for a peaceful nightâ€™s sleep â€“ the bed was extremely comfortable and there was virtually no noise from the other guests or the busy street outside. There was a well-stocked complimentary mini-bar and the refrigerator came in handy to keep my own snacks fresh. In addition, there was a complimentary self-service bar in the lounge with a wide range of alcoholic and soft drinks. The hotel is located in the picturesque Canal Loop and, as the city centre is so easy to get around on foot, it is ideally situated with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Because I was sightseeing for most of the time, I only ate three times in the hotel. My first meal was a delicious breakfast of cheese, cold meat, crusty bread, pain au chocolat, a croissant, Rice Krispies and orange juice delivered to my room on my first morning which set me up for the day! I also enjoyed two evening meals of tomato soup and vegetable lasagne via room service â€“ both were very tasty! I found all members of staff who I dealt with to be extremely friendly, polite and helpful, especially one of the receptionists who gave me travel advice on how to get to and from Amsterdam ArenA. The best things about the hotel were its charm, class and hospitality, and the worst thing? Leaving it behind, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights and chose this particular hotel on the strength of the reviews we found on tripadvisor. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and can fully endorse the other good reviews that have gone before. There were a couple of minor niggles which I will come to and we also had a feature in our room that, strangely, is not mentioned anywhere on the hotel's web site and is also not mentioned in any of the last 45 reviews on here. I'll also come to that later. On arrival, we were greeted by some very friendly and pleasant reception staff who explained where everything was and how everything worked (for example, the free bar area, the internet computers and so on). We were then shown the way to the breakfast room. Breakfast is also included in the price. Our room was well furnished, if a little on the small side. The bed was one of the best I have slept in for a long, long time and the pillows on the bed were, without doubt, the best quality I have ever encountered in a hotel - and I've certainly stayed in quite a few!! You even had the option of requesting more, or different, pillows from something called the â€˜pillow menuâ€™! I kid you not! The large flat screen TV is also equipped with a DVD player and the hotel has a range of DVDs you can borrow for no additional cost. On top of this, the TV has about 30+ channels, including BBC1 & 2, various film channels and, apparently, two 'adult' channels of the type you most certainly will not encounter in the UK - or so I am told! All free! The bathroom was small, but clean with a full size glass enclosed shower cubicle. Now, here's the unusual feature that has not been mentioned by any previous reviewer. Our shower cubicle doubled up as a personal steam room. It had a stone seat and an electronic button on the wall which turned on the steam. It worked really well - easily as good as you will find in a professional spa. That was something I have never encountered in a hotel room before and which was an interesting find. The niggles I mentioned above mainly relate to the bathroom. After using the shower, no matter how careful you were, a large amount of water seeped out under the shower door and across the bathroom floor where it lay for hours before drying up. We mentioned this to the front desk who promised to look at it but nothing at all was done about it. It really was a nuisance throughout our time there. On arrival, I discovered that my flimsy plastic glass on the sink was already broken in several places before I had even unwrapped it. I put it in the bin but it was never replaced. Likewise, the second plastic glass broke on day two and was thrown away. That, also, was never replaced. We used up the shampoo and shower gel on the first day. Neither was replaced on the second day, forcing us to use our own toiletries. Fortunately, they were replaced on the third day. The room minibar contained one solitary can of beer (and no other alcohol), which, when drunk on the first day was... you've guessed it, not replaced the next day! But this was not a big problem as there are half-full spirit decanters in the room and the hotel also didn't mind you taking drinks to your room from the bar downstairs - as long as it was not past midnight as we discovered on coming back in on our last night at about 12.05am. We got a seriously frosty glare from the man on reception who came round to see what we were doing. He didn't say a word but it was clear from the look on his face that he was not at all happy at us taking a couple of beers from his freshly-stocked fridge! Breakfast was good but nothing to write home about, despite the hyperbole on the hotel's web site! There is a chef who cooks eggs 'live' (according to the web site). That was much nicer than having to select them from a hot buffet. Was it value for money, bearing in mind the hotel is more expensive than most others in the same category? Overall, I think it was and I would certainly stay here again as we did like the hotel very much. Although it cost more than others, when you factored in the cost you would have had to pay elsewhere for two breakfasts each day and unlimited drinks (at typical hotel prices) you certainly break even. Finally, I see some reviews mention traffic noise. We had a second floor room overlooking the road outside. The double glazing was so good that we had no traffic noise whatsoever. The room was nice and quiet at all times.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, freebies, but small, loud, and expensive”
Reviews.Author: travelingmike167
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location for touring central Amsterdam. Staff was very freindly and check in was a breeze. It's nice that the hotel includes drinks, breakfast, and evening snacks in the price. Internet in the lobby on there computers is included, but they only include 50 minutes per day wireless access. For this price range rooms are small (even for Europe), but well appointed. My main complaint would be there was quite a bit of noise both from the road and other guests rooms. If I got a good rate I would return to this hotel, but the "inclusive" stuff probably doesn't make up for the increased cost compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to all in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AshburnVAMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my husband was attending a conference at the RAI center which Tram 4 runs to right in front of the hotel. It was convenient for getting to RAI and close to Rembrandt Square, Spui, Dam Square, shopping districts and just about everything else. We paid 265 euros for an Executive Room - #306. The room was a decent size with a very comfortable king bed (2 twins), nice duvets, desk, free minibar (toblerone bars every day!), good, large breakfast (free) and snacks all day, drinks, etc. Service was ok - not top notch but they did try hard. We got to check in several hours early and they gave us a free breakfast the day we arrived. I did ask for an extra blanket one night and it took 3 calls down to the desk and over an hour to get it but it got there. The one guy at the desk I guess was new and led us in the wrong direction for a restaurant that the hotel recommended. They staff was generally very nice. We had some trouble using the 50 minute free interenet cards they gave you. Several of them did not work and we had to keep going down to the desk. Also, our room keys had a few issues. This hotel is on a fairly busy corner with trams going by, cars, people. I used my earplugs because I am a light sleeper. We had a great view of the Herengracht canal from our room. Their are 2 doors that open up for fresh air. It was very chilly while we were there. All in all a nice little hotel with good extras that are included in the price. It's in a good location close to the tram and you can walk just about everywhere. The free breakfast is really nice. You can get omlettes, eggs any type, dutch pancakes and french toast from the griddle, their is bacon & sausage everyday, good smoked salmon, lots of fresh fruit, juice, great coffee, cappucinos, teas, hot chocolate, yummy croissants, cereals, all kinds of breads, cheese, ham, yogurt and just about everything else you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dexter619
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the centralized location in Amsterdam, since we'd be doing alot of walking. I couldn't have chosen a better hotel. What stood out the most was the stellar service we received at all times at the hotel, especially the front desk attendant. Since it is a smaller hotel, the attendant had numerous responsibilities ranging from checking people in, greeting them, arranging taxis, taking phone calls....all of which she did with grace, professionalism and genuine caring. I wish I had got her name. Her attentiveness made all the difference for our stay, since it was our first time in Amsterdam. The hotel had free access to the lobby bar which was generously stocked with beer, wine, liquor, coffee/tea and snacks. The breakfast area, which was downstairs was spacious and the attendant there presented a wonderful breakfast every morning with a great continental selection. Our room was pretty standard, nothing fancy, but the view of the canal was great. I would definitely stay here again and again if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel the best we have stayed in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Robyn070
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but wished we had stayed for longer. The attention and service of the staff was excellent and nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was well furnished and very clean. A nice touch was the complimentary drinks in your room and also down in the lounge. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices. We will definately return and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rothesayisexotic
Reviews.Content: From 2007 to now I've had the great pleasure to stay here many times and be treated exceptionally well by one of the very best hotel teams around. This time, as always, I received absolutely exemplary service, a great value for money room, in a terrific location with extensive choice of breakfasts, use of the "Living" facilities (inclusive drinks, snacks, coffee & internet and of course the heart shaped sweets are still there too). Nothing to complain about whatsoever and everything to feel pleased and somewhat smug about. Not worth going anywhere else in Amsterdam. I really love this hotel and the people who work there and I will undoubtedly keep coming back as long as the current levels of service remain. Well done to Ellen and the Banks Team!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: marlenaGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing Hotel we have ever stayed in. The saff were were helpful and charming, nothing too much trouble. Breakfasts were to die for but only if you like things like fresh salmon,duth pancakes,omlettes with all the other trimmings. Everthing included in the accom, help yourself to the bar, cheese and pate for happy hour`. I cannot sing enough praises for this hotel. I do hope one day we will return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location , brilliant staff..”
Reviews.Author: Haps4
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed hear for two nights from January 9th had a great time would stay again anytime. With special thanks to Ali the night porter super fella ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby Small Room”
Reviews.Author: discofun54946
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning after a flight from the states and no problem checking in at 830 in the morning Dec 26 for 4 nights. Ill repeat what has already been said: Small room, great shower. Radiator heat took some time to 'dial in'. Good breakfast selection. Inviting lobby with piles of magazines, whatever you want to drink, comfortable seats, warm fireplace and always fellow guests. In a hotel this small, I still never saw less than 3 staff working the desk/office. And desk staff was always cheerfully answered questions and gave advice. Clean. Good bed. Good location and trams out the front door made getting around easy. Suggestion... buy the unlimited ride card... get on and get off as many times a day as you want for the price of 2.5 rides. I had canal side room so it was really quiet, I could image the street/tram side could be noisy at times. Really, no complaints. Other than the really small room. Would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sorret
Reviews.Content: stayed at banks mansion after reading lots of reviews,i have stayed in hotels all over the world and this was up there with the best.The rooms are quite small but in amsterdam your room is the last place you should be!the location is superb the staff were great,very unintrusive but always at hand,the inclusive drinks were excellent as amsterdam is a very expensive place these days! the tv inthe room was excellent also atl east 30 inch lg(i read one review here which said they were tiny)all in all a great place to stay and we will defienetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay"”
Reviews.Author: JagHi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Banks Mansion in the beginning and end of our of our three week trip through Europe. We would recommend this hotel to everyone! Our first room was very comfortable, clean and worked very well for us...but a bit small and a little louder as it was facing the street traffic and a train or tram went past us throughout the night. Our second room was great as it was quieter, larger and not facing the street. It didn't have much of a view but we didn't care as it was justva place to sleep anyway. The bed's are very comfortable - my husband is 6 ft 4 in. We stayed over New Years Eve and even with the craziness of New Years, it was very quiet and peaceful. The hotel is worth staying at. The staff is very accommodating, helping us to plan excursions, make dinner reservations, provide walking directions, etc. The lobby provides free Internet for all ( or you can pay for wifi in your room)and also a fully stocked bar with everything from Beck's beer to baileys to scotch, etc and it's all on the house. Included free of cost. Also water, juice and soft drinks,etc. The lobby has a wonderful seating area with a large fireplace. You can also eat or drink anything from your hotel room refrigerator at no cost as well. The location is only a 10-15 minute pleasant walk into Dam Square, the city center. We chose this hotel because it was close enough to the action but quieter than being in the hustle and bustle of the city. If you don't mind walking, it's very accessible to all the attractions.....we walked to Anne Franks, Rembrandt Square, central station, .....everywhere is walking distance with good walking shoes. Otherwise, you can take the local shuttles, taxis, trams everywhere. New Years Eve in Amsterdam is spectacular and crazy! We walked into Dam Square, had dinner there, which the hotel called in a reservation for us, walked around the red light district and stood among tens of thousands of people in Dam Square when the clock struck midnight! It was insanely fun! When you arrive into AMS airport, find the Connexxion counter and they can provide roundtrip transfers to the hotel and back to the airport for 24,50 euro per person...or you can take a taxi but not sure of the cost. It's about a 20-30 minute drive to the hotel from the airport. After both stays, we found ourselves very well rested and will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best city hotels we've found.”
Reviews.Author: alanl726
Reviews.Content: We had to wait when we arrived because our room wasn't ready. They didn't have any dry ginger (for my wife's brandy). The lobby carpets have a terrible pattern. There was only one lift. The room would have benefitted from some brighter light. That's it - can't think of anything else bad to mention. When we arrived it was before normal check in time and we waited all of 15 minutes to access the room. Just trying to see how easy it is to write a bad review and I have to say it's quite difficult to do that with this hotel. I thought it was clean, friendly, efficient and comfortable. We've stayed at hotels in other European cities and this one compares favourably with all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good though not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: tjdnewyork
Reviews.Content: Location is very good--close enough to central touristy stuff but also near to edgier neighborhoods like De Pijp. They create a nice atmosphere in the lobby with a fireplace, free drinks, cheese plate at night, etc. The rooms are nicely outfitted, though smaller and darker than I would have liked. The standard rooms seem to all have only one relatively small window at the front. Ceilings are pretty low. A couple of things I did not like: They make this big deal about everything being included in the room price (drinks, snacks, beer, wine, etc.) but then they charge a very high price for something that most travelers need/want as much as a free sparkling water: the internet. They do give you 50 minutes free, but that goes fast, especially if you're working. After that the price is too high. The front desk staff were quite polite but did not know some very basic things about the city. For example I wanted to go to a pharmacy and it was about 5:30pm. I asked the person at the front desk and she said i could try one place around the corner but actually every pharmacy in the city was probably closed. I asked at a shop next door and they directed me to a place close by that was open until 11pm every night of the year. The front desk should know this or be able to find it out. Similarly I was jet-lagged and asked about where I could eat out late at night. Again I was told that there is nothing in the city open after 10pm. Simply not true. I had the feeling that the front desk staff didn't feel like it was their job to learn anything about the city except the most obvious stuff. I was told by more than one person at the front that I should just google something they didn't know about. When I come to a hotel at this price level I expect the staff to know more about the city or at least to go out of their way to find out more.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HCLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Staff friendly and welcoming; the communal area with a roaring fire was a pleasure to return home to. We had a canal view room which was lovely, not huge â€“ but more than adequate and full of character. Location was perfect; close enough to walk to most places â€“ but far enough away from night-time noise. There were a number of good restaurants on Utrechtsestraat (10 minute walk from the hotel) we particularly enjoyed Alfonsos, Mexican Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion exceeded all expectations. Our room was lovely, quiet, very comfortable with all amenities. The staff was exceedingly helpful with dinner reservations and event tickets. Breakfast is wonderful - a selection of pastries and breads, cereals, fruit, yogurt, omelets and pannnekoeken (dutch pancakes). The location is perfect - a 10-15 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, Museum of Bags and Purses, Museum Van Loon, Museum Willet-Holthuysen and slightly longer to the Rembrandt, Jewish Historical Museum and Anne Frank House. It is a perfect base from which to explore Amsterdam. There are numerous restaurants in the area. I would not hesitate to recommend Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “If traveling to Amsterdam, you MUST stay at Banks Mansion!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night trip to Amsterdam. We stayed at the Banks Mansion in Amsterdam. Honestly, I can't think of a single negative thing to say! We arrived in the late morning and our room wasn't ready but we were offered a corner room for only 16 Euro more. It was a fantastic room with a king bed. But, remember, in Europe, King beds are really two twins next to each other. Having a room with or without a canal view would be perfectly fine. The room was very nice, the service was wonderful, the free drinks in your room and in the lobby are top notch and there is always some sort of snack available. The breakfast in the morning which is also included in your nightly stay, is wonderful! The hotel is centrally located to everything. We walked everywhere. I'm very hard to please but would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff..”
Reviews.Author: AlyP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, well located. The room we had had a nice canal view. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The free bar in the lobby and free mini bar is a great idea. The room was a slight disappointment, no bath and quite small room and bathroom however bed and pillows comfortable. Breakfast really nothing to write home about and is situated in the basement dining area so a bit enclosed, i.e no natural light or windows. No real atmosphere in communal areas. Overall adequate probably wont stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing, all inclusive hotel, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: HalDavies
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to Banks mansion for my 50th birthday. we have recently stayed at places like Mandarin Oriental, Traders and Pan Pacific. what Banks lacks in stars it makes up for in quality. The location is perfect. One can walk to all the best museums/galleries with 15 minutes. the best value was the Handbag Museum on the same road. The Reception are is very welcoming, the staff were even more so. they were very helpful and always had a friendly greeting. This area is the heart of the hotel as it is a large lounge. All drinks, hot and cold are complimentary. I found drinking in the city quite expensive (not compared to the five star hotels though), but we often returned to Banks for a 'pick me up'! Breakfasts were really good, a big choice and as much as one wanted. This set us up for the day and we didn't have to lunch. The bedrooms were on the smallish size but we didn't spend much time there. All the usual PPV TV channels were there and they were complimentary. There were also three decanters in each room. All in all, for the extra expense of the hotel, I would return there because of it's all inclusive policy and because of it's location.- And thanks to my Wife for taking me there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever...”
Reviews.Author: varunsdua
Reviews.Content: Chose Banks Mansion based on the previous reviews on tripadvisor and everything I read was true. The hotel has the best location for the people who want to visit various city attractions. Every attraction is within 15 mins of walking from the hotel and hotel is central to most of them. Van gogh museum is 15 mins towards one side and dam square is 10 mins walk to the other side. Hotel has a policy of offering complete package including mini bar and bar in living room within your room charge when most of the amsterdam hotels charge you around 40-50 Euros extra for breakfast for 2 people. This gives you a great relaxation that you can have as many drinks as you want (coffee, beer, congnac, gin & wines). Central location helps you in coming back to the hotel room while you go to an attraction from another and enjoy a drink and then start your excursion once again. There are lots of good restaurants next to the hotel. We ate at La Traviata (Italian Restaurant). The restaurant serves very good pizzas and pastas. Fast food chains like McD and Burger King are also next to the hotel. A falafel shop next to the hotel, named "Maoz Falafel" also offers inexpensive snacking option during the day. Banks Mansion also offers 50 mins free wifi internet access for every day and also has 2 PCs installed in the living where you can surf the internet while sipping on your favourite drink. The hotel staff is very friendly and help you with everything. Breakfast offers eggs in anyway you like (Omlette, scrambles, fried etc.) and also pancakes along with fruits, cereals and juices. The living room with a free bar makes your stay comfortable. I can never recall my stay in any other hotel where I spent so much time in the hotel lobby as I did here. You can bring a book, read newpaper, surf internet or just chat while sipping on your drinks before/after dinner. The bar is very well stacked and accompniments (water, coke, munchings) are replenished every now and then. Rooms are small but that does not matter here as anybody staying in banks mansion would not spend much time in their room apart from sleeping time. Overall, I would go to an extent to say that Banks Mansion is the best hotel to stay in Amsterdam bacause of its location and its all inclusive policy. I wish hotels in other European cities also embrace this policy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Nirit97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and in a great location. We (2 adults and 2 girls, 8 and 13 years old) stayed 4 nights in 2 twin-bed rooms, which were very spacious as compared to normal double room. The staff is very friendly, always smiling and helped us in every detail (to find and reserve places in restaurants, etc).The free bar gave us a real home atmosphere. Although a bit expensive, it was worth its price! We would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Staff, Great Amenitites, but small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: petecass78
Reviews.Content: Title pretty much sums it up. The amenities are amazing, includes free breakfast, free alcohol (including top shelf liquor), free cappucino/espresso machine. Great lobby and great location. Very friendly staff. Only downside was the room, which was quite small, but the bed is heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Service is their trump card”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: The girls on reception are exceptional. The rooms are okay but the extra cost for canal delux not worth it as there were so many trees we couldn't see much of the canal view. No bath in room but the shower was nice and powerful. Breakfast in the breakfast room was nice, when we ordered it in our room ( extra 5 euro's) it was completely cold and had no covers on the should have been hot food. Didn't repeat room service again! The complimantary bar is very welcome. The hotel was nice enough but the reception staff was their jewel in their crown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect All Around!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanucksinCT
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, easy walking distance to everything. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. At 5:30 every evening there is an assortment of cheeses set out by the fireplace. Very enjoyable to relax along with a few glasses of wine, read one of several European newspapers, or just chat with the other guests. The breakfast served in the Breakfast Kitchen every morning is wonderful. Fresh fruit, smoked salmon, the best croissants ever, eggs whichever way you like them, and so much more. We had a deluxe canal view room which was superb. The most comfortable bed and pillows we have ever slept on. Enjoyed the Get Together Restaurant at The Albus Hotel just around the corner. We found the best Italian restaurant just a few blocks away called Saturnino. Owned by a husband and wife team, inexpensive, frequented mostly by locals.

Reviews.Title: “We have traveled a lot of countries and this was the best hotel for location and service to customers have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: appleg
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about the Banks Mansion hotel, location 5 star, service of staff 5 star, customer care 5 star, beds 5 star. This is the first hotel we have stayed in that has a full bar in the lobby (included in room fee), 24 hours a day with snacks. The lobby has fire place and it felt like sitting in your own living room having a drink . . . atmosphere was so friendly. Good breakfast buffet included. Only 2 blocks from Flower Market and one block to all the outside cafes, just nice walking distance to the shopping area and located right on the canal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a good location”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledOkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable (awesome bed), fairly roomy for a Euro hotel, and a good location. It appears to be recently updated/refreshed. Tram stops are about 1 or 3 blocks away that can get you anywhere in AMS (buy the tram/bus pass!). Good breakfast selection and quality complimentary beer/wine/cocktails and snacks are a very nice bonus. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Also, within a few blocks there are dozens of restaurants and cafes. This hotel will be top on my list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Girlbarber005
Reviews.Content: Not a wink of sleep with such an awful mattress and pillows. But to make matters worse........the room was not ready for us when we arrived (hours after the check in time!), the first room they offered us had never been cleaned. So gross! The second room was better but still had the last guests dirty plates laying around. The safe was broken. We were supposed to have a balcony room but since all of those rooms were dirty we would have had to wait even longer until they were cleaned or we could take what was available. Small and akward doesn't give this room justice. The bathroom was like a cofffin! The room never seemed to get vaccumed! We only came across one nice employee and the lady who ran the kitchen was sweet. Other then that GOOD LUCK! Not a single thing was done by management to reconcile all that went wrong. I will never in my life ever stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! What a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JEBath
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at Banks Mansion with my teenage daughter, and just had to leave a quick review. We had a fantastic stay at the hotel, it ticked all the boxes - really friendly and helpful staff, great position from which to explore Amsterdam, and the room was comfortable and spotless (with a lovely bathroom and gorgeous "rainstorm" shower).
