The all-inclusive concept made for a really relaxing visit - sitting by the fire after a day's sightseeing, resting our feet and enjoying a complimentary glass (or 2...) of wine, was bliss. The breakfast was great too, all the usual cereals/croissants/juices/hot drinks etc, plus omelette/french toast/sausages etc if required. My daughter especially appreciated the free computer access. All in all, it was lovely, and I will definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone.....

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: avic999
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions were very good, the staff ( mainly women ) were very friendly and helpful, especially Nancy. Our room was a good size with free mini bar, bathroom with shower and bath, and good size double bed. The drawback was that there was a strong smell of cigarette smoke - we are not smokers and specifically asked for a non smoking room. We asked for another room but couldn't be moved until the next day. Our new room was fresh and had a larger bed but no bath. At the side of the bed on a table were, a bottle of whisky, a bottle of cognac, and a bottle of gin, all half full but totally FREE. The mini bar had water, soft drinks and pringles, again all free and replenished each day. We were also given some complimentary chocolates as an apology for the first night. Each day at 5.30 p.m. down in reception a free cheese and spicy sausage selection was brought out for the guests to snack on with a good selection of cheeses. There was also a free selection of wines and beers, soft drinks, coffee, nuts etc. All hotels should do this - it's a fantastic idea!!! It was difficult to resist the temptation to just sit and gradually get drunk whilst enjoying the free food instead of going out to a restaurant after seeing the sights. The location is perfect for walking around as everything is within easy reach but if you want to you can catch the tram very close to the hotel. Breakfast was the buffet variety with a good selection of the usual - cereals, fruit, yogurts, cold meats and cheeses, and hot food - bacon and sausage with freshly cooked eggs,omelettes and french toast if you required it. I had only one small criticism - grilled tomatoes would have been good to go with the sausage. The staff were really helpful if you needed directions,a taxi, or needed to book a cruise at night. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and excellent level of service”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Banks Mansion a number of times over the last few years and I just realised I hadn't yet written a review. The most recent visit was in July 2010. The location cannot be beaten in Amsterdam. Central to every sight and located on one of the most beautiful canals with wonderful architecture. It is also very close to some great restaurants (around the 9 streets precinct). The Banks has a unique concept of all inclusive room rate, so all mini bar, downstairs bar and canapes, breakfasts etc are all inclusive. The rooms are very comfortable and have an art deco theme. The showers are terrific and some of the rooms have a huge deep bath for you to relax in. The lounge downstairs has a great fireplace which is a nice place to relax after a long day walking around. The service level in the hotel is excellent. All staff are more than willing to help you with any concerns you have or provide restaurant or visitor recommendations. What I like most about the Banks though is that it feels like a small boutique hotel and is not impersonal like a lot of the big chains can be, particularly in Europe. I would recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting Amsterdam. Particularly if you don't want to take trams or cabs everywhere as you can easily walk to Anne Frank House, the Dam, Central Station, Flowermarket, Heineken Museum, Rijkzmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and everything in between! Personally, I would never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mqs311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Amsterdam after stops in London and Paris. The Banks Mansion was the perfect plave to end our trip. Attentive service, Walking distance to all sites, complimentary breakfast and happy hour and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona_Lamont
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion is a gem of a hotel. The staff are excellent, The Living with it's roaring fire, bar, coffee making facilities and snacks is a real home from home. Bedrooms are very comfortable. Breakfast caters for many tastes. We'll be back, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: anitaTrondheim
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night, unfortunately, because we liked this hotel and their philosophy that everything is included in the price (breakfast, appetizers and drinks in the lobby) Makes you feel at home and relaxed. Because of this philosophy, the hotel is not among the cheapest, but we didn't choose this hotel for it's bargain prizes anyway. When we arrived we took a taxi from the railwaystation, but walked there the next day (20 mins, normal speed) and you have everything you need around the corner. We have only one negative thing to say: We arrived early at 14pm, and we were told that our room would be ready at 3pm (which is the actual checkin time). Instead of heading out, we desided to feel at home in the lobbybar. Our room wasn't ready until 0320pm. This may seem like a minor detail, and it would have been without the "free" bar...When you pay a certain amount for a hotel room, you expect it to be ready at check in time. The staff was nice and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in August. Our room, described as an upgrade at the front desk, was really tiny, even by European standards. The only thing that could have made it an upgrade was a Juliet balcony. Despite the fact that it was a non-smoking room, there were cigarette burns on the toilet seat. I've never seen that anywhere! The hallway carpets and elevator carpets looked like they had not seen a vacuum in a very long time. A large wall clock in the room was stopped at the wrong time. The tiny LCD TV had snowy reception. Room service pizza for two came with two plates, but one set of cutlery. In the breakfast room in the morning there were flies all over the food. The free liquor in the lobby ("the living") attracts a big, noisy crowd and there is free liquor in open decanters in the room. The bed was fine and comfortable and the shower was good. But on balance I would never recommend this hotel. There are much better options in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had had more time to stay here”
Reviews.Author: martypdx
Reviews.Content: Quick one night stay on layover en route to other European destination for business trip. Quality of hotel room was excellent, staff was friendly and helpful. Location was great Floral Market, Van Gogh Museum, etc. Was worried it might be noisy at night, but that was not the case. Only regret is that I didn't have more time to relax and stay at this gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very excellent service, beautiful place to be”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for our anniversary. We stayed in Amsterdam before when we were younger but in the more busy area near the Central Station. The location of Hotel Banks Mansion is more quiet and is more romantic, along a beautiful canal and we could walk to the Museums (fortunately we had sunny weather). The service of this hotel is really very excellent, the people were very very nice and helpful. We also appreciated the drinks and the Dutch cheese (tres bon) in the lounge area. Nice decoration and interior; chosen with care. We hope to come back soon! ValÃ©rie & Felix

Reviews.Title: “So pleased we found this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AW_LK
Reviews.Content: We were so relieved to stumble across Banks Maison Hotel after the experience we had at a B&B called the Blue Moon in amsterdam. What i was thinking when i booked that B&B i still dont know to this day. It is and was well rated on tripadvisor but was just not for us. Thankfully the B&B owner was understanding and allowed us to depart earlier than planned. BM hotel had a few rooms available and showed us a few rooms to pick from. We decided to request the room facing the rear of the hotel to avoid the potential noise from the main road elevation. This meant sacraficing a view and large windows but well worth the quiet nights sleep. Note that the room we viewed on the top floor felt extremely hot and were very small though did have a view of the canals, for an extra 50 Euros, we would suggest avoiding those rooms. recpetion service was excellent. the girl held the room for us whilst we worked out the B&B issue and returned an hour later to our clean and comfortable room with free minibar. the room rate for a very very large room was 200Euro for the walk in price. perhaps more than a prebooked net price. the price included unlimited free soft and alcoholic drinks at the bar in the reception. refilling bottles during the day allowed us to save a little money on buying water and juice throughout the day. :) in the evening we had an appetiser prior to dinner again savig some money buying wine at the restaurant. :) Very very nice touch. Rooms were clean and tidy. The bathroom was above average but not brilliant. Breakfast was good and freshly made pancakes to order were available. A nice way to start the day. Location is just far enough away yet close enough from the immediate centre of town in the area of the very exlcusive canals. Lots of nice restaurants to choose from. A good hotel with some very nice inclusions. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, best location, all-iincluded concept”
Reviews.Author: RickG23
Reviews.Content: By now, every great feature of this hotel has been cited in previous reviews. I'll just restate quickly. If you're staying in central Amsterdam, you can't ask for a better location. The hotel pays extreme attention to detail and comfort options. The entire staff is wonderful without exception. The "concept" - everything from full cooked breakfast to the in room mini-bar is included with the room rate - is refreshing and ought to be adopted universally. One last item I want to mention. Our room (I would assume all rooms) came equipped with the best shower ever! It's a 10-inch diameter straight-down rain head (a hand spray is also provided). I could have stayed under that thing for hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldSuki
Reviews.Content: Stumbled across this hotel by chance and compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Amsterdam, this stands out in a class of its own. The staff are friendly & attentive, the facilities/services pretty unique. Planning the next visit before the year's out!

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: lulu12391
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to amsterdam and found this hotel through trip advisor. totally lived up u to all our expectations. Booked deluxe room with canal view and what a view. Gorgeous!!! Great location a stones throw from the busy Rembrant square full of bars cofee shops and restuarants.. ten minute walk from the busy damn square. Staff great helpful and friendly. complimentary bar saves u a fortune on drinks and huge selection to choose from. breakfast freshly made to order absolutely delicious!( try the french toast) Will definetly return to banks mansion.. hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Br00klyn08
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel ... comfortable, immaculate rooms ... a very accommodating staff ... free drinks and snacks provided for the guests, a wine & cheese happy hour and an outstanding cooked to order breakfast. The location is ideal - be sure to request a canal view - within walking distance to most sights. Don't miss the Handbag & Purse Museum two blocks from the hotel (amazing collections from early centuries up to current times).

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: joegrink
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel experience. you cannot beat the extraordinary staff. from the front desk to the kitchen to the people who tidy the rooms, they were all wonderful. they should be cloned and sent to a lot of the hotels I've stayed in where they thought it was a privilege to allow me to stay there. as for the amenities, you've probably read the other reviews. well. it's all true. great food, great coffee, and drinks and movies included. hell, they should just clone the hotel!!! highly, highly recommend this establishment. and if you're a frank lloyd wright fan, you'll love the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TahoeJoe1954
Reviews.Content: The title says it all.. we stayed 3 nights and could not have been happier. The staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. The hotel is ideally situated to walk to almost any part of Amsterdam whether it be the Van Gogh museum, the flower mart, red light district or Dam square. On this trip we visited Edinburgh, London and Amsterdam.. In all categories Amsterdam was the winner this would include the Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Js
Reviews.Content: Great staff, and a nice hotel. A pretty solid choice over all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not great”
Reviews.Author: Hampronstraveller
Reviews.Content: Don't let the free minibar and lobby snacks and drinks overwhelm the fact that this is a 4 star hotel pretending to be a 5 star. Canal facing rooms lack view on all floors due to foliage on trees - save the money and face the side street. Rooms on small size, even for Europe and the reception staff is adequate - not terribly professional. When asked if they could change a 50 Euro note, the response was "we don't make change". At the right price, this is a very nice four star hotel - certainly not the 5 star they wish to be.

Reviews.Title: “Call your own cab”
Reviews.Author: Hospitable1
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to get ripped off don't use their taxi services, had a chat with the cab driver who was quite grudgeful towards many Amsterdam hotels that forced him to swindle. It's on commission basis and you'll pay it anyway. Fething at least 5-8000n euros a year at least - siphoned of between management. The rest of the Hotel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “If only there were more hotels like this!”
Reviews.Author: Geeman63
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel I read and reviewed many Trip Advisor comments on this property, all I can say is that all the positive comments are 100% correct! What a fabulous botique property. This was a real gem of a hotel and I would reccommend it all who visit Amsterdam. Firstly and foremost are the staff - during our stay Kiki and Nancy were the greatest of hosts. As soon as you walked in you were met with a genuine smile and a willingness to make you feel at home. In a business sense I have not experienced this in Europe or the UK before. You immediately feel like a friend and not a guest. The rooms are spotless and have all mod cons. Yes they are of a European size (smaller than what is on offer in Asia/Pacific/USA) but everything you need or what want is included and for most items with-in the accommodation rates. There are very few hotels where your mini bar (replenished daily) is included in the rate, as is wireless internet, and where evening drinks (huge choice) is included (free) and a fabulous breakfast is included. This is a special hotel in so many many ways. Having highlighted all the included offerings free (well this is really with-in the rate structure) at the end of the day for me it comes down to the staff and they are simply the best - I would reccommend Banks Mansion to anyone coming to Amsterdam, my only concern is that the property gets too popular and I can't get a room here next time I visit Amsterdam!! Enjoy your stay here I reckon it would be impossible not too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and service”
Reviews.Author: courtneyAlcoa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcomed relief after 25 hours of traveling. The staff was very friendly, and we were surprised by an upgrade to a suite. This room was wonderful, with a very large living room and separate bedroom. The bathroom was large with a big whirlpool tub and separate glass shower. Everything was included. We had wonderful views of the canal,as well as the street. The staff gave us a wonderful recommendation for dinner at an Italian restaurant within @ 3 minutes walking distance. The king bed was comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent and was included in the price also. The hotel was also in a great location, and within walking distance to all the main attractions and great restaurants. The staff were consistently helpful and gracious. When we return to Amsterdam, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best Hotel In Amstredam”
Reviews.Author: holidays54
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Banks Mansion, and the very high standards are still in place. The secret of the hotel is The Manager and The Team who work there. The Front Desk are always helpful, pleasant, caring and always say hello. The rooms are excellent with a pillow choice now!. Breakfast is always very well run by a lovely lady who goes out of her way to make sure you have a good start to the day. The design of the hotel is excellent and a lot of time and trouble is taken on how the hotel looks. The Home from Home is so welcome after a long walk round the city. A great idea. This hotel is miles ahead of most hotels in service and standards. A Real Gem.!

Reviews.Title: “Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Gareth66
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy visiting the Netherlands. The Dutch are great people, and always make you feel welcome & at ease. It's a great country to holiday in. Amsterdam is always busy, always moving. And it's rare to find a quiet and peaceful hotel anywhere. But to answer the usual questions about noise, this one seems to be really solid. Never heard a peek out of the other guests, the double windows block out most noise. And the curtains keep it dark enough when you want it. the air-conditioning works, and as it was quite warm when I visited, it was a welcome relief. The rooms are specially designed ( as is the hotel) in an Art Deco motif. And it gives it a stylish and uncluttered feel. It's not that expensive either. Amsterdam is an expensive city for good hotels. And you don't always get good either. I've visited the city for over 25 years now. And I think this hotel is a goodun. I had room 206, which is a corner room ,so was little roomier than some of the others. The rooms are comfortable & clean. The bathroom is stellar ( bath & power shower). Plenty of room to move about. It's got a nice coffee machine, which took a lot of the stress out of the 1st drink of the day routine. And surprisingly the free mini-bar and booze supply makes it more relaxing. The free bar & snacks thing downstairs with the internet and newspapers are a great idea. And it's nice to have a refuge from the streets. The more frugal amongst us will really like this, as it enables you to have a few evening drinks both before going out, and when you return all included in the price of the room. Lovely. Lol. I like to think I'm not a demanding customer. But I think we all expect politeness & helpfulness when staying in a hotel. This hotel has it in spades. They are lovely & professional, with that relaxed Dutch approach, which means you aren't speaking to a machine, but a human being. They are lovely people. The breakfast bar was uncrowded when I went. And stacked with a good choice of foods. It's also a largish room, so not the usual box room so many hotels use breakfast. Location is spot on also. Just go out of the entrance, and explore. Nigh everything you'd want to see in the city isn't far away. I never used the trams this time. Just walked and walked. If you like to do that, Amsterdam is the city for you. If you like using trams and taxi's, Amsterdam is the city for you. If you like bikes and boats. etc etc. I do recommend this hotel. And will use it again. As I've really struggled with hotels in Amsterdam over the years, and I feel I've found a good base for when I next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Ricofisher
Reviews.Content: Our view was of the street and I was disapointed but that was almost the only negative. The front desk with Nancy and Kiki were both incredible! If there is a model for what front desk should be both of these ladies represent it. The great staff goes much beyond the front desk. Sam is as good as it gets. To call him a bellman would understate his value. When we would return at the end of the day he would immediately ask what he could get for us and even mix us drinks from the OPEN BAR! Yes, that is right they have a well stocked top brand bar in the lobby that you are free to help yourself to and they even have stocked minibars and decanters of Cognac, Gin, and Whiskey in the rooms all free. Breakfast is very good and if you want to stay in the room they will put together an incredible tray for you for only 5 Euro service fee. In the afternoon they put out some nice cheeses, pate, and meats. It is located right on a main canal and you can request a view room for about 30Euro extra. We slept with the windows open the first night and woke up with several mosquitos in the room. The rest of our stay we just left the air on if we wanted to cool down a little. Bathrooms were very nice with a deluxe shower. The only down side and it was minor was the wireless service. They give out 50 minute cards. You have to scratch off the code and use it to get online. They are not stingy with the cards but it is a bit of a chore and if you have multiple computers, phones or devices, it's not great. As we left, they told us that they were considering opening up wireless fulltime to guests. This would be a great choice and one that us Americans are becoming accustomed to. This hotel had all of the nice features of a big name hotel but the local flavor and excellent location to make it something special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvlots
Reviews.Content: Great â€˜boutiqueâ€™ hotel in excellent locationâ€¦. Skinny-train right down the block. Rooms are small but service is excellent. Everyone was extremely helpful (found that my US curling iron would not work with electrical converter so they directed me to Dixonâ€™s right around the corner where I could buy a â€˜localâ€™ oneâ€”Gave us train schedules for our out of town excursion). Breakfast was wonderful â€“ donâ€™t miss their Dutch pancakes or made to order omelets. Nice to use their lobby to meet for free cocktails before heading out to dinner. Loved the beds and room 306 is a corner room and bigger than most!

Reviews.Title: “great concept”
Reviews.Author: stu026
Reviews.Content: great idea with all drinks in lobby and room included. great idea providing a large selection off cheese and compliments at around 4pm, just what is need after busy day sight seeing, just enough to fill a hole before heading out for evening dinner, Good access to free internet, and news paper of choice in the morning. very helpful staff, love range for food for breakfast, great location in classic area of amsterdam, if slightly close to main room and tram way, but that is conveniant and very little noice in hotel. all through a little pricey i would highly recommend, you could pay the same elseway and not experince the same high quality

Reviews.Title: “First update since 2007”
Reviews.Author: Rothesayisexotic
Reviews.Content: Been back here many times since first stayed nearly 3 years ago. Every time I browse through the competition but every time I re-book into Banks Mansion. Great staff, very friendly, helpful and relaxed, Great location 10 mins on tram 16 or 24 from Centraal Station, great breakfasts and civilised serving times, great beds, mostly great rooms - with one or two just a bit on the poky side - great to help yourself to coffee and drinks as and when you like. Best of all, the heart shaped sweets in the jar by the computer...yuuuummmm. Sunspecs required to deal with the carpets in the lift lobby areas but otherwise I can't find anywhere better in Amsterdam. It's a real joy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “All-inclusive? Well, nearly...”
Reviews.Author: megpickard
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion is a former bank on the corner of a busy street in the heart of Amsterdam, and bills itself as having an "at home" and "all inclusive" approach to welcoming guests. It's good, mostly - a damn sight better than many hotels in Amsterdam, a city which is riddled with terrible places to stay - and the things they get right they get very right indeed. I was assigned a room on the ground floor, literally steps from reception and with a window looking out onto the busy street outside, complete with trams and bikes going past just beyond the glass. Because of the traffic noise and lack of privacy, I went and asked at reception if it was possible to have another room, but was told that the hotel was full, and that I could move in the morning if I left my bag packed in the room. To cut a long story short, this didn't happen though I did as requested. Despite this, I slept well in the small but comfortable room, which was clean and well-appointed, with a variety of pillows and wall-mounted TV + DVD player. Weirdly, in common with many other refurbished hotels, the room was terribly underlit (though this was compounded by having to keep the curtains drawn to keep passers-by from looking in!) The hotel's proud boast that it is all-inclusive means that each room comes stocked with a (free) minibar and carafes of gin, cognac and so on. In the main lobby, a free bar operates in the same way as at an airport lounge - you help yourself. There are also two internet-connected computers there, which is good because despite the all-inclusive claim, wifi connection is charged extra. If you ask at reception, you'll get a 50 minute card free, but can pay for longer. All in all, a pleasant hotel and no doubt rooms on higher floors provide a less bustling and overlooked outlook, leading to a more relaxing stay. A nice change from faceless hotels, with some nice touches and thoughtful inclusions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and concept”
Reviews.Author: RichardMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in May (although that was cut short thanks to the wonderful Icelandic volcano). Despite late changes to our arrival, the stay and accomodation was wonderful. My wife and I travelled with my mother for her birthday and we had 2 canal-view rooms on the 2nd floor. While not the biggest rooms I've ever stayed in the accomodation was first-class with a queen-size bed that is closer to king-size. The staff were great from Nancy and co at reception to the breakfast staff. And the concept of all drinks included made for a very relaxing atmosphere - it takes a while to get used to the idea of just taking stuff from the mini-bar and helping yourself to drinks. The hotel's location is great for the flower market and the main tram lines and soundproofing is fine - you don't hear the trams at all. We've stayed at several hotels in Amsterdam (Radisson, Swissotel and the Kras) but this was easily the most relaxing and enjoyable one so far - we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Staff exceeded all expectations and Irish Hotel's staff should be sent her to remember what "cead mile failte means "”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2009Ireland
Reviews.Content: We were one of the many thousands, who's travel plans were affected by the Volcanic Ash ! We were very lucky to be staying in the Banks, the staff were so concerned and helpful with our plight ! On departure at 6.00 am with a long train, ferry 26 hour journey ahead of us, we came down to reception to hot rolls and lovely cups of coffee but even more importanty a really amazing night porter who could not have been nicer or more geniune. We must also say that before all this , the staff were fab. Another review mentioned KiKi, she was amazing , we actually met her in the street when we didn't know which direction to go, she was not working but spotted us and askes were we ok ! We were so impressed ! Great Location, Food fab, FREE BAR ! Rooms small and not anything to write home about but spotless

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Angela22Durham
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Banks Mansion hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. It more than lived up to our expectations. First impressions were the very friendly staff who explained their concept which is to make you feel at home. You certainly do feel at home here! This means that the bar is free, with coffee, tea, wine, beer and every spirit you would expect to find in a bar. Pastries and cakes are provided during the day and crisps and peanuts in the evening. We didn't buy a drink outside the hotel as the location was so perfect that we were able to walk back to the hotel if we wanted a coffee. There are two computers with free internet situated in the lounge area. The mini bar in the room is completely free as are the three decanters containing whisky, gin and brandy. The roooms are lovely and very clean. Breakfast was very good. There is a chef preparing fried eggs and omelettes to order. We have stayed in lots of hotels in Amsterdam but this is one of the best for value and location. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home!”
Reviews.Author: hillbobs
Reviews.Content: We loved the way that we could just help ourselves to drinks and nibbles without waiting at a bar or for waiters. The hotel's ethos of making their customers feel relaxed was also evident in the reception staff (particularly Kiki) who were always cheerful and knowledgeable about the area and facilities on offer. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce056
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Banks Mansion we knew that we had made the correct decision. The Staff were friendly, smiley, attentive to every request & query - nothing was too much bother. Unfortunately due to personal circumstances we needed to postpone our visit twice - this was never a bother for the reception staff - thank you for your understanding. Our room was on an upper floor and overlooked the canal - with the double glazing you never really heard the traffic - there are very few cars anyway - the occassional clatter of the trams and ringing of bells on bikes when we opened the windows all added to the Amsterdam experience. The room was a fair size and the bathroom with rain shower was wonderful. The concept of 'free' in room bar and 'no charge' hospitality in the living area at reception was very welcoming and never seemed to be abused! Being very central all the museums, visitor attractions, shops, restaurants etc were very easily accessible - although nowhere is really more than 15 minutes away at a brisk walk although with soo much to see and the quaint architecture that just appears around each corner made some walks pleasently longer! The weather on our visit was really warm and we never needed to use the trams but they are very efficient & regular. We will be back to Banks Mansion in the not too distant future - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparrowFlight
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Banks Mansion. The hotel is in a great location and the beds and showers are decent. The internet usage can be annoying if you use it often in your room. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was ok but not so nice to eat in a basement. I think that may be a seasonal challenge and perhaps they move it outsside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location and nice decor”
Reviews.Author: Janeh2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banks on a romatic getaway.It was great - the hotel is in a good central position easy for the canals, trams and nightlife.The hotel is really nicely decorated and has warm welcoming staff.Its an all inclusive concept so once you have checked in you can help yourself to drinks from the bar and the mini bar in the room is complimentary too. The rooms were smallish but very stylish- this is due to the construction of the building and the hotel has been renovated to fit in perfectly with the design of the original building.Breakfast was in the basement and was really good- plenty of cereal,breads,fruit and a really nice lady making wonderful pancakes!!!! The staff recommended some restaraunts which were all top notch.I would recommend 'the five flies', not the most attractive name for an eatery but great food and atmospheric setting with excellent service. All in all a great place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel with Poor Service and Unprofessional Behavior”
Reviews.Author: mattnjennie
Reviews.Content: Note to the owners and general manager at the Banks Mansion; If you don't understand your contractual obligations and bookings with Travelocity DO NOT ask your guests to DOUBLE PAY! Manage your staff and shortcomings in reservations without placing the customer int he middle of your disputes. If you cannot reach Travelocity Reservations in 48 hours because your staff is not properly trained or LAZY please don't be assumptive and overcharge your guests while you attempt to figure our your contractual arrangements. Lastly, don't have your General Manager chase your guests out the door begging them to pay both Travelocity and your establishment because you were not able to reach Travelocity in 48 hours for payment terms. Poor training and service are the cornerstone of the Banks Mansion in complete contrast to their Brilliant Hotel and location. I stayed at the Banks Mansion with a colleague after enjoying many of the reviews her on TripAdvsor. After checking-in with a Travelocity reservation the Front Desk happily checked me in with the correct room overlooking the canal which was the correct room. So far so good. BTW: NEVER book a room off the main street just west of the Canal as a street car runs all night some 10-15 feet from just half of the Hotels Rooms. The ambiance when you arrive is romantic and inviting with an open lobby and open bar for all guests. Kudos here. Note: If you are a business traveler watch for the expensive KPN Internet Access as you will only receive your first 50 minutes free. The Room was small, quaint and stylish but maybe needing a refresh soon as the furniture, decor and bedding looked a bit worn and dated. The room and bathroom appeared clean and the fridge was stocked with numerous drinks and snack which are included as part of your stay. Overall...well done. Breakfast....Well, Breakfast was acceptable with preserves, breads, yogurt and an omellete station. Coffee was ready made from a machine and service was very acceptable. This review is reflective of my personal experience and is accurate as a Million Mile Traveler every year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with all inclusive pricing”
Reviews.Author: rothsberg
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with this hotel. The staff are extremely helpful, genuinely friendly and ready to help out when needed. The great thing with this hotel is location and that everything is included, drinks and snacks in mini bar, in foyer there is a fully stocked bar, with coffee machine and in evenings they do snacks and wine. Also in foyer are 2 free internet terminals. Room looked over the canal and had a great view with big french doors opening out. Bed however and room are very small. Breakfast was also included and had a chef cooking eggs to order. My only criticism would be cleanliness, bathroom was not very clean or cleaned very well when we stayed. They could really do with reviewing cleanliness policy. But we would definitely recommend this hotel and we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but nice”
Reviews.Author: MRRHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banks Mansion for 2 nights in March. I think the best way to describe the Banks Mansion is that it is a quirky hotel that canâ€™t quite make up its mind whether it is a full service hotel. On the positive side, it is wonderfully locatedâ€”about 2 minutes from Rembrandtsplan and 10 minutes from Leidesplan and the museums. So, you are right in the heart of Amsterdam. Also, a plus is the lobby lounge of the hotel which provides a complementary full bar, tea, and coffee. The lounge has a wonderfully cozy fireplace, just right for chilly Amsterdam winters. On the down side, the hotel seems to run with very minimal staff. We arrived on Sunday night and quickly learned that there was no bell staff available. Indeed, the Sunday staff consisted of just one person and so far as we could tell, there was no bell staff employed by the hotel. So guests are expected to manage their luggage pretty much on their own. Of course, many people prefer to deal with their own luggage, as we often do, but it is nice to have the option. The room had a lovely canal view (as advertised), but was incredibly small even by European standards. There is really no place to put luggage in the room and the armoire is not big enough to tuck the luggage or other items away. So, while the bed has the best down pillows imaginable, the room is not especially functional. Be prepared to map a path from the bed to the door around your luggage. The room also lacked basic instructions on how to use the television and phone and so we were constantly calling the front desk (our one staff person) to ask how to do this or that. If given the opportunity, I donâ€™t think we would stay at the Banks Mansion again. While it certainly was not a bad experience, it was just not so enjoyable that one can overlook the room size and other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect blend of luxury, comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: HampshireMonty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated within walking distance to all attractions. It is situated on a busy road, however our room on the 2nd floor was double glazed and we heard nothing. Our beds were SO comfy with pillows to die for! The all in policy just helps you to relax. A glass of wine after a hard days sightseeing, a few nibbles with a coffee, a bottle of water, a brandy as a night cap - its all there - no nasty bill at the end. You help yourself to everything and anything. Breakfast is superb. Omelettes made to order, crispy bacon, fruit, croissants etc... The staff made us both so welcome. On wandering around we saw other hotels we had considered but none came close.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sunangel32
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at the Banks Mansion in August for 2 nights, but lately I have been having a strong desire to go back so I thought I would share my lasting memorable Amsterdam experience of this wonderful property. The hotel's location can not be beat. It was super easy to get to, we took the train from Amsterdam airport to Central Station and hoped on the bus from there. The tram was about a 5 minute ride and literally let us off right in front of the hotel. Check in was a breeze. The room was nice and the view was awesome. Wasn't technically a balcony, but we did sneak on it a few times to enjoy the peaceful canal view ( i believe it could be referred to as a "french balcony"). Beds were extremely comfortable and the rain showerhead was pure heaven. Yes, rooms were small but that is to be expected in Europe. My boyfriend and I are in our late 20s and really wanted to do up Amsterdam, so I will be honest, the main reason I booked this hotel was for the inclusive drinks and it did not disapoint. There was a bar set up downstairs with a wide selection of beers, wine, liquor, coffee, sodas, and bottled water that was on a help your self basis 24 hours a day. From the Jameson put in my coffee in the morning to the late night after the bar beers this was a really nice touch. I am also a huge water drinker, so the free bottled water also was great. The mini bar in our room was fully stocked, but it was not refilled (this minor detail was my biggest complaint). We were definatley the youngest people staying at the hotel, but the evenings were a great time to socialize with other travelers when they would put out wine and cheese trays (and cheese in Amsterdam is wonderful). I cant say enough good things about this place. The location was awesome. With in walking distance is the Rembrandplein, which is filled with lots of bars and restaurants. There are many pleins throughout the city and this was by far my favorite one. It seemed the most local and not touristy like Dam Square and the Red light district area and even the Leidsplein There is really no need for a car in Amsterdam. My boyfriend and I rented bikes and rode everywhere.(mikes bike rental was great and with in 10 minute walk from hotel) Breakfasts were wonderful. Lots of buffet items, but you can also order basically anything cooked to order. Staff is so friendly just like the rest of the city. Gotta love the Dutch. We booked the Float package and have to comment on it because I was unsure of what to expect. With the float package we were given a free float session at a highend spa down the street(this was not done by the hotel but offered by them) . The Koan Float was one of the oddest things I have ever experienced. Basically you submerge in a blue chamber filled with warm salt water. You are given a floating headrest and basically just float for an hour while calming music plays. Very different, and can't say I'd want to do it again, but an experience none the less. The float package was cheaper than booking per night so that's why we went with that. All in all I am dreaming of returning this summer. This was our first stop in our Europe tour last year and set the bar very high. The rest of the trip unfortuantly did not compare in quality, and would highly recomend Banks Mansion when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: tripaddy
Reviews.Content: Went on trip advisor to find hotel as so many in Amsterdam where do you start?!!! With Husband for a special anniversary and wanted something different. Couldn't fault it. Yes you do pay a bit more than other hotels but all drinks (hard and soft) are most definately included. This includes branded names, and not cheaper imitations so is well worth it as drinks in Amsterdam bars are not cheap to say the least. Breakfast was very relaxed and a lovely way to start the day. Shower in room lovely. Visit trip advisor lots but have never left a review. Banks Mansion deserves it! We will definately return with friends next time. Wouldn't advise it if you have young children though. More for adults. Staff most helpful and very welcoming. It is easy to see why it has such a good reputation. Our room wasn't massive but this was part of the charm and individuality of the place. View of canel quaint, and situated just on edge of centre. Could walk to loads of main places ie dam square, anne frank house etc within 10-15 mins but still felt like you were miles outside of the hustle and bustle. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Great hotel, fab service and it really is a free bar”
Reviews.Author: Mazzamca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an Executive canal view room for Valentine's weekend. From the moment we arrived the service was wonderful. Lovely room. Good breakfast. I was dubious about the claim of free bar but it is indeed free: both in room and downstairs in the lobby too. Overall excellent stay, would use again

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BlindBaz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay in Amsterdam in the Banks Mansion with my wife from a business trip, the hotel is 4* some of the fittings in the room had seen slightly better days, but that is the worst thing i can say! The staff are a real breath of fresh air, i extend my thanks to Nancy, KiKi, Philip and all the others. I have never experienced service like it before ( and i have stayed in a lot of hotels of all ratings ), nothing was to much trouble and this hotel truly put much larger and much more expensive establishments to shame. The free bar in your room and in the Living area where always fully stocked, and if you needed anything just ask and it appeared. I was truly surprised by this hotel, it is of boutique size but punches well above its weight. I will not be staying anywhere else in Amsterdam, do your self a BIG BIG favour and try it you will love it. OH i forgot the breakfast served by Sam, delightful !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Juhala
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Amsterdam for several years and was not away of Banks Mansion hotel. We stayed here last year and would not wish to stay anywhere else. Polite and helpful staff, excellent service and after a hard days work a delight to go home to. Congratulations Banks Mansion! See you soon

Reviews.Title: “From the time we arrived to the day we left everything was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia858
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old Daughter and I spent a couple of nights there. The rooms were a good size the bathroom large for European standards. Everything was included from the mini bar to the drinks in the lobby/ bar area. The location was very central. We also went to the Purse and Bag Museum which was close by and worth the trip. The hotel I think is better for Couples and families with Adult Children.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mamouthLondon
Reviews.Content: I visit Amsterdam every couple of months on buisness and have probably stayed here 20 times. Its my first choice not only because its so central but also because the staff and environment is great. Whats different from usual is the 'living room' area where you can get unlimited free drinks and bar snacks plus free internet use. Whats great is that when traveling alone its often a good place to meet and chat with other guests in a nice environment. With this in mind I have recommended it to female colleagues travelling on their own.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value & great location”
Reviews.Author: nakaj1
Reviews.Content: a great location, excellent service, & a crazy amount of gratis amenities (free beverages! an amazing breakfast buffet! champagne to ring in the new year!), i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in seeing amsterdam. sure, the rooms aren't huge but really, should you be spending much time in your room when you're in a beautiful city like amsterdam? especially when you can buy your tix to the rijks museum & the van gogh museum directly from the concierge? i think not.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Yank-in-France
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Banks Mansion had its pluses and minuses. On the plus side is mainly the hotel's location which could not be more central. Also on the plus side is the fresh, abundant cooked breafast included with the room rate, and the complimentary mini-bar, and soft/alcoholic drinks. The minus side was the housekeeping department. On our first day, they did not arrive until 5 pm, which was way too late, since we had been out walking all day, and at that time only wanted to rest and relax in the room. The next day, they did not arrive until 2:30 pm, again, the one moment when we wanted a short break from shopping. The reception was also a bit cold. Having said all this, for the "plus" reasons, I would go back to this hotel. Try the P-KING asian restaurant across the street, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the rest, and one of the Best”
Reviews.Author: newyork-everywhere
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for choosing a hotel for a business meeting in Amsterdam for 15 people. I was very nervous since I have never been to Amsterdam and was basically calling different options. I was very impressed with the staff that helped me with the logistics and the location I can describe in one word "perfect". The rooms were outstanding and the bathrooms make anyone feel like a million bucks. The concept of one price covers all is great for anyone thinking of travelling. The location is great, walking distance from the Tulip market and most of the historic buildings. Free breakfast (made to order omelettes, etc.), free use of mini-bar, and free beverages and snacks in the main area while looking outside at the canal made me want to stay inside the hotel at times more than going outside. The staff is very accomodating and goes the extra mile to please all of its patrons. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam for business or pleasure. With all of the extras included in your daily rate and the amenities, I find it hard for any hotel to compete with it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms with unconventional amenitiesâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: Overlooking a canal near a tram line, the Banks Mansion lived up to expectations. The rain shower was lovely. The provided slippers and robes would have been excellent â€“ but we werenâ€™t in the room long enough to use them. A major factor that sets apart this hotel are the free amenities like free access to the bar downstairs, free mini bar with cognac, whiskey, and gin and a supply of soft drinks to choose from. Also a few snacks were provided. This was all quite lovely but we didnâ€™t end up drinking a lot â€“ mostly because I caught a cold in Dublin and spent a lot of time sleeping on the, extremely comfortable, bed. The location was just off of the 16, 24, or 4 lines to Centraal so it was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience while not staying at the Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: ddinlger
Reviews.Content: I wanted my parents to come to love Amsterdam as much as I did when I was there many years ago. They are not frequent travlers having left the USA only twice in the last 20 years. I booked the Banks Mansion based on reviews from Tripadvisor.com for a 4 day weekend holiday. I have never stayed at the Banks hotel as I have become a "slave to the HiltonHonors" program having elite status blah, blah, blah... To complicate matters I was/am an overly worried son fearing my parents would get lost in the shuffle of a busy boutique hotel catering to more prestiguous guests and venues. I was very wrong to be so concered, as my mother and father were in very good hands at the Banks. My parents have not stopped talking about this hotel experience since they got home; "Beautiful hotel", "fall-all-over-you-service", "warm and friendly", "delicious breakfast", "great view of the canal"(4th floor room), "comfortable room", were just some of the many raves my parents had. I know they arrived from JFK to AMS in the morning and the reception was able to get them to thier room straight away. Aside from the hotel itself, I was eased by the fact my parents would have a "wonderful" breakfast each day as well as having "snacks" available to them should they want. The other huge comfort for me was that I was able to work with a guest reservationist named Sarah Post, for without her services I would be lost. Sarah, helped put my mind at ease knowing my parents would be well taken care of. She helped coordinate deliverinng fresh fruit and flowers to my parents every day of thier stay (a charge for this, but well worth it). Sarah also helped recommend tours and activites my parents would enjoy. Sarah and the rest of the hotel staff, put my mind at ease and helped make this a wonderful vacation for my mom and dad, as well as a great gift from me. My parents had the "trip of a lifetime" and I get the credit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with some unique perks, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banks Mansion in September. It's right on the Herengracht. We requested a canal view room (which costs more), and had a great view of canal and street life. The most unique and value-added aspect of the hotel is that drinks in the room (they have decanters of gin, scotch, and other liquors and bottles of beer) and in the lobby lounge area all free of charge. Rooms were well appointed with modern decor. The room sizes were small by US standards, but typical for most European cities. The location near the Rembrandplein was excellent. The room cost over 250 Euros, at the current exchange rate, that was well over $300, so it's a pricey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonlnParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days for our honeymoon. Right off the bat we were impressed. A very nice young man walked us to our room and helped us with our luggage and showed us around the lobby. The room was small, but it was so nice. The bathroom was huge! The tub and shower were great and it was all very clean. The best thing about the Banks Mansion was that everything was complementary. The mini bar in your room, free! No watching what you take, if you're thursty, drink something! The breakfast was good and there was someone to make a few things if you asked. They had a little mini bar with all kinds of juices, sodas, beers, coffee there for you if you wanted. In the afternoons they had snacks, which was nice to come back to if you wanted to take a break after your morning travels. Just stop off at the hotel, pick up a drink and a snack and go back out! The location is great, the Herengracht canal is incredibly beautiful, and it's within walking distance to the Anne Frank House, Rijksmesuem and Van Gough (spell?) and most of Amsterdam. It's right in the middle of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Rooms a little Small”
Reviews.Author: jamestoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located just off Herengracht. Its an easy tram ride directly from Central Station on trams 16, 24 or 25a. Hotel staff are extremely friendly, efficient and eager to please. The Room was comfortable but very small. The bathroom was very good with a nice full size shower, there was however not too much space for toiletries (shelving etc). There was a choice of pillow type which was a nice touch and the bed was comfortable. There was complimentary dicaners in the rooms containing Gin, Scotch and Brandy which was a nice touch. Also the Mini-bar was inclusive in the price and restocked regularly. Downstairs in the lobby / Living area there was a nice open fireplace and comfortable seating. There was also a complimentary help yourself bar with sweets, nibbles and coffee. It was disappointing that WiFi was an extra cost in the room but there were two computers and a printer for guests to use in the lobby. Breakfast was good and the omelets/ french toast were cooked to perfection. I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TrapezeFlyer
Reviews.Content: Located within the Canal Zone, Banks Mansion is an excellent vacatoin stay in Amsterdam. The staff at the front desk are helpful and very cheerful. The rooms are very modern, albeit a bit small. We did not pay to upgrade to a canal view room. I'm not sure it's worth the extra money unless view is of paramount importance. The included breakfast includes both the usual cold dishes as well as cooked-to-order eggs, french toast, and dutch pancakes. The lounge of "Living" as they call it is verz cozy, providing free wine, beer, liqueurs around the clock. At 5:30 they put out a nice spread of cheese, meats, and bread. If you don't like to drink with others, the in-room minibar is well stocked and also free. The lounge also has two computers with free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllsfairPrinceton_NJ
Reviews.Content: Based upon reviews of this hotel in Trip Advisor we decided to give it a shot. Overall impression was that it is an average hotel located in an average location for Amsterdam. On the plus side, the breakfast buffet is above average and the lobby is nice.On the less than plus side, we stayed on the 3rd floor with a view of the canal and found the room to be quite small (yes, even by the oft-quoted "European" standard) and well past due for a refresh. The receptions staff is very much hit or miss, with the average being mostly efficient but certainly less than warm. The hotel has a view of a somewhat commercial section of one of the canals and is located on the corner of a busy street with a tram running down it. The tram is conveniently located in that sense, but do not even consider a room on the ground floor as people on the sidewalk could look down into your room through the window. Although we did not stay in any other hotel in Amsterdam to form a relative comparison, I believe there are better places to stay and would try something else on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but we were disapointed with things”
Reviews.Author: Kezia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Banks Mansion before approx 3 years ago, got it on a special and great deal and a party of 8 went and we all had a fab time - We love Amsterdam, the atmosphere and the people and have visited many times. We re booked this hotel, as it was so good previously, and we were celebrating a special Anniversary, so we booked the deluxe canal rooms, and paid 515 euros plus city tax on top, for 2 nights, so not the cheapest, but we thought we have been there before and we felt it was worth it as it was a special occasion. I emailed the hotel approx 36 hours before we were due to arrive, explained that it was a special Anniversary (20 years) and that we were very much looking forward to our stay, and if there was any chance of a upgrade and a bigger room (as the standard and deluxe canal rooms are quite small), and also that we would be arriving early so if the hotel wasnt full was there any chance of a early check in. Before we departed we had no email and no response to our email - which isnt great customer service, and when we arrived the email was not mentioned - no Happy Anniversary nothing - the person that checked us in was very efficient, but not at all personable, and the email was not mentioned at all. Our room was the room that we booked and paid for, although they did have more superior rooms and the hotel wasnt full - so that was disapointing. All treats, mini bar, and the drinks, beakfast are included like previous people have stated and yes it is great, but you do pay a premuim for this, so unless you are planning on spending a lot of time at the hotel and getting your moneys worth, I would go to another hotel - equivelent in class, that doesnt include all the extras, but is less probably far less expensive. Things we were dispointed with - The hotel was the same as it was 4 years ago decor wise, and hasnt been revamped at all, and is starting to look a little tired in places. They didnt acknowledge our email. No upgrade was given although the hotel wasnt full. The remote control didnt work properly -batteries needed replacing, and when we returned back to the hotel from a day out exploring the city on the Saturday at about 6 oclock, we had a drink in the bar, before heading to our room for a quick change around - and our room was exactly how we left it - bed unmade and no clean towels, we rang reception who said that it must have been overlooked and they would get it sorted, which they did, but thought that this was poorand really not good enough for a hotel of this class, and that we were waiting for the chambermaid at 6 oclock at night. Also missing from the room was the breakfast menu, as late on sat night when we returned we got into bed and decided that we would have room service and have our breakfast delivered to our room, which you can do for a extra 5.00 euros - you just have to select from the breakfast menu and ring down to reception - we didnt have a menu in the room and at 2am, after waiting for our room to be cleaned earlier on, we were really were to tired to wait for one to be sent up and then select and then order - another disapointment Reception staff all leave alot to be desired on the whole, as I said efficient but not personable, apart from Nancy - the weekend manager that arrived on the Saturday, she always asked if everything was ok, and seemed to with all the guests, and always asked people whether they had a nice day and seemed genuinley interested in the people staying there and what they were up to. That all being said it is a good hotel in a nice central position, of a nice class, and if you get the chance to go on a special deal then do, especially if you go with a crowd and intend spending alot of time at the hotel, and enjoying the freebies, but if you have to pay top money then just look around at the alternatives - there are many. Another thing if you have booked or are planning to stay here - If you have breakfast, there is a help yourself buffet and also a menu with things to order about 3/4 things, be aware that you can also order other things that arnt on the menu, as a couple came in on our last day and ordered, eggs, bacon, sausage, tomatoes and mushrooms and they got it - this wasnt on the menu, and my hubby would have definately ordered it had he known.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with 'freebies' galore!”
Reviews.Author: hoosenpoon
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1/ The hotel is excellent value for money. Guests receive complimentary drinks from their mini bars, free drinks and snacks downstairs in the 'living' area and internet access. 2/ The hotel is located on the Herengracht canal - which is ideally located for exploring Amsterdam. 3/ The staff were very friendly and helpful when dealing with us. 4/ Guests are offered a selection of four pillows to chose from! 5/ Rooms were clean, modern and decorated in an art nouveau style. 6/ Plenty of choice at the breakfast buffet, including eggs cooked to your prediliction while you wait! Negatives: 1/ The rooms may be a little small for some peoples taste. 2/ Our bathroom needed a shelf at a reasonable height - as opposed to one at knee level! 3/ Room service was 'off the menu' for our stay (late Aug 09) but I presume will be back in place shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch hotel”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasTravelnut
Reviews.Content: BEWARE: This is a classy hotel, but they overbook. We paid $316 to our travel agent months in advance. When we arrived, they said they were overbooked and put us in an inferior hotel at a less desirable location. The rate was $183. per night, so we were lost $133 which they have refused to refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Added Perks”
Reviews.Author: CVChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for a long weekend in Amsterdam in March 2009. I thought the complimentary drinks and the snacks in the lobby were a nice touch. We were able to come back to the hotel before dinner each night and had a drink and a little bite to eat before taking a rest before dinner. Location of this hotel is great - very central. Only a few blocks from the flower market and many restaurants within walking distance. We took the tram or walked everywhere throughout our weekend stay in the city. Would recommend this hotel as a good central hotel with nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bank on It”
Reviews.Author: Da_Criticizer
Reviews.Content: In searching for a hotel in Amsterdam this hotel came up as â€œrecommendedâ€� on various travel sights. I also skimmed through the reviews here on Trip Advisor and honestly, I was not very impressed with the pictures which I saw but then again, pictures from other hotels in Amsterdam were even less impressive. Given the 'somewhat decent' price, location and promise of "free" amenities (unlimited access to the lobby bar, free in-room mini bar and 50min free daily internet access) I decided to go ahead and book it. I just accepted that Amsterdam isn't known for having world renowned hotel brands (no Westin, Hilton, Hyatt etc. in the city center) and fairly sized hotel rooms. I just prayed the Banks Mansion isnâ€™t really the Haunted Mansion The trip into Amsterdam (from Paris) started by me almost getting ripped off by the taxi from the train station (Amsterdam Central) to the hotel. Do yourself the favor and just carry your luggage a few more steps on to the tram (name for local metro) which has a stop next to the hotel. The hotel is only 1.6 miles from the train station. When I arrived at the hotel the check-in process was easy enough and the staff was friendly, even though their cordiality didnâ€™t come across as being genuine. The front desk seemed to be managed by the cast of The Stepford Wives who were good with scripted responses and fake smiles. I checked in after the hotel check in time but was told that the room was clean but the mini bar had not been serviced yet. I had a â€˜deluxe canal-view roomâ€™ which was small even by European standards; I hate to see their standard size room. Upon entering the small room, I saw a table top full of open beer bottles and the room had a faint smell of cigarette smoke (supposed to be non-smoking). The room also had little flies and some mosquitoes in it (a sign near window advises to keep it closed since the canals attract insects). This defeated the purpose of paying extra for a canal view. The bed and bedding were left to be desired. They offer a pillow menu with different types of pillows which is nice but it doesnâ€™t help the fact that the bed feels like an IKEA futon mattress. Also, they only put one comforter sheet on the bed which didnâ€™t feel good and made me dream about bed bugs. The TV in the room was a joke; it was no bigger than a computer monitor, about 18â€� small. I get a larger picture on my IPod. This is a shame given the fact that the hotel does have a good selection of channels including free porn - if that gets you going. I also had to reconnect the cable to the back of the TV. It was half way out causing the picture to go in and out. It took me a few minutes of tinkering with the TV before I realized the problem (the front desk couldnâ€™t figure it out). After blasting the air conditioning the room seemed to quickly clear up (bugs & smoke smell). When I returned later in the evening the mini bar was serviced but the free bottles of gin and whiskey were not replenished and near empty. Also the bottles were not sealed, so I was wary of even drinking out of them (if I could bring myself to drink cheap liquor). My first shower (no bathtub) proved to be a daring act as within minutes of my shower the shower hose busted and scalding hot water shot out on to me (aimed at the worse part for a man). I was on the verge of looking like Freddy Kruger after that experience. I complained to them about this and they were generically nice about it and did fix it quickly. Luckily (for them) my bodily discomfort was very temporary and I didnâ€™t have any lasting damage to my umâ€¦ skin. The next day I had their complimentary breakfast in their â€œkitchenâ€� which was okay. The â€œchefâ€� that morning was a woman who had an ugly attitude which was reflected by her face. She couldnâ€™t even give the name of the cheese she was putting the omelets. The â€œFrench Toastâ€� she made was just some stale bread slices with a fried egg on them. This made all of us guest in the â€˜kitchenâ€™ think â€œwhat is this mess?... at the very least put a dash of powdered sugar and cinnamon on them". I highly doubt she was a real chef. She was more like the maid whose turn it was to fry the eggs. The rest of the breakfast offerings were decent - cereals, breads, breakfast meats. The juice and milk were in open containers and left out which made them warm and not so desirable either (but better than the French Toast). The 2nd and 3rd mornings of the stay there was another â€œchefâ€� who was much friendlier but you wonâ€™t find her cooking at any 2 star restaurants either (maybe just eating in them). The quality of room cleaning is also questionable. At 6pm they still had not provided more towels or washcloths as they were â€œstill in laundryâ€�. The floor wasnâ€™t vacuumed and the room wasnâ€™t dusted (during the whole stay). All the maid did was make the bed. The bottles of water, which I drank the night before, were taken out of the trash can where I had placed them, and left on the nightstand next to the bed. What the...? I put them in a plastic bag and placed them in the hallway where they sat until the next morning. The cleaning cart used by housekeeping which I saw in the hallway was no bigger than a hand basket and had a bottle of Windex and two cleaning rags in it. Itâ€™s obvious that housecleaning only did the bare minimum when cleaning the rooms between guest and even less during oneâ€™s stay. Given this was the 3rd hotel on my trip through Europe this hotel fell far behind the others in quality and comfort. The hotel was nothing more than a high priced hostel. They try their hardest to make the hotel feel high â€“end and to make their guest feel â€œat homeâ€�, which Iâ€™ll give some credit for, but I guess they think feel at home is in a housing project. When I return to Amsterdam I will look for other hotels to stay at. The location was good and the â€œfreeâ€� amenities were good (even though you do pay for them within the nightly rate). However, the quality and comfort of the rooms and maid service probably do not outrank those of a low end room in the red-light district. Overall, I was disappointed and had higher expectations for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uubfly
Reviews.Content: I normally stayed in NH hotels when I went to Amsterdam. This time I decided to try the Banks Mansion for a change. The hotel is in an excellent location along a very nice, fairly quiet canal. My room was large (for Euro standards) and had a very comfortable bed. I had room 206 on the front of the hotel ( I believe 106, and 306 are the same), odd shaped but good size and plenty of room. The windows overlooked the canal. During the day the street was a little noisy, all I had to do was close the double windows and it was quiet. At night I would open the windows. The shower in the bath was great, an overhead shower that dumps on your like a waterfall, it was so nice it made it hard to get out of it every morning. Also it had a separate large soaking tub that also was nice to chill in late at night before bed. The included drinks/snacks/wireless were great. It was nice to have Cappuccino in the AM, water throughout the day, and beer whenever I wanted. The room also had decanters of liquor that I did not use because they were in unsealed bottles. How would I know if anyone tampered with them prior to my stay, no thanks. The Breakfast was terrific, very good cooked to order eggs, bacon, sausage, meats, fruits, cheeses, bread, and more. I ate so much for breakfast that I seldom ate much more the remainder of the day. The staff is great, especially Phillip. I was met at the door and given royal treatment on my arrival. I felt right at home and pampered immediately. The staff was available whenever you needed them and were always very helpful and courteous, thank you. I will be back in Amsterdam and I will stay at the Banks again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jorge037
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel in the center of Amsterdam. As we traveled with a 3 year old kid they were very atemptive and gave us a corner room (bigger) so that we felt confortable. The breakfast superb and the receptionist very kindly. The all inclusive concept is a must and how nice it is to return from a tour in the city late afternoon and grab a snack and drink something from the bar. Just a suggestion: Improve the room service. We asked for a cup of milk the first day we arrived and when we left 4 nights later the cup was still in the room! Nevertheless a perfect stay in a trendy and superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwk
Reviews.Content: even prior to getting to amsterdam I had been emailing with the staff to help set up museams, bike rentals, dinner res. they were great in getting it all done..once there it just continued.; our room overlooked the canal...small rooms but typical for a non chain hotel. very comfortable though..nice to have the comp friged in the room as well as liquer out in crystal bottles...the breakfast was great as well..after a long day of wondering the city or biking etc it was really nice to come back to a laid back happy hour with pate, cheese, meats out with wine, proseco or beer. the staff was very helpful..we can't wait to go back again....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: raymo990
Reviews.Content: Just back from a lovely 4 day break in amsterdam,which was made even better by our choice of hotel.We are seasoned traveller's and have stayed in most citys in europe.what made our stay in the Banks one of the best was the friendly staff who couldn't do enough for us from start to finish,however we didnt feel like they were in our face all the time.The breakfast was great and so was all the free drink and nibbles.The banks is situated over looking the beautiful gentlemans cancel in one of the nicer areas but very close to everything (we walked to most things).Everything about our stay was great i would difinitly recomened the Banks.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: wimbrussel
Reviews.Content: After two stays at the Bank Mansion over the past 4 months, this hotel clearly ranks among the better choices for a trip to Amsterdam. The location is very central and the hotel can easily be reached by public transport (tram stop outside the door). Rooms are quiet and spacious (do ask for a room facing the back of the hotel, though), beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are gems. Frank Lloyd Wright, Macintosh or Berlage aficionados will very much feel at home - the decoration is consistent throughout the hotel (watch out for those psychedelic carpets and curtains). The overall aim to create a 'homely' feel works out very well: the large lounge with open bar is perfect for both relaxing and business talks, free drinks and snacks feel like a treat. Breakfast is varied, large and good. The hotel's quality control also showed when a billing error occurred after my first stay: they were most correct about promptly reimbursing the extra claimed sum. In all: not cheap (rock bottom price is 149 euro per night) but definitely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND AND STAY AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-in-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel certainly met expectations, great location, friendly helpful staff, good breakfast..all you would need for a weekend break and more. The extras offered is a lovely addition to the normal, it is really nice to have had a full day out and return to the 'free' bar to enjoy a glass of wine or two and again upon returning from your evening out to enjoy a night cap! We also hired bikes for our 3 night dtay and certainly found that this was the best way of getting around Amsterdam, quickly and safely believe it or not! All in all we had a fantastic trip and should we return again to Amsterdam there would be no hesitation in booking at Banks Mansion!

Reviews.Title: “Business As Usual”
Reviews.Author: sgavik
Reviews.Content: It was supposed to be a very good place for business meeting and stay, but i didn't find it great enough. Banquoet hall was nothing great, service was mediocre and food was average. Overall not a very nice experience to talk about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ppasknuj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great location, very clean, tons of amenities. Convenient to flower market, tram, restaurants, and within walking distance to most major attractions. Staff was always available and very friendly and helpful. Offered help with baggage, called for a taxi, had helpful information, etc. Very pleasant. Revolving door is a little tricky, but there's a wide, regular door right next to it for moving luggage through easily. Room was bigger than expected, with VERY comfortable beds, pillows, chairs, etc. The bathroom was great, very clean, very nice. No view, but didn't request one, so that's OK. Minibar in room is complimentary (especially nice in Europe, where a soda or water can cost you a small fortune) and there's a very nice bar area with drinks, candy, and snacks in the lobby. There are also computers with internet for no charge, plus a printer, always helpful. Breakfast is included and was pretty good. Not the cheapest place to stay, but well worth the bit of extra expense

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great amenities, great location”
Reviews.Author: scott92
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the internet rather than our travel agent. We were very happy with the room; small but deluxe, canal view, shower in bathroom. The service was excellent after the front desk staff warmed up to us a little(we stayed three nights). The rates are super for the quality of the rooms, breakfast and snacks are included as well as liquor and soft drinks-anytime!!! They also did not charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel is top-drawer and more than we dared to hope for for an 'internet pick'.”
Reviews.Author: kathmm
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the front door until chieck out everything was exceptional. THe service is superb - including an e-mail request sent a week before the trip related to tub vs shower bathroom. The front desk assured us up front that the request was recived and honored! Beautiful room, large beautiful bathroom, all spotlessly clean and well appointed amenities. Service was exceptional in dealing with any request quickly and with a smile. Breakfast included is large, fresh and with an on-site chef cooking to order; decanters of spirits in the room - as well as an open mini-fridge is included. Tea and late afternoon wine, cheese, nets, etc as well as an open coofee and juice bar are included as well. Does not get better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5th Anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeandSandra
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Banks Mansion for our 5th wedding anniversary trip after a lot of research, we thought it offered the best value for a quality hotel and we weren't disappointed. We arrived at 09.30 on the 30th April, when we booked we didn't know about Queens Day, and as roads around hotel were all closed we were very fortunate that the Conexxions hotel shuttle bus driver managed to get through several checkpoints and dropped us at the canal bridge outside the hotel. I explained to the receptionist that i was aware check in was 3pm and asked to use the luggage room, she asked us to have a seat in the lounge and within 10 minutes we had checked in and were in our canal view room,we were even given breakfast as well. The room was clean and well kept with a nice view of the canal. The room has free minibar and 3 decanters containingwhisky/gin/congnac. There is also an ice machine and a shoe cleaner opposite the lift. Breakfast is served up to 10.30 (11am on a Sunday) the breakfasts were excellent.
