The lounge also has complimentary bar and 2 internet desks connected to a printer. There is a luggage room and each bag is tagged and you are given a serial numbered receipt so its very secure. The hotel location is excellent it should only be 20-30 minutes to places such as Central Station/Anne Frank House (we had prebooked Anne frank House on internet for the 30th unaware of the birthday festivities and it took us over an hour to weave through the huge crowds that line the canals watching watching the brighly decorated boats and their occupants having a grerat time. Everywhere is bright orange and it is an excellent spectacle, everyone is friendly and having a great time (we certainly did!!) Anne Frank House is a must see it is well worth a visit we also visited Rembrandt house which again we felt was good value. It was our anniversary on 1st May and had booked a table at the Kelderhof restaurant which was a 10 minute stroll away, The meal was lovely and we were well attended to, we reserved for 8pm and there were a few tables still available but these were all occupied by 9pm. The staff even remembered my booking was for an anniversary and brought sparklers to to the table with our desserts. We enjoyed our 3 nights in Amsterdam, the weather was good as well and as we still have other places to see we will return and stay at the Banks Mansion again. We used the Connexxions shuttle bus service which was 45 Euros return for 2 howver I think next time we will get train to Central station and a tram (16 or 24) which stops almost outside hotel as this would be much cheaper plus arrive the day before Queens Day as no trams operate on that route each 30th April.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: SolusIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband recently spent 4 nights in Banks mansion (in the middle of April) and had a wonderful time. I would say that I am quite 'picky' when it comes to accomodation but Banks Mansion did not disappoint ! Having read a number of reviews on trip advisor, I was prepared for the small sized room, but in saying that we found it very comfortable. We had a canal view room which I would highly recommend, which had a lovely view and was also quite. The all inclusive policy at the hotel was really nice - helping ourselves to a hot or cold drinks when we returned to the hotel during the day and at night had a very homely feel. There was also chocolates, & cheese and crackers in the foyer at certain times during the day, again included in the price. 'The hotel is in a great location - the Mayor only lives on the next street ! The only thing I would say is that breakfast was a little limited in terms of variety, so we only ate there on the first morning (even though it was included in the price). But overall I would recommend the hotel and we will stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I'm not sure what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: teppy83
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion is a hotel of a good standard, with all the room facilities you would expect and clean, modern furniture. My room was a little smaller than I would have liked, but it was quiet and the staff were very helpful. Of course, the free in-room mini-bar and facilities in reception earn this place a LOT of brownie points and make it good value, which is a rare thing in Amsterdam! Apart from that though, there is nothing remarkable about this place. Oh, apart from the fast food style room-service, which is both very limited and truly, truly awful! There are plenty of restaurants in this area of town though. Generally a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: avalonbride36
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Banks Mansion and had an excellent experience. We arrived early morning after a long flight and although couldn't check into out room, the staff offered us breakfast and held on to our luggage until check in was available. Our room was great, the bathroom was spacious and the shower was great - plenty of hot water and good pressure. We loved the free drinks in the lobby and in the room and the breakfast was varied and plentiful. The location was wonderful - we walked to almost everywhere we wanted to go. When we needed to use a tram (as we did when arriving at the train station), we found the right one easily enough and the stop was a 1/2 block from the hotel. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who travels to Amsterdam, and will probably stay here next time I return!

Reviews.Title: “The good, bad (including black toilet paper)and "whoa- that is insane"”
Reviews.Author: texan75225
Reviews.Content: Let's go in reverse order for this one. I booked the Banks Mansion based on reviews from "Trip Advisor" Here is the "whoa- that is insane" first. Upon finding the hotel (which was a crazy ordeal in itself) I ran in and asked about parking. The lady at the desk said to park in the garage across the street and down behind the "Jolly Carlton" Hotel. She gave no mention of the price- probably because there was no other choice.So we had to "self park" in a parking garage across a very busy street and two blocks down from the Banks Mansion. There is no valet service if you drive. DON'T DRIVE HERE. Repeat DON'T DRIVE HERE. The absolutely claustrophobic garage made you drive into a tiny elevator with your car (a new one for me) and go to the roof and park in a tiny spot (only one left) very unnerving. We parked, had to board the elevator with a lady in a car and with our bags, and had to cross a busy street after two blocks, walk into the hotel, carry our bags up stairs, and enter the revolving door. SERVICE IS DEAD. We were there for 2 nights. After checking out of the hotel, my friend was too scared to drive our rented BMW out of the garage so I drove. We were DUMBFOUNDED at the cost. 90 EUROS FOR TWO NIGHTS. That's right, over $140 (even with the stronger dollar) for parking. We are lucky we could afford it and were splitting it, but this was a NASTY SHOCK. I would stay in a hotel with valet parking next time just for this parking insanity if I drove in to Amsterdam. The bad- our room safe was broken. This is a MAJOR inconvenience to me as I travel with a LOT of cash at times. I am an antique dealer, go to markets, and carry cash. I always check to see that the hotels I stay in have a ROOM SAFE for this reason. The Banks Mansion had them but ours was broken and no solution offered after two people had looked at it other than "you can put your documents in an envelope and we will put them in the safe downstairs" They had no other room with two beds for us to check into. Obviously I was not going to hand this woman $10k in cash and say "here you go". Also bad- the beds were foam and very uncomfortable. We had a nice corner room with canal view but did not sleep well either night. The funniest bad thing- the BLACK toilet paper in the downstairs powder room. I won't elaborate on this. It is just a bad idea. Wipe and find out for yourself. Praise God they were smart enough to have white toilet paper in the upstairs bedrooms. The good- location is very good to walk to the Reiksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Rembrandthaus Museum (which we did) all are HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Location is also good for walking to restaurants. The lobby is nice and the free internet computers is a BIG PLUS. They were usually occupied, but I found time to use them and check my e-mails. Breakfast was good and nice to have included in the room bill. They made the most of the breakfast room in the basement with no natural light. It is 100% self-serve and I prefer a bit of service at least for hot tea or coffee. Free mini bar and booze was nice but we only drank water so would not use this as a selling point to book here, unless you are a big drinker and boy this hotel caters to some big party people. There were some WASTED Brits who entered at night and were very loud and obnoxious (not sure if they were only drunk or had been drugging). The group came in one night about ten when I was in the lobby and using the computer. They had to pull one woman away from the jars of sweets and they were very rowdy. I put this in the "bad" category because I came here with a friend so see the sights, not to party but if you are a party person or big drinker, you will LOVE the free booze in this hotel. It is in the lobby and in your room. Drink free until you drop (which some guests here do.) I can see how some guests ADORE this hotel. Under the circumstances of my trip, it was not for me and I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiAesthete
Reviews.Content: Banks mansion is very well located. VEry central. The rooms are cosy. The bathrooms are very well sized. The rooms could be a little more spacious although there is everything in it that one would desire in a first class hotel. What is great about this hotel is that drinks in the lobby are free and so are snacks there. Internet is free as well. The breakfast is mediocre. The service is functional. The suggestions on restaurants is very poor. Its very good value for money and great for a business stay or a short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to declare : perfect!”
Reviews.Author: aliaslili
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 great nights at the Banks Mansion: location is the best, near all the typical small shopping streets of Amsterdam (9 streets). Even if the hotel is located on the corner of two main "roads" the location was so quite (tram stop at 50m). We had a big room 206 (corner room), very clean with big shower & bath. The all-in concept for drinks is such an added value: back from shopping, thirsty in the morning, everything is included in your room or in the lobby. Breakfast is superb (lot of choice and fresh). But the most valuable aspect of the hotel is THE STAFF : they are helpful, friendly & polite. We'll come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, everything is free!”
Reviews.Author: Setup1
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel very much. Everything is free: free bar in the lobby, free interent and free mini bar in the room. The room was clean, nice LCD screen and a great shower. The hotel is located not quite in the center, but 10-15 minutes walk from everything.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CATracey
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Banks and probably won't be my last. There are so many wonderful things about this hotel, but I won't bother going over it, since it's all been said in previous reviews. What I would say to someone considering staying here is that the rooms facing the canal are on the small side, not uncomfortably so, but if you prefer a larger room, forgo the canal view and get a room on the other side, they are much, much larger (room 210 for example). To the hotel: Breakfast this time around seemed a bit on the skimpy side compared to my last stay. Still good. Still sufficient. But less to choose from. And what happened to the dutch pancakes? Also, I said it on my last review, and I'll say it again. For a hotel known for it's "all inclusive" concept, how can this not extend to internet? Yes, the computers in the lobby are free, but this doesn't benefit people traveling with their work on laptops. 15.95 euros for a day pass...come on Banks, you can do better than this. I'm still crazy about this hotel and would stay here again and again without the slightest thought of staying elsewhere the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very efficient and always willing to help. The hotel was nicely decorated and clean. The breakfasts were outstanding. We were able to order a hot breakfast every morning. The tram lines 24 and 16 were just outside the hotel so getting everywhere was very convenient. The floating Flower Market was just on the next corner. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, free bar”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I just finished a two-night stay at the Banks Mansion. I really liked it. Here's why: Location: After flying into Schipol, I took the train to Central Station and then took the tram (16 or 24) from the station four stops right to the hotel. The hotel is located off of the super-touristry district and more on the edge of a residential area, which makes is much nicer in my opinion. I bought my tram ticket (the Streifenkarte--but that's German, not Dutch) at the book/magazine shop in Schipol, behind Tourist Information). So really, it cost me about 5 euros to get from Schipol to the hotel. The Free Drinks Policy: It was so great to check in and then help myself to a Sprite in the mini bar and not have it cost me 5 euros. I drank all the bottled water, all the Sprite, and the Sparkling Water. I couldn't stop! It was great. Also, there's whiskey, gin, and cognac in the rooms. For free! In the evenings, there's beer, wine spirits, and snacks in the lobby area. Really nice. The Shower: Rainforest showerhead. Slippers/Robe: Provided! Oh, and great towels. Bath sheets. The Rooms: I was in 202, and it was small. But I was also paying the lowest rate. That being said, it was so QUIET and so DARK! It was great. The black-out curtains were awesome. The Breakfast: So I've stayed in a lot of hotels that include a buffet breakfast. Usually, you have to pay extra for a hot breakfast. At The Banks Mansion, I had a ham and cheese omelete one morning (excellent) and French Toast the next morning (average). But still, I thought this was an excellent touch. Downsides: Pay for Internet sucks. And I got a bit screwed in that I paid for 100 minutes, and they didn't give me my free 50 minutes, so I had to get that later after I had already used my 100 minutes. Rooms are a bit worn around the edges 202 was a bit small. It was fine though, honestly. But if I were American (I am!) and this was my first time abroad (it's not), I might be offended by the smallness.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: peterharwich
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here and another memorable experience. Wonderful lobby, friendly staff, great rooms, lovely breakfast and a great location near the Flower Market. Difficult to fault.

Reviews.Title: “don't miss the hotel bar”
Reviews.Author: sean_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, can't fault the hotel & staff. We had a room at the back of the hotel it was really quiet. Right in the centre of a great part of Amsterdam. Don't miss the hotel bar even though a bit naughty of them not to sell draught beer!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: markpb
Reviews.Content: On the strength of all the great reviews on TA, I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The hotel is everything all the other reviews say it is: great location, nice lobby, fantastic rooms, very friendly and very helpful staff. I found breakfast a bit disconcerting because it's so informal but once you get used to it, it's great and food is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Friendly Service, Good Value....”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAW
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family (of 4) in two rooms for a three day city break. Apart from the fact that we requested adjacent rooms on booking and didn't get them when we checked in we thought this was a really great hotel. They did everything they could to resolve the rooming issue and managed to get us settled quickly. They allowed us to check in early and were happy for us to relax in the main lounge when we picked up our luggage later on in the day well after we had checked out. The inclusive breakfast was among the best I have experienced in any hotel worldwide and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable with everything you could want. The very best part for me was the fully inclusive experience of the hotel - Nothing worse than getting to hotel bill to find numerous extras for nothing worthwhile. The open bar in the lounge was a real treat which created a very relaxed atmosphere for a pre dinner drink and/or nightcap. The location was perfect with trams linking every part of town just outside. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. We will certainly go back and would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality four star hotel, well located, professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: ManontheMoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 'Banks' for a four night period, reserving a canal view at a price of Euro159 per night. In my view the hotel provided good quality for this price, particularly in comparison to several other 4/5 star hotels in this city. Location is good, on the classy herengracht canal. The number 16 tram (and others) stops very near by. The free use of a small bar in the reception area is a nice touch as is the presence of a dvd player as standard in all rooms. The kitchen serves an ok breakfast but not formal dinner. However, given the multitude of options nearby this is not an issue. Room service is limited - from when I was there this seemed limited to some noodles and ice cream from a nearby vendor. My only gripe is the lack of free wi-fi - it is available for a price but given the concept of this hotel I would have expected no charge. Nevertheless Banks Manison will be a define option for me on return visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: MarkandSusanOC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Banks Mansion for 5 nights over new years. From the moment we arrived, we felt extremely comfortable and welcome. Our room was not ready when we arrived (it was 10.30 in the morning!) but our bags were taken and we were shown to the refreshment area where we had a well needed drink. We then went for a stroll and came back an hour later and our room was ready. The room was small but the bathroom huge. It had everything you need, including the free mini-bar which is a great touch. The hotel itself is in the perfect location in Amsterdam. It is within walking distance of the city centre but just far enough away that it is that little bit quieter. You can also walk in the opposite direction and be at the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum in 10 minutes. The best thing about this hotel, though, is the staff. All the staff we encountered (especially Nancy and Pamela) were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We hope to return to Amsterdam one day and when we do we will stay no-where other than Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great ambience”
Reviews.Author: Rich288
Reviews.Content: I had a slightly 'rocky' start to my stay. I contacted the hotel twice, made the booking which they failed to confirm. The third telephone call made up for their mistake; upgraded room and a better rate! After a direct flight from Sydney (35 hours) I very happy that their reception was friendly and efficient. I was given a corner room overlooking the canal and street, plenty of space for Amsterdam, great bed and well furnished. (Spend a bit more to book a canal room.). The mini-bar is free and well stocked, a pleasant change from the prices of most mini-bars! They have a "living room" rather than a lobby, it has an open bar, coffee, nibbles all day and canapes from about 5.30pm, fire, plenty of lounges and arm chairs, Dutch and English newspapers and magazines. For a single traveller the friendly, low key atmosphere made it easy to strike up conversations with other guests. It has a perfect location 1.5 blocks from the Flower Market and 3 minute walk to the shopping precinct south of Dam Square. Breakfast is always included the rate, plenty of variety including eggs anyway cooked to order. This hotel cares about making your stay, personal, warm and friendly, it was summed by the advice reception gave me when I asked the way to the Rijksmuseum; the most direct route is...; but if you have time walk here for great antique shops, here for fashion, try this coffee shop etc." I won't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travulator
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Banks Mansion very much. It's a mid sized hotel, about 40 rooms. My room was a canal view room on the top (fourth) floor. It was nice, albeit small. I was traveling alone, so the twin bed was fine, particularly comfortable with good pillows. The bathroom is very nice, and the shower head is a like a huge watering can. The lobby has a sitting area, as well as a bar with cold drinks, a coffee machine, liquor, and some small snacks at all times. All is complementary as is the minibar in the room, which has several cold drinks and three spirits. There are two computers in the lobby for free internet use, and you get a free 50 minute wifi connection to a hotspot type internet service, which is much faster than the lobby computers. More time can be purchased. There are European outlets in the rooms and one UK outlet at the desk. Breakfast was very good, and presented as described by the hotel. The location was ideal. The hotel is on a canal in a nice area in the southern canal belt, close to the city center. It is walking distance from busy areas, but its block is quiet and subdued. Trams are close by--either a one minute or five minute walk--depending on which line you take. Taking the tram to the train station (and on to the airport) was very easy, but I had carry-on luggage. A great hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - a real find in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Downunder
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on two occasions, each for one night, on business. This is a top quality hotel in a great location in Amsterdam (right on one of Amsterdam's lovely canals). The staff were helpful, friendly and polite from the minute I walked in the door and till the minute I left. Not speaking Dutch is no problem as all the staff I spoke to have excellent English skills. The room was tastefully and stylishly decorated. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom facilities were well presented and very clean. The room was typical size for European hotels, but I didn't actually feel cramped or cluttered, and the furnishings and decor were really attractive and created a pleasant atmosphere. It is the little things that really make this place stand out. For example, there is a small minibar in the room - and it's completely included. There are spirits, beer, wine - all included in the price. Downstairs in the lounge, near reception, there is also a drinks/nibbles bar, from mid-afternoon onwards, where you can get free drinks and nibbles. No charge for anything - that includes more expensive drinks like Baileys, Tia Maria, etc as well as a range of wines, beers, and other spirits. There is also a nice selection of nibblies (cheese, crackers, nuts, olives). The hotel provides two internet browsing stations in the lounge - and they're free to use, as well. And breakfast is also included in the room rate. Breakfast is great - a very good selection of cereals, fruits, cold meats, and some hot food (bacon, sausages) and they will make you your eggs however you like them (scrambled, fried, omelette etc). It really conveys a much more personal feel than most hotels in most big cities. It's also quite conveniently located - about a 10 minute walk to Anne Frank's house (and the Prinsengracht area in general, which borders on the lovely Jordaan region, with lots of interesting shops, small streets, cafes), very close to the flower market, and the canal bus has a stop not too far away (fantastic option when you're too tired to do any more walking!) Overall, this was a real find. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Nothing ever seemed too much trouble for the staff, and the quality and service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Service”
Reviews.Author: Travelling0ldie
Reviews.Content: The Banks Mansion was exactly as advertised. A truly comfortable stay in the heart of Amsterdam. The staff were clea rly very well trained as well as being excellent linguists. They looked after our every need without being in the least servile. They clearly understood the meaning of hospitality and professionalism.One word of warning, we booked our one night through Expedia, two days before we travelled, they charged us Â£50 extra so book direct! Expedia refused to make a refund.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelreviewer_C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels around Europe over the last few years, and at Bank Mansion I had my best ever hotel experience. In a world full of soulless chains and dives, this character laden gem is really one of a kind. We visited the hotel (couple, mid twenties) Nov '08 on a short weekend trip to Amsterdam. The staff were very kind, courteous and as everything in the hotel was complementary, I feel that they treated all customers the same. Free Bar! Seriously. Couldn't believe it. Beer in the fridges, wine on ice, bottles of spirits, mixers, coffee machine and always a selection of nibbles (cheese, nuts, olives, etc). Free drinks in the room as well!!! Other reviewers complained about the size of the room, room service options etc. But they obviously chose the wrong hotel for their needs. I hate being ripped off, so I never order room service or use minibars, or watch pay per view films. Here there were no hidden charges. No charge for Breakfast, minibar, bar, internet etc. It drives me up the wall when you book a posh hotel for a hefty sum and are forced to pay extra to use the internet or watch a film or whatever. So I suppose it's all relative. Some won't like this hotel. But I stand by what I said earlier, you are treated better at Banks Mansion because nobody is paying extra. The staff don't look down at you because you haven't racked up a massive drinks/food bill or aren't booking in for hourly herbal massage treatments. With all the conventions, hidden charges etc, I've found it hard to be truly comfortable in highly rated 5 star hotels that I've visited. Others: Room was nice, stylish. Bathroom gorgeous. No view, but didn't request one (2 day stay in November....) Lobby and "Living room" area were also very stylish and comfortable. Nice realistic gas fire. Some lovely furniture throughout the hotel too. Breakfast is as good as you will get on the continent. Omelettes/Pancakes/Eggs all made fresh for you (no extra charge) Very nice area. If you, like us want a comfortable base from where to explore the city where you can unwind with a free drink or more and are not overly concerned about over rated 5 star luxuries, then book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: YMLSydney
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in great location in Amsterdam. We spent most days out and about and would drop in to the hotel for 'lunch/afternoon' tea from the complimentary all day open bar (drinks and snacks plus internet access) and head back out again all afternoon until pre-dinner drinks at the hotel bar again! So we probably saved a bit of money on lunches and cocktails and it was very nice to have a sense of feeling 'at home' in the hotel without having to put our hands into our pockets for everything. Rooms are a little squeezy but clean and tasteful. If you are going to Amsterdam, hiring a bicycle for the duration is a great idea as you can cover lots of ground and even head on out to their lovely countryside in no time. This is a very nice hotel if you want a very comfortable and convenient stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bar”
Reviews.Author: minxypinxy
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal - the all inclusive drinks package was amazing Rooms very stylish - all art deco Breakfast was good - made to order eggs and pancakes location near flower market - bit of a walk into the city centre but ok once you figured out the trams

Reviews.Title: “Sort of Ridiculous but with some upside.”
Reviews.Author: nolarolla
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I found it hard in general to find a nice room in Amsterdam from the information you can find on the internet; just didnâ€™t seem like allot of options out there for how I like to roll. Ok hereâ€™s the beef nobody seems to be talking about on this Thread; the rooms are VERY SMALL, maybe one of the smallest rooms for the $ I have ever stayed in. This next grievance might not matter for everybody, but I really like to use the Internet in my room on my computer, and they have this bogus scratch off card racket to use the Internet wirelessly; otherwise you can use the free computers downstairs. Ok. Ok. The final negative thing I will say is if you are the type of person who might want to sleep in one day and dial up some room service; not happening, instead they have three options. Noodles, Ice Cream and Champagne. Really weird combo but did make me laugh hysterically for about a hour when I saw it. The upsides are great location, free minibar and open bar in the lobby , as well as a good free breakfast. the staff was helpful and nice . Overall we had a great time in Amsterdam and really enjoyed this location if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Another tripadvisor triumph!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor strikes again! We booked this hotel because of the reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. Its in a great location in a nice part of Amsterdam close to all the major sights. We had a canal view room which was nice, but maybe not worth the extra money - depends on how highly you value these things I suppose. The rooms are also not that big, as other reviewers have said, although I don't think this is uncommon for Amsterdam. It was clean and the staff were always really friendly. The hotel has a free bar downstairs in the lobby where you can help yourself to free drinks - tea, coffee, alcohol, soft drinks - all day. There are also small snacks available depending on the time of day. It was a really nice touch and gave the place some life - sometimes hotel bars can be a bit desolate but this one always had a good atmosphere. There are no extra charges for most things - including minibar and breakfast. The breakfast was really good - lots of choice and nice quality food. Overall we were really happy with our stay and felt we had excellent value for money given everything that was included. We'd stay here again if we were back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: dadsasdasd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in September'08. Had a room overlooking the canal, even though the room was located at 4th floor and the window was such a small one that you couldn't actually see the canal other than standing right next to the window. Room was not the biggest possible, but good enough for myself. Small LCD TV and DVD player included. Room had a free minibar (incl. Beck's beer) & 3 free additional bottles of booze. Bar in the lobby also included in the room price. Nice :-) Generally speaking everything in the hotel was in good shape and clean. Breakfast was quite good with a variety of offerings. Housekeeping didn't bother me once despite sleeping very late and also otherwise the staff was very friendly and helpful. Weather in late September was absolutely awful, rain rain and more rain. But there's nothing the hotel can do about it, I guess :-) Location was fine, walking distance from center station (20min though not with any heavy luggage) and lots of trams going just by the hotel. Not a pure 5 star super-Ã¼ber-luxury hotel as such, though. So don't expect that and you'll be fine. Would I return there? Yes, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Euro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markwb
Reviews.Content: Yes, it was indeed a nice hotel. Drinks and snacks in the room and lobby were entirely complementary. As the reviews said, it was a very pleasant hotel, with friendly staff always looking to help. Room was clean, and well looked after. bed was comfortable, and I had a view of the canal, and veranda doors that opened to them. Very nice. Very close to the city centre, a 5-10 minute walk. A small LCD TV attached to the wall was nice, and the shower and toilet was good too. Good pressure, and large sink. Really no complaints at all, as it was very good, and nothing bad can really be said about this place. Perhaps the price could have been too much, but it was booked by our clients so I can't comment on that. Lobby was very nice and 2 computers were down there for internet connection. Dont know if there was wireless in the rooms. But was very nice in the lobby just to relaz and read the paper.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jazna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Banks Mansion and what a treat!! It was very clean and close enough to all the major attractions. The room was small but what room isn't in Europe. The bathroom and room was clean and comfortable and that was all that mattered. Also, the free mini bar and breakfast in the morning was awesome. I would definitely stay at the Banks Mansion again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: haggisheed
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 night at end of aug 08 Did a lot of searching on trip advisor first. a good location I had looked at dam square originally for accomodation and was put of by the likely noise and was right to stay a little further away from the square. we walked from central station to the hotel took 30 mins however taxi is less than 10 euro. trams stop very close to hotel also. good accomodation. excellent breakfast. bar in lounge a nice concept .staff friendly . we were upgraded when we arrived to a canal view so very happy with that. found it was cheaper to book through hotel website direct. my tip ref the anne frank house book online much easier no queuing. when we arrived at our alloted time straight in. the other queue was round the corner of the building so glad we pre booked the tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: CWYC
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on a weekend away and I would thoroughly recommend it. It â€˜does what is says on the tinâ€™ - itâ€™s not a hip or luxury boutique hotel by any stretch of the imagination but it is comfortable and it is very convenient, hence I gave it a 4. The front-desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Check-in was quick and the receptionist took us up to the room. We stayed in a canal view room (room 206) which was basically at the apex of the building above the front entrance overlooking the corner of Herengracht and Vijzelstraat. It was a triangular shaped room and while not huge, it wasnâ€™t poky. The interiors are pleasant enough although not my style. The furniture is a cherry-wood colour and the wardrobes and bedside cabinets have art deco style floral stained glass panels. Breakfast was a standard buffet type affair with a small menu that is cooked-to-order and it was all very nice. The â€˜Living Roomâ€™ area in the lobby and is a nice touch â€“ free drinks (including branded alcohol) and snacks at all times of the day. Oh, and the mini-bar in the room is also free. Unusual for a hotel in this price range. We loved the location of this hotel on Herengracht, which is beautiful, and the hotel is about 5 minutes walk to the Golden Curve. Itâ€™s convenient to walk to most of the major museums within 20 minutes. There are 3 tram lines from outside the hotel which are also very handy. Oh, and thereâ€™s a Canalbus stop on Herengracht about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The only downside we experienced was that the housekeeping staff knocked on our door at 9.45am on Sunday morning to ask when they would be able to clean our room. Given that we were checking out that day, and check-out is at 12pm, we thought that was a bit unnecessary. On the whole though, we enjoyed our stay - it was fuss, and hassle free and we will stay there again next time we go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere special”
Reviews.Author: Moley8
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a last minute stay at the Banks Mansion and from the moment the reservation was made, the staff proved how important it is to make the customer feel special. We had a problem with the credit card when booking and the following day the hotel made contact, by telephone as well as email, and ensured that the reservation was made without worrying about taking a deposit. We arrived pretty early on our first day and intended to drop our bags and run, but the lovely Nena told us the room was nearly ready and showed us down to the breakfast room and offered us complimentary breakfast while we waited. How often does that happen....??! The room was a large room on the ground floor, facing the road, when we enquired about moving Nena was only too happy to look at the other rooms and quickly moved us up to the 2nd floor, overlooking the canal. The room was small and the art deco style might not be to everyones taste but it was very clean, comfortable and with the lovely bathroom and huge shower with rainfall head it was perfect. A well stocked, complimentary(!!), minibar with additional decanters of spirits, robes and flipflop slippers were the icing on the cake. The 'living room' area in reception offers complimentary wines, beers, spirirts and hot drinks along with snacks and newspapers so you can chill out after a long day exploring this fantastic city. The staff were excellent throughout our 2 night stay and nothing was too much trouble for them. As we had an early morning flight home, Nena organised cereals, milk and fruit to be left in our room the night before. Again, nothing proved to be too much trouble and the staff were genuinely happy to help. We will definitely stay here again when we next visit Amsterdam, which might not be too far away.....

Reviews.Title: “Terrific small hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtgoug
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in July at the Banks Mansion. Staff could not have been more helpful. Nice, relaxing ambiance. Very friendly. The location is central but still removed enough from the frenzy of the city center. Rooms are clean, very comfortable and canal side rooms have great views. The hotel has been decorated with care. Really one of the nicer hotel experiences we have had in a long time. Staff seemed completely dedicated to service and were exceptionaly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few hotels worth repeated visits in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dpglasgow
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel on three occasions and it has never disappointed. It's comfortable, classy without being pretentious, and each time the staff have been very helpful. But the best thing of all is that drinks and snacks are absolutely free. At first we couldn't quite grasp the idea that a hotel would give you free drinks in your room (yes, including alcoholic ones) and a wide range of free drinks in the 'Living' area downstairs, including wines, beers, soft drinks and coffee, supplemented by a range of nibbles that changes over the course of the day. I've noticed that other Carlton hotels don't do this - it seems that only in Amsterdam do they trust guests not to abuse the privilege. It makes for a very relaxing experience. The hotel really is everything it says on its website.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: DopeyUK
Reviews.Content: I read all the relavant reviews on tripadvisor and decided Banks Mansion would suit us. It was a lovely experience. From check-in the staff are lovely - its like staying with friends. The lounge is like a comfortable airline business class lounge with coffee, tea, wine, snacks, spirits, chocolates and sweets. Free mini bar in the room. Room was perfect, taps in the bathroom I agree with others are funny but not serious Breakfast was a great selection of proteins and carbs. Nice situation will stay again. They have scooter hire for those interested. Very clean. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: I did wonder if this hotel was all it was written up to be but I was most pleasantly surprised to find not only a really nice very clean property but also very friendly and helpful staff. Our room (canal view) was small but adequate and at least it was not a faceless who cares what city this is, this is the room type of larger chains. Wehad 6 pieces of luggage in the room and we still were ok - just. The bed was very comfy and the linens were nice. Excellent toileteries are provided so no need to pack them and a lot of goodies in the minibar and 3 decanters (gin, whisky and brandy) meant we needed for nothing. Breakfasts were very good - very wide choice and a lady ready to cook anything egg based for you as you required. The breakfast room has a lovely "farm kitchen" feel to it and the breads and coffee are really good. It is a bit disconcerting when you arrive as no porter will jump out to help you, but as soon as the reception staff realise you are there, they will jump into assistance (note there is a short flight of 9 stairs to the front door so if you are in a wheelchair this is not the hotel for you I am sorry to say as I could not see any ramped access to the hotel) Reception staff are excellent and chat with you any time you are having a drink (if you want them to that is) they are very helpful and will always draw maps to help you find your way around We found the location excellent as it is midway between Dam Square and the Museums so we were not a long walk in either direction Although the street adjacent has trams we never heard them at night (we are light sleepers too) so either they run very quietly or the soundproofing is amazing. There are a few restaurants near by which we did not try but others in the hotel said were very good We asked the hotel to fix up a candelit wine cruise for us and they did well on this as it was cheaper than anything we had found on line and was a very good trip. At the end of our stay they fixed up a minivan to take us to the cruise terminal and again the price was very reasonable so do not worry about using their recommendations for trips, taxis etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieSouthWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great inside and out. Wonderful staff, Lovely clean rooms. Free drinks in rooms and also drinks and snacks in the lobby plus free internet access. The breakfast is worth having, again staff are frienly and plenty of choice and all taste good. The hotel is based in a quiet part of city but still close to everything. plenty of resturants and bars about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: gemsstock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Banks Mansion and once again, the reviewers on Tripadvisor had it spot on. The location of the hotel is perfect and all the main spots within easy reach. We were received very well by very professional receptionists, in fact the service throughout our stay was exceptionally well, especially in a city not renowned for the friendliness of the service in general. We had a room on the first floor with canal view. The room was not particularly large and for our taste a little too crowded with furniture, but I guess for Amsterdam it was acceptable. We were however told that the street view rooms, though cheaper, were larger but decided not to bother. I think if I went back to the Banks Mansion, I would go for a larger and less expensive street view room. The bed was ok, aircondition was appreciated in the heat of the summer. I agree with comments on the bathroom, nice but on the small side as well, the tabs were not user friendly. The principle of including all side costs in the hotel price is attractive, the minibar was well equipped with drinks, the lobby bar came with an excellent coffee machine and snacks. Breakfast selection was not enormous, but what was on offer was of excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We loved it! As stated in the other reviews cocktails and snacks were included. The only thing I did not care for was that we had no coffee maker in the room, but they had a great coffee machine in the lobby. We had a quiet room overlooking the canal. The rooms were small by American standards but comfy. I loved the slippers, Japanese in style, darling. We stayed at the Marriott the last trip to Amsterdam and were disappointed, but the Banks mansion was great! We would stay again in a heartbeat. Staff was attentive and breakfast was very good , consistent with much more expensive hotels. The little restaurant across the street had great indonesian food and was good after a long flight from California. We stayed for two nights before a cruise and will most likely stay there again on our next trip over.

Reviews.Title: “The best in AMS”
Reviews.Author: bbigdaddy
Reviews.Content: If you have a 5 star reservation in any hotel in amsterdam, cancel it! This is the place for you. Let's start with the staff. I was greeted by the front desk as if they knew me. Check in was quick. I was given a room key. Before being escorted to my room I was given a tour of the "Living area". This is where drinks and snacks are placed during the day for you to enjoy. It's free! I'm talkin' bottled water (gas or no gas), beer, soda, wine, champagne, juice and coffee. I was then shown to my room by a wonderful hostess who explained all the room goodies. Mini bar items. Free. beer, soda, fruit drinks and water. The bed was neat. A flat screen TV. DVD player. Movies are in the hotel video library. Free. Is this for real? I am then shown the bathroom. Wow! If you have traveled Europe, you know baths are not large. That is not true here. The Rain shower head was different along with a hand held body sprayer. The sink was modern and big. The towels big and fluffy. There are speakers in the bathroom cieling from the media center. I brought some cd's to play in the dvd player. It was nice to hear music in the bathroom insted of TV. My tour came to an end with my guide telling me about the great breakfast served every morning. Pastries, cereals, meats and made to order eggs and omlets. Free again. Bed was great, breakfast outstanding (free newspapers). Hotel is on the 16 or 24 tram line. Get off after the floating flower market (fourth stop from central station. Go in oposite direction of tram. Half block, right hand side. I would go on tours, museums and shopping, but I would always come back to hotel for water or a beer and a snack. Just to get off your feet in the Living area is worth the price. Be sure to meet Kevin at the front desk, he knows just about everything concerning your stay in AMS. I really should not be telling you all this stuff. The hotel could be sold out once word gets around about this great hotel. I have stayed at the Hilton Amsterdam, the Renaisance and the Golden tulip. This hotel beats them all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with Canal views”
Reviews.Author: RobertKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 days in early April. The rooms are small but nicely decorated. Very friendly staff and the lounge area downstairs has free drinks and nibblies and free access to the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome respite in busy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: downhudson
Reviews.Content: We were given a recommendation to the Banks Mansion by our hotel clerk in the Hague. The big plus was that every service within the hotel is free. There was a lovely breakfast, in the dedicated room downstairs, with station for omelets, pancakes, etc., delicious breads, cold meats, salmon. In the late afternoon, the cocktail hour offerings included wine, beer, soda and little snacks (nuts, olives, chips). There were also copies of many international newspapers, which along with the food, insured that there was a friendly busy quality to the confortably appointed hotel lobby in the late afternoon. The internet was also free access, including two computer stations. The entire hotel, which is small, a boutique hotel, four floors, is decorated in the style of Frank Lloyd Wright's decorative stained glass, and geometric patterns. Many design details have been thoughtfully incorporated (an under sink night light in the bathroom, for example; lighted cabinets). The room rate was slightly higher than our normal budget (229 Euros per/night), but we found the extra offerings plus the desk hospitality and advice about the city well worth the higher rate. We were given a corner room which overlooked the street, with an oblique view toward the famous Herengracht canal. Great peaceful location! Given the many warnings about the difficulties of finding a good hotel in Amsterdam, this one was a quiet and comforting place to land at the end of much walking and museum visits in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: stockholmguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my family - the location is excellent, very good breakfast, the rooms quite small but ok - the open bar in the lobby is a very nice idea - you meet people and it is nice to relax there after a long day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nadalert
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay at the banks mansion hotel. The staff at this hotel are probably the best I have encoutered. They are extremely friendly and helpful. I arrived early at the hotel and they were able to check me in at 10am (check-in time is 3pm). The free bar is great in the lobby. Breakfast was great I had pancakes whick were delicious! The rooms are quiet small but the bathroom is a good size. Just a note to anyone who needs a hairdryer...bring your own! The ones in the room are very weak-this is ok if you dont have too much hair but it was a problem for me!! The location is great 3mins walk to main shopping street. All in all, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fabulous Position”
Reviews.Author: chickybabe123
Reviews.Content: Just want to reiterate what other have said here. Loved the hotel. Spent 2 nights in May and though I did not have a "canal" view room my room was only one room back from the corner so still had the view! The staff were helpful and accommodating and provided restaurant recommendations. One night I was particularly tired and just wanted some take away indian or thai food. The receptionist rang a few restaurants for me when I asked for a recommendation and sent me in the right direction - good food too! When I arrived back with my thai they even offered to get me a plate and cutlery! The free mini bar is a great idea - though unfortunately I don't drink whisky, cognac or gin but that's okay - they had everything else you could imagine in the free bar downstairs! My room was pre-paid but my cc was accidently debited twice for the city tax (computer glitch at time of check out). No problems - within 3 days of my contacting the hotel by email the charge was reversed. Only one minor complaint - no coffee making facilities in the room. I think that would be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharben
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not too hard to find. Mind you we had a TomTom, which I highly recommend for getting into Amsterdam. We had to park along the canal to unload our luggage, which wasn't a huge amount because we were only staying for 3 nights, but we only had enough change for an hour. The hotel recommended a local car park which we then went to and used the 24 hour parking and didn't move it again until we left, mind you it did cost us 140 Euro! Check in was easy. Everyone spoke English. Got the lift up to the top floor and entered our non smoking room. We had the eaves in our room so the bed was tucked into there a bit. I never banged my head which I thought I would do. The air conditioning was great. We had very warm, unseasonal weather while we were there so we left it on all day. The room had everything we needed, a safe, hanging spcace in the wardrobes. The only thing it didn't have was a set of drawers but we managed fine. There was also a desk, tv and 3 decanters on a table with whisky, gin and brandy at no extra charge. The mini bar was free too with soft drinks and lager. We had a canal view and it was lovely. Such a beautiful city. We also found out on the last night that we free access to the adult channels on the tv. There was also a dvd player in the room but we couldn't figure out which channel to use on the tv. You even had a pillow menu!! Where you could choose between a variety of pillows. The breakfast was excellent too. There was bacon and sausages and you could get eggs the however you wanted them cooked. Pancakes could be cooked to order too. There was also cereal and a selection of cold meats and cheeses. Various drinks were there too. Downstairs, just by reception, there is the lounge where you can sit and chill. Various drinks are there including beer, wine, and spirits and also some snacks. All of this is at no extra charge. This is a smoking area and although we are non smokers this was not a problem for us. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Excellent location. We pretty much walked everywhere and was around 15 minutes to anywhere we wanted to go. I would happily book this hotel again next time I am in Amsterdam, which I hope will not be too long from now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: marzipan2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. Really can't fault the hotel. Staff are very attentive and welcoming. Our room was clean and comfortable, but the bathroon was even better with a really big bath plus a separate rain shower. Breakfast is lovely and there is a chef to cook omelettes and pancakes etc if you want. One of the best bits though is the free mini bar in your room and the free drinks and snacks in the lounge in the lobby. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it says it is!”
Reviews.Author: bjdbjd
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Amsterdam and selected this Hotel mostly based on reviews I read here. It was everything the website says it was. I really can't fault this hotel at all. We arrived around 8am and couldnt check-in til after lunch, which was expected and we were fine with that. Simply left luggage there and went exploring Amsterdam. When we returned at 2pm to check-in the room was ready and we headed up. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a corner room with canal views. It was awesome! It felt more like a suite than a standard room. The bathroom with rain shower and separate bath was impeccably clean. The bed was comfy and we had 4 massive double windows/doors and a mini balcony looking out over the canal. And the best bit, *everything* is included in the room rate. So i nailed at least a dozen Hoegaardens and a few glasses of wine in the lobby over the 3 days, all complimentary. Even when you return at 1am from a night out you can chill by the fire with a drink in the lobby unhassled. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful!”
Reviews.Author: flyboy411
Reviews.Content: This place is really different - and a mixed bag. No stupid rip-offs with the mini-bar, lots of terrific extras - all 'free' and a really great location. BUT, the breakfast was about as poor a standard as could be imagined, eg scrambled eggs made by reheating already-made stuff resembling yellow rubber, poor selection etc. This is not what hotel dining rooms should offer. The safe was broken, the phone didn't work, and they would only move us to a different room at OUR expense. The "free WiFii" turned out to last 50 minutes and in one room didn't work at all. Hmmm. The worst part was that our foursome booked for 2 days and were forced to leave after one due to genuine and serious circumstances beyond our control. We asked (at breakfast time) if they would let us off the second night's charge. The (young) guy at the desk was very tough and said he would 'ask his manager', later saying he did so and was told 'no'. I said I expected a more lenient attitude under the circumstances and wanted to speak to the manager myself and he immediately said 'OK, we will let you off one room but not both. We can't lose money because of your problems.' I later discovered that they managed to fill the entire hotel that night but still pocketed the room charge they demanded from us. I know we had booked for 2 nights and technically, they may be said to be in the right, but I doubt the manager was even consulted and whereas the small things are what could make this hotel so attractive, knowing they employ transparently poor actors like him and are happy to 'fine' us a (not inexpensive) room rate they ANYWAY sold to somebody else, makes me reluctant to set foot there again or recommend them. You need to feel comfortable in a hotel, but they run it so poorly it spoiled the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its promise”
Reviews.Author: My_Aunt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banks Hotel for seven nights (April 30 - May 8), and we were very satisfied with the hotel. I booked directly with the hotel, and I was contacted by the desk staff to welcome us and enquire about any requests. And we did have a couple of requests: 1) we were arriving in the morning and asked to check earlier than the usual time 2) we asked for a room that had a bath tub (most rooms have showers). The staff replied promptly, saying that they will try to accommodate our requests - and they did. We were checked in by Nina, who is very efficient, knowledgeable, and friendly, and so are the rest of the desk staff - Pamela, Laura, Kevin and Ali. Our corner room commanded a view of the canal (Herengracht) and the street (Vijzelstraat). The room and the bathroom were spacious and comfortable. We travel in Europe once a year, so we are used to smaller (than North American) rooms. Breakfast in the "kitchen" was also very good; omelettes, pancakes and French toast can be ordered in addition to the buffet-style standards (cheese, cold cuts, smoked salmon, etc.); however, the selection wasn't changed when we were there. The 24-hour lounge snacks and drinks were also good, keeping in mind that these are snacks and not mini-meals, along the lines of nuts, olives, Dutch waffles (cookies), and the occasional dips and cheese. I would have rated the hotel excellent, but the housekeeping service leaves much to be desired. In our 7-day stay, we had to ask 4 times for bathroom items that were lacking: soap, shower gels, bath salts. In addition, the cleaning was cursory: empty gel bottles and soiled face cloths were left uncollected. But again, the desk staff was very quick in sending whatever we needed. As a matter of fact, one of them came to our room with the items that were missing, and she saw the condition of the bathroom. The location was also ideal for us. It was central enough, but not too busy like the Dam, Rembrandtplein or Leidseplein. We like walking, so we walked to many of the the attractions, occasionally taking the tram to the Central Station or the Museum area. Aside from the problem with housekeeping, we were happy with the level of service, specifically of the desk staff ,and would recommend Banks Mansion Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindyDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bank's Mansion for four nights in April and couldn't have been more pleased. Everything important has already been said in other posts but I felt I needed to confirm that the hotel is just as nice as people claim. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. The room was a perfect size (corner room) as was the bathroom, which had a very long soaking tub and a large shower. In room complementary mini-bar had a good assortment of drinks in addition to the flasks of liquor and bowl of apples. Breakfast was great and the cook will make anything you ask for. Lounge was very relaxing and it was nice to have a cup of cappuccino, wine and bar snacks while reading newspapers or checking email on the free computers. Location was great and in walking distance to a lot of attractions. Small restaurant across the street, Peking, had very good sandwiches, soup, Dutch pancakes and after 4 pm they have Chinese food. Have only great things to say about this hotel and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkerSuffolk
Reviews.Content: A great hotel situated in central Amsterdam, within easy walking distance of most sights in the city. The hotel is immaculate and the staff most helpful and pleasant. The unusual feature of the Banks is that you are provided with decanters of whisky, brandy and gin in the room with mixers and soft drinks, all included in the price. The room was large and comfortable. In the lobby there is a comfortable seating area with sofas and armchairs, coffee, tea etc and a bar with wines,spirits, even champagne, and snacks available all day,again all included in the price. The breakfast was excellent and could fill you up for the day if you wanted. They don't serve dinner but there are so many restaurants in Amsterdam that you wouldn't really want to eat at the hotel. You can find cheaper hotels but for my wife and I we would stay at the Banks Mansion again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: medorand
Reviews.Content: We chose the Banks Mansion because we wanted a more comfortable hotel located close to our friends in Amsterdam. It definitely met this criteria and went way beyond! The fantastic customer service made the stay. They never hassled or even commented about our early check-in time. Our room was clean and fitted nicely with modern furnishings and extras like free mini bar and spirits in glass decanters. The bathroom was very nice with a shower and a really long bathtub! Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: BornToRock
Reviews.Content: Genuinely the best overall hotel experience from start to finish - We couldn't fault it. Service on arrival and throughout the stay was superb and the rooms and facilities were outstanding. We'd recommend this hotel (and have, many times) to anyone planning a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel and we loved it and will return. Highlights were: the corner room...this is a must. There is more room and more light in these units facing the front of the hotel. Ask ahead of time. Even with the windows opened, you couldn't really step out on to balcony because there was not much room. There are better views around town but other things in this hotel make up for the lack of a balcony. Rooms are small but extremely functional and charming. The complementary beverage and food in lobby was great. We invited a friend over after a long day and enjoyed just sitting in front of the fire place drinking and snacking and enjoying it all. We liked getting extra water and coffee from this area to bring to room. NIce chocolates and rotating snacks all day long if you happened to be there. Bar in room and frig for other things. Free WI Fi in lobby at two big desks. You could check in on any info without using your room computer. They also gave you 50 minutes free WI FI in room. Bathrooms were great...not huge but perfectly set. Great big tub and fantastic rain shower. Very clean. Ice and shoe shine right at the end of the hallway. Bed was nice and hard but I did not like the seam down the middle. This would be so easy to correct with a proper pad over the seam! Pillows were rather lumpy. Breakfast down stairs in the basement was fabulous. We missed the first morning because we slept in but the second day we enjoyed all the goodies. Great selection of papers and magazines at breakfast and in lobby each day. The front desk was outstanding! Great help and extremely friendly. The only thing I thought odd was the lack of vacuuming of the carpet in all of the hall ways. This made its seem dirty but I could just tell that it really had not been vacuumed well...or in a long time. Odd... when every thing else was very clean. GREAT LOCATION. The tram was just outside hotel a block up. Very easy to get to train station, 10 minute ride. Not on a super busy street but close to every thing. Flower mart was 2 blocks away. Great cafes near by. Fabulous hotel... we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary greatness”
Reviews.Author: hagggis
Reviews.Content: Spent an easter here. Nice, tidy rooms, comfy bed. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was good too with all the usual eggsybacon stuff, healthier things and the made-for-order omelettes/pancakes. Connections were good since the tram line is right next to the hotel. Complimentary bar and snacks is the greatest, when you are feeling lazy you can just slob it in the lounge by the fireplace and sip cava ... :) If you look for something to wish for, some kind of sauna/spa/gym like thing would be great .. also they could lose the 50 minute complimentary wireless internet limit ..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dagestan
Reviews.Content: A bit on the expensive side,but the hotel and staff were second to none,very pleasent and helpful as are the Dutch in general.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: neetstraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a young couple between 13/03/08 - 16/03/08 after seeing the reviews on Tripadvisor. They had booked us under the wrong name but this was quickly rectified although it was funny seeing a handwritten note in the room saying "welcome back Mr & Mrs ..." The hotel was like we expected, we had booked a deluxe room with canal view for a bit extra. The room was slightly on the small side but this is quite normal in European hotels. The room was well stocked with cognac, vodka and brandy and the mini bar had some cans of beer, fruit juices, smoothies and water. There were also some complimentary apples which we didnt have a chance to eat! We had bought some drinks from the airport hence the big bottle of baileys on our table! Word of note, if you want the mini bar restocked, make sure you let the cleaners know you want your room cleaned/drinks restocked! we didn't get it restocked on the second day. The beds were really comfy, I didn't notice the choice of pillows that other reviews had mentioned, maybe I missed that. The air-conditioning worked fine, and we did have a nice view of our canal from our window. It was very quiet at night which was surprising but welcomed. We also had a flat screen TV which had English channels. The bathroom was nice, which was also on the small side, again this is expected in European hotels. The rain-shower was amazing, although there was no bathtub. The complimentary slippers and massive white bathrobes were also a welcome addition. The breakfast was nice, we went for one morning (closes by 10.30am) we got there about 10.20 and the toast had run out so its best to go earlier, the cook was nice and she made our eggs to our liking although she couldn't make the poached eggs I wanted! The un-staffed bar downstairs was also nice with comfy seats and a fireplace, and with a range of alcoholic drinks, soft drinks and a coffee machine. There was also a variety of snacks which changed during the day. The free internet downstairs was also a welcome addition. Many of the people seemed to be business travelers, so we did feel a bit out of place as younger travelers!. The staff were very helpful with places to go and things to do in the locality. The nearest trams were 16/24 to get to central station but pretty much everything can be reached by walking too. The usual taxi service from the hotel to the airport was 48E so if your trying to budget it might be better to take the tram/train route. Overall I would recommend this hotel, if your prepared to pay a little extra for luxury. I will definitely stay in this hotel again, and has provided us with many good memories of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie_DK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the positive reviews on this website, and we were certainly not disappointed. The hotel was superb in every aspect from the complimentary snacks in the lounge to the cosy rooms with view over the canal (if you pay a little extra for canal-view). The breakfast buffet was delicious and had all things that you could possibly want. Location of the hotel is great too. In walking distance of everything in the city center and easy access to the tram if you don't want to walk. We will definitely stay at Banks Mansion when we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, well-presented in good location”
Reviews.Author: ozjug
Reviews.Content: Staff were all very helpful, particularly Kevin at reception. Room clean and in good condition. Free minibar and drinks at the lounge area a nice touch - even if just for fruit juice and mineral water. Good range of breakfast options. Comfortable bed and even a pillow menu. Well located on one of the nicer canals, close enough to walk to Central Station and most other points of interest. Not a cheap place to stay, but still good value.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Europhile031
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four nights in this hotel, which is definitely one of the very best we've stayed in (and we've stayed in many!). The combination of style, informality, efficiency, friendliness and cleanliness, not forgetting the complimentary drinks, made for a relaxing and thorougly enjoyable stay. Returning here after a busy day was almost like returning home (where someone else had done the cleaning and tidying up!). Absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: susanmarieelizabeth
Reviews.Content: one of the most pleasant stays ever, very elegant for price. very comfortable beds/linens. quiet, nice lobby with 2 public computers. good internet in room, you recieve 50 free minutes but then a day is 15 euros, which i paid for 2 days. nice area. across from shopping, healthy grocery/deli. movie theather a block away, lots of restaurants, near canal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel With Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lubin68
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in mid feb and found the hotel to be lovely. The room was great with a great shower and a very comfy bed. The included drinks and minibar are a nice touch. We wanted to see as much of the city as possible and found the location to be very central for getting about.The only negitive I could find that that there is no resturant in the hotel. This would normally not be an issue when visiting a city as we would rarely eat in the hotel as there is so much choice in a city. However, in Amsterdam there was a very limited range of resturants. If you like steak houses or pizza houses then you can't go wrong, they are on every street. But we wanted something different from that but couldn't find anywhere. As it was really cold when we were there and with no great selection of eateries about we would have been happy to enjoy some drinks in the lounge and eat dinner in the hotel. This is the only negitive we found and we did enjoy the hotel. The staff were very friendly with brilliant English and great local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lis_45
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package deal and were not disappointed. We paid a bit more for a canal view room and it was definitely worth it, the view from our room was amazing. The staff were friendly, rooms impeccable, breakfasts were great and we really enjoyed the complimentary drinks, an unusual but very welcome addition. I would definitely stay here on any future trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing atmosphere, great location”
Reviews.Author: Amijoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banks Mansion for a long anniversary weekend last summer, and it was perfect. The hotel's "living room" for guests is a fantastic concept, a great place to come back to and relax with whatever you'd like to drink and little snacks, comfy chairs and magazines to read - I'd pop down from our room with a book and curl up by the fire if hubby wanted a pre-dinner nap. I really enjoyed the living room and made the most of it, spending the early evenings chatting with other guests as we all came down for an early evening drink before parting ways for the night. The staff were friendly and helped with directions or recommendations for evening walks or canal trips. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location on one of Amsterdam's most beautiful canals, and is also a brief walk to Rembrandt Square where there's plenty of late night cafe and bar culture for an evening out - we'd sit and people watch every evening for hours. The hotel's also conveniently located for frequent trams, so you can take a leisurely stroll through the tulip market and along canals/shops up to the train station then hop on a tram back if the weather turns (the hotel has umbrellas for guests if it does turn wet). The rooms aren't big by anyone's standards but they're beautifully put together in a modern deco/Charles Rennie Mackintosh style, and our bathroom was beautifully finished with an enormous rainfall shower. The little touches are nice - our room had a few cut glass decanters with different (and tasty!) spirits for a night cap. The room and hotel both were nicer than 5* resorts/hotels I've stayed in, the bed linen good quality and the mattress comfortable. The room was spotless, as was the entire hotel. I'd completely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable break in a convenient location, and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel - welcoming and warm staff”
Reviews.Author: jacob123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend end of Jan 2008. Could not fault it (and I have stayed in many hotels in AMS). The staff were excellent - very friendly and efficient. The room was large, very comfortable and nice touches, like a free mini-bar. Also - no fooling around looking for adapators to plug in my laptop - it was all there. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Establishment”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld321
Reviews.Content: This is a quality establishment. The staff are extremely professional and all seem to speak impecable English, service is of a very high standard. There is no bar as such but the very pleasant lounge area has a self service bar with a choice of different bottled beers, wines, spirits and soft drinks all included at no extra charge within the room rate. The all inclusive drinks extends to the mini bar in the room. Our mini bar was very well stoked with beer, soft drinks and chocolate bars and there were also 3 decanters of spirits. The room was not particularly spacious but was well presented. The bathroom was of a good standard and the bed was very comfortable. We had to pay extra for a canal view but it was worth it. The hotel has a breakfast room but no dining room which necesitates going out for dinner but as the hotel is very centrally located there are plenty of very good places to eat within a short walking distance. This is a nice place to stay if you are visiting Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic,Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gazefc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel , direct, as part of a 3 night / 4day trip to Amsterdam.I was told about this by a good friend of mine. The hotel is just around the corner from Rembrant Square, and 200 mtrs from the no.4 tram stop. the outside of the hotel is nothing special, but when you climb the steps (only 4 or 5) and enter the lounge/reception area, you get a feeling of something special. The staff are friendly, professional and very helpful. one lady Nina, is a credit to the hotel !!! The 'Lounge' area is relaxed with comfy chairs and sofas, a fire in one corner, and NO Television !!! There is a bar that comes as complementary as part of your rate. The rooms are a decent size not massive, just right. We had the choice of a room with a canal view , which has a massive walk in shower, or a bigger room with a bath for 2 and a good size shower , but no view. we took the room with the bath and shower. All movies and in room drins are included. the bed was a good size king , and was really comfortable. We ordered breakfast in bed on the first morning , and it was delivered on time and hot !!! There is not many things wrong with this hotel, it does what it says, and with a certain style, that is not over the top. I could go on, but what i will say , is that we will be going back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay & great value!”
Reviews.Author: MMM8
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our stay. Great place all around. We had booked a canal-view room and found the view lovely, the room as comfortable as any we've ever had, and the staff just outstanding. This is,as far as we are concerned, the only place to stay in Amsterdam. More like a good club than a hotel. Worth following the front desk's advice on restaurants too. In a city not known for food, they do know where to find the good places to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: massmorg
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Banks Mansion and what most reveiwers say is true. The staff is very welcoming, the location perfect and the bed and bath were great. I would return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay. Not more than 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: cashew_nut
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a two night stay at the Banks Mansion. We booked because of the great reviews on TA but had such a bad experience I felt I needed to write my own review. Although it is undeniably in a great location - no more than 10mins walk to everywhere it seemed, and just around the corner from the picturesque '9 streets' - the hotel is just not worth the money. Our room (212) was incredibly dark - we felt like we were in the basement despite being on the 2nd floor, and was really way too small to justify the 279Euros it costs a night. We could hardly walk around the bed - and had no-where to put our luggage. On the plus side the bed was very comfy however the pillows were lumpy and really need to be replaced. FYI - Banks Mansion claims to have a 'pillow menu' - but they didn't have any pillows available when we asked so the claim seemed a bit of a let down! We also only had one pair of slippers and one dressing gown. The drinks in the 'free minibar' were never replenished, and after the room was "cleaned" on Saturday morning the maid left old half full cans of coke and beer. Finally, the room was not clean (by my standards) - hair in the bath and in the sink, soap marks on the mirror, grit on the carpet in the bedroom, and dark marks all over the wallpaper. FYI - our room was non-smoking but everything including the bathroom towels smelt smoky and dusty. The communal areas - lounge etc are also smoking so it cannot be avoided in this hotel. The free nibbles (always the same..nuts and crisps, nougat and small waffles) and drinks were great but again they did not make up for the room. The very last bone of contention about this hotel is the breakfast. It's really quite horrible. The pancakes ("made to order") come out of a packet and are literally warmed up on the griddle in front of you. The eggs are worse - they have a tub of orange eggy liquid which they pour into a frying pan...) There were no pastries or croissants, etc. Not much choice at all to be honest.
