All in all, based on our experience we would not recommend this hotel. There were simply too many problems to justify the price, and even if we had loved our room it is still too expensive. Hope you find this review useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mikey47
Reviews.Content: As usual we booked this hotel after reading the reviews and comparing with other hotels. Again we were not disappointed. Several days before the weekend holiday we received an email from the hotel bidding us welcome. I replied and because we had booked a Deluxe canal view room asked for one of the corner rooms over the entrance, eg 106, 206, 306 or 406. This was confirmed. We arrived early having taken the Connexxion hotel shuttle from the airport (19 euro each return) and were told that our room was ready. We were given 401. I mentioned that we had been promised a corner room and after some deliberation we were reallocated to room 306. That wasn't ready so we left our bags with them and took the tram into the centre and the railway station. Here we collected tickets for the prebooked Candle Light Cruise (no candles!) and the canel bus. The hotel is right on the canel and ten minutes walk from all the main sights. We ate out at Visrestaurant Lucius, 5 minutes away, and the mussels and king prawns were delicious. The room was tastefully decorated and had 4 windows out onto the canal and intersection. There was some road/tram noise. As mentioned by others the minibar and associated decanters of whisky, brandy and gin are all included, as are drinks/nibbles in the lounge. Breakfast, served in the basement was OK. Checkout was at 12 noon. Again we were able to leave our bags and continue sightseeing coming back to the lounge at 5pm for a drink and wait for the shuttle. The staff were all professional and welcoming. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Chem73
Reviews.Content: Believe all of the reviews here, this is a brilliant hotel. We booked from reading the reviews here. It can look a bit more expensive than a lot of the hotels in Amsterdam but the accomodation and use of facilities is worth every penny. The free bar was well stocked with loads of chocolate, biscuits, etc. The beer and wine was all good quality and at various times during the day extra food was put out. It was a great area to go to unwind after a busy day in amsterdam. Breakfast was also included in the rate (we found the best deal via opodo.co.uk) which was a very good range of food and anything you needed made up to order. In the room the free mini-bar was well stocked with chocolate and drinks, the in house movies were also included in the price. I don't think any hotel rooms in Amsterdam are particularly large but the rooms were modern, clean and very comfortable. The location is also very good, right by the flower market and a short walk to almost all attractions. Probably a 15 minute walk from the central station or accessable on the tram routes. If your off to Amsterdam you have to try this hotel - it is as good as every review here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RB7769
Reviews.Content: I stayed at BM this past August and I must say this was one of the best if not best hotel I have stayed at in terms of everything working right. Everything in the rooms are in the right place and working properly. The front desk staff is great and goes out of their way to make your stay a great one. The free drinks in the lobby and in the room along with free snacks and chef prepared breakfast was amazing. I would stay here again any time in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Banks Manison Hotel was Brillant”
Reviews.Author: McDonaldRichards
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Banks Mansion Hotel for 3 nights. It is a clean, friendly and convenient hotel. The breakfast was included together with the drinks (that includes alcoholic drinks). The breakfast was fresh and there was a good choice to choose from. The rooms were small but big enough for a 3 night stay. The only problem in the rooms was the fact that the lighting was not very good. Although this hotel is not cheap it is worth it because of the little extras that they offer and the friendly staff. We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. We would also recommend asking the staff where to eat as they give excellent recommendations. We only did this on our last night and they recommended Brasserie Harkema which is well worth trying as the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you wont regret it!”
Reviews.Author: nursey-IsleofWight
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We booked with a few days notice so phoned the hotel direct who quoted the same prices advertised on their website. It worked out at about Â£130 per night for two of us sharing a delux room. We wanted something a little different to celebrate our wedding anniversary and decided on Amsterdam. Banks Mansion stood up to all the great reviews it has received and we were not disappointed. We arrived at central station and took the tram (16,24) which took only a few minutes and stops about a two minute walk away. The room was on the top floor but there is a lift so no problems with luggage and stairs! Checking in was a doddle and very fast with the efficient and friendly staff. The room was well equiped and included a hairdryer in the ensuit (shower) bathroom. Everything was clean and presentable and the free mini bar was very much appreciated. It included things like mineral water, canned pop, juice and some alcohol. The lounge also provided drinks that were free and this was nice to come back to in the afternoon and at the end of an evening out. Even though there are quite a few rooms in this hotel the lounge maintained a relaxed feeling and there was never more than two or three other couples using it. There are also two free computers with internet access in the lounge which was useful if you left on a whim like we did! The location was perfect. Nothing was more than a few minutes walk and the trams are so efficient (get a day ticket, it's better value) You can even go past the hotel on a canal trip (lovers do a very entertaining canal cruise). I would definetely go back to this hotel and reccommend it to my friends/family, and I am very picky!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: RodandKristie
Reviews.Content: Excellent! We stayed at the Banks Mansion for 2 nights in early July and loved it. Of our 5 week trip it was definitely our favourite of many beautiful hotels. The hotel staff were lovely and very helpful. The hotel itself was situated right on the canal (we had a canal view - very worthwhile) and was in a great location, only 5-10 minutes walk from all the nice shopping and eating areas. We were very impressed with the 'pillow menu' plus the complimentary open bar, not only in our room and in the foyer for all hotel guests, which we found was one in a million and definitely a huge bonus for us. We have already recommended the Banks Mansion to many friends and for these reasons wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way - Great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertTG
Reviews.Content: The Banks Mansion more than met our expectations, with a wonderfull staff, excellent made-to order breakfast. free cocktails...(albeit limited selection), free internet, quiet air-conditioned room, canal view, and perfect location. We walked everywhere, from the Ann Frank House, red light district to the art museums, etc, and frequently took a quick break at our conveniently located hotel for a beer or glass of wine, and a little rest from all the walking. Our room was a model of effeciency...perfect size for two, and everything one would need. Excellent shower, comfortable bed, nice view, and great security. We went on a cruise for 2 weeks following our stay at the Banks Mansion, and found ourselves comparing the cruise experience with that in Amsterdam. We found the breakfast at the hotel, especially the coffee, expresso, & lattes at the Banks to be far superior. And you really appreciate those free drinks & free interent after paying cruise ship prices. We really loved it there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: BenL1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four days at Banks Mansion during a long weekend. We both loved it and would recommend it to friends. The location is great as it is equidistant between the centre of town and the museum area- we walked pretty much everywhere all weekend but the tram was outside the door if you wanted it. Also it is on one of the main canals, but it is far enough away from the neon lights and really touristy squares to feel really relaxed (although there is a sqaure with all this only a block away if you want it). Room was nicely done with massive walk-in shower and art deco styling. We didnt have a canal view as all were booked but it was fine and heavy curtains and double glazing kept out all noise from the street. Really nice touch is free mini bar in room and free serve yourself area downstairs- soft drinks, wine, beers, coffee, tea, cava and even spirits. Also free internet. Dont get me wrong, you dont go to Amsterdam to drink all day in the room, but it was really nice to go back to freshen up and have a beer before heading out, or a night cap when returning home. We normally dont use hotel facilities as it always feels a rip-off, but it made it feel really relaxing to be able to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trip”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Bedford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in August with some of our family. The way the hotel operates is innovative. A small boutique style place with only 50 rooms and an attentive staff. The hotel is just off the Leidseplein so impossible to get lost as there are signs to it from all areas, and brilliant for walking about. The Living is an area in the foyer stocked with a coffee machine, cold drinks, beer, wine and spirits and allows you to read international papers, use the internet for free, and relax without any need for stress. The service is unobtrusive and there are small snacks available. There is also a minibar and a selection of drinks in the room which makes for a much cheaper stay. Breakfast in bed only costs 5Euros and is wonderful! Some of the rooms have steam rooms within the showers - I'd advise asking for one when you book. None of the rooms have a bath. The Selecta directly opposite the hotel does a great Indonesian ristafel banquet, and there are great Argentinian Steak Houses off the Rembrantsplein. We will definitely stay again - I've stayed in the Pulitzer and Bildeberg Garden hotels and this is far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: izzyd
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I think anyone who has taken the time to complain about the size of the rooms or the amount of snacks laid out is being unrealistic. There was more than adequate and the hotel doesn't advertise inclusive meals - only snacks! The booze available is fine - Gordon's Gin, Johnnie Walker Red Label - that's OK!! The hotel staff could not be faulted and unlike another reviewer, I did not think any of the courtesy was any more contrived than any other hotel I've stayed in - in fact it seemed much more genuine than many. Our room with the canal view was fab - no standing on tip toes to see the canal! We had a shower rather than a bath and next time I would ask for a bath but having said that I have no complaints about the room. Location is great - everything is in walking distance and we found the area surprisingly quiet given the busy locations round about. Go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Jerandnanc
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff with excellent perks. It is located on one of the main canals (as is everything else, it seems, in Amsterdam!) Room was well kept and the â€œliving roomâ€� (hotel lobby) with its free bar, snacks and, in the afternoon, appetizers made the visit even more comfortable. A full breakfast is provided. It is not that close to the main museums but, on a pleasant day, the walk is fine. The problem is not the distance just that the city has numerous canals that get in the way. It is close to a number of restaurants, bars, coffee shops and coffee houses. The hotel is centrally located. Watch out for the bicycle paths. They have the right of way and the bicyclists yield to no one!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: nickybasingstoke
Reviews.Content: I would just like to echo all the things everyone else has to say about the Banks Mansion Hotel. I chose the hotel based on the reviews posted on Trip Advisor and would like to thank everyone for their contributions - it was spot on! We had a lovely stay and will definately go back. This is a city that does not sleep! Loads to do, very cosmopolitan, fantastic break.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Chinsworth
Reviews.Content: We've been to Amsterdam a dozen times and stayed at medium to very high end places, but this was the most pleasant by far. Friendly helpful staff, and the "living room" concept worked very well for us, as we had several occasions on which friends came to visit with us there. Having just arrived from a Paris hotel, with all its many gouging charges, we were stunned at the bowls of fruit, snacks, coffee, wine, etc., and the fast internet readily available. There was even a small table with cut glass decanters of brandy and whisky in our room for a private nightcap. Our room was angled at the corner, and we liked the immediacy of the canal and street view, and the modern/retro decorating. Breakfast included eggs and pancakes made to order. We will definitely do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home-from-home”
Reviews.Author: Tikidog
Reviews.Content: I chose the Banks Mansion for a surprise birthday trip because of TripAdvisor reviews, so had high expectations. But it was even better than I'd hoped. I booked canal view rooms well in advance (room 106 is large & dual aspect) and while my partner & I thought it wonderfully romantic, our 2 teenaged sons loved the free drinks, snacks, and internet... It's in a great location, offers huge, delicious breakfasts, is spotlessly clean, stylish, friendly, and utterly relaxing. As soon as we can think of another excuse, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: LA-Elvis
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Banks Mansion in May while we were in Europe for two weeks celebrating his 21st birthday. The hotel was perfect in every way. It was probably the best boutique hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was beautiful, luxuriously appointed, spotless and a great view over the bustling city street and serene canal. The area is great, it is across the canal from the Amsterdam mayor's house. Sonja at the front desk was terrific. She was helpful with restaurant and touring suggestions and she, along with all of the other front desk employees, was friendly and just a lot of fun whenever we would see her. All in all an amazing hotel and a place I would always stay at if I return to Amsterdam. We liked this hotel so much that we changed out hotel in Glasgow, Scotland, our next stop, to the sister property of Banks Mansion. We found the Glasgow property to be nothing like the Amsterdam property and were very dissapointed with our decision to stay there. So, as noted above, Banks Mansion is superb but that doesn't seem to mean that the whole small chain they have is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for couples to be in the middle of things”
Reviews.Author: eTood
Reviews.Content: Good service and helpful staff. Comfortable, quiet room (if a bit small) and bed. Our room had a great rain style shower. We especially liked the lobby and general decor. It was ideal for being in the centre of things, only a short walk in any direction to see something special. Make sure you ask for a canal view - it is worth it. We did a deal to include breakfast and it was well worth it - plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Nelly-6
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - a great base for a really relaxing short break in Amsterdam. The whole vibe was very laid back and calm, staff were attentive, with tip-top restaurant recs, and the serve-yourself approach in the lounge was so much nicer than having waiters buzzing around. The room was much bigger and more comfortable than other Amsterdam hotels I've stayed in, although not huge by international standards, but and lets face it, hotels are expensive in this city. The bathroom was large and well-appointed, with an enourmous bath (I could float in it!) and a great walk in shower - but oddly, only one bar of soap was supplied and the bath salts weren't replaced the second day. Breakfast was delicious. There was service at the cooked bar, where eggs, omelettes and pancakes were prepared, and everything else was serve-yourself -so equally as relaxed as the lounge. Overall, I thought the 'all inclusive' concept was worth it for the relaxing vibe - you know if advance what you're paying and don't have to keep a tab on where the minibar bill is heading. And considering the price of Amsterdam hotels, I don't think the room rate is over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Overpriced! Not Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Emily_14
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Apparently, most people don't mind paying through the nose for a less-than-mediocre hotel. I stayed for 3 nights in May. I booked a double "deluxe" room with canal view for over $350/night and I thought I'd be getting my money's worth. What a disappointment! This hotel is nothing more than a Holiday-Inn type chain. The room was really tiny and had cheap stucco-type walls and ceilings. The hotel says it's "different" because it includes drinks and snacks--this is their gimmick to justify charging such high rates. Your mini-bar is stocked with cans of soda, a couple of waters and some mini bottles of really bad wine. In the lobby you can get more soda and coffee, and... mini Mars bars and other assorted candies. In the afternoons they put out small amounts of bread and butter w/ a very limited amount of cold cuts, which are not replenished when finished. My point is: if their "free drinks and snacks" feature is supposed to justify their high rates---it's absurd. About the view: I had to stand on my toes to peer out the window and see the canal. Service was standard, and the staff is trained to repeatedly ask you how you are and how your day went EVERYTIME you exit and enter the building. They also ask for a tip when your bill is printed out--there's a blank tip amount line when you sign your bill upon check-out. Overall--no charm, cheaply decorated, tiny rooms, intrusive service--NOT WORTH over $300/night. You'd do better to book a bed & breakfast on the canal and get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKeen_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in January - booked room via hotel website. First time in Amsterdam (which is a wonderful city to visit) so cannot compare this accommodation with others in the city. Overall had a great stay (but would not classify it as 5 star). Highlights of the stay: - Rooms (well appointed but small) 3.5* - Bathrooms (large with bathtub but skimpy on toiletries) 4* - Location (great) 5* - Internet access (easy and free) 5* - Lounge (casual with fireplace) 4* - Lounge food / drinks (whilst free which is 5*, quality is a mediocre 3*; expect cheap wines and limited food spread 3*) - Breakfast (adequate but not a huge spread 4*) - Service (wonderful staff 5*; staff forgot to service room 1 day (despite reminder) but was apologetic and compensated us with Bulgary toileteries). Overall would definitely recommend this hotel to friends but still curious to try others in this city.

Reviews.Title: “The best part of my holiday was staying at the Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: HollowayLondon
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Banks Mansion was fabulous. When we arrived we were taken to our room, 406, by Pamela, who was so nice throughout our stay. When she opened the door we were overwhelmed by how beautiful the room was. The main room was huge with a large sofa and two armchairs with footstools. There was a widescreen tv and dvd player. The bathroom was divine with a jacuzzi bath and walk-in shower and two sinks. The bedroom, yes seperate bedroom had the biggest bed I have ever seen. When we lay on the bed together and stretched out we did not touch each other. There were 4 windows which overlooked everywhere. The room was so nice we did not even want to go out. It is true the drinks are all complimentary. There is only a small sample of drinks in your room, but downstairs there is a larger variety. Just go and help yourself. There is also snacks and sweets to pig out on all day. Unfortunately, breakfast was not so great. It was just okay. There was not a lot of variety and it was not very tasty. Maybe I am just being fussy. This hotel was in the middle of everything. We did not really need the tram or train tickets because we walked almost everywhere, even late at night. Even though most of the days were sunny, it was always cold, particularly in the shade, and freezing at night. Forget sandals and shorts. Bring comfortable shoes. Forget the party clothes, most people dress casual and comfortable and warm. When you get to the airport, do take the connexions bus return fare for 19.50 euros.The bus will stop about 50m away from the front door. The hotel staff will confirm your return for you, this time the bus will stop right outside. You do not need to buy any maps because everywhere you go someone will give you a map. The best piece of advice I took prior to arriving in Amsterdam was to buy my tickets for Van Gogh museum online, the queue was enormous and we felt quite smug when we just walked straight to the front. If you are going to Amsterdam you will not regret staying at the Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cjwintter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for five days and let me tell you that this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in my life. This is in my opinion a near five star hotel in a wonderful location with a very friendly staff. I arrived very early due to my flight from the USA and the staff had my room ready within one hour. The staff, like most everyone in Amsterdam is multilingual and everyone at the front desk especially spoke English well. The hotel has a sort of modern feel and all drinks in the lobby (beer, water, juice, coffee, espresso, etc.) are free. There is free internet access in the lobby via two desktop computers. There is a free breakfast which includes fresh bread, cheese, fish, eggs, meats and more. The hotel has a modern feel and this extends to the rooms. My room was large for a European room and it had a view of a canal. The bed was the most confortable bed I have ever slept in ever, a temperedic mattress with matching pillows. I had a nice sized bathroom with huge stand up glass shower. The room was not the cheapest but I went during Queens day and there where far more expensive hotels including the Jolly Carlton which is right across the street. This hotel is located in the middle of everything, directly across from the flower market, 5 minutes walking from clubs and a huge shopping district, 20 minutes walking to the red light, and like 25 minute walk to central station, a tram line also passes directly in front of the hotel and it is a 5 minute walk to the stop which from there will take you anywhere in the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: frogandbear
Reviews.Content: The hotel was brilliant - great rooms, perfect location and very attentive staff. The free bar facilities in the living room area were ideal for when you want to relax but not just sit in your room. Walking distance to all of the main attractions and metro station. Excellent breakfasts that set you up for the day - made to order pancakes, omelettes or french toast as well as continental breakfast. Overall a very good experience, looking forward to going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connecticut06
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 night stay at Banks Mansion. I couldn't fault a thing. We arrived a bit early, and our room wasn't quite ready. The staff at the front desk were friendly, helpful and capable. We were invited to sit in the lobby and enjoy a snack and drink while waiting. Within 10 minutes we were invited upstairs. Our third floor room overlooked the canal. The room was immaculate, and the amenities were wonderful (bathrobes, slippers, room safe, fresh fruit, free mini-bar, decanters of gin & whiskey & congnac). The bed was great, and the hotel is remarkably quiet. The bathroom was fine (shower but no bathtub). All in all, an exceptionally comfortable room. The breakfast room is on the lower level of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive, and could be supplemented by made-to-order eggs, pancakes, omelets, or French toast. I had a wonderful omelet one morning. Again, the service was great. Free drinks of all sorts were always available in the lobby. This included wines, beers, sodas, and even liquers. The hotel is very well located to allow walking to all the major sites in Amsterdam. We never felt the need to take a tram. It was wonderful to be able to stop in the midst of sightseeing for a cold drink and a snack. The staff at the desk provided a very good street map, and were unfailingly polite when we needed replacements, having twice lost ours. The lobby has 2 internet workstations, which I had no trouble accessing whenver I needed. It's a great help to check in and print boarding passes before going to the airport. The hotel will arrange a shuttle to the airport for 24 euros, which worked out well for us--we turned out to be the only 2 passengers, so it was like having our own taxi but cheaper. Do yourself a favor and have an Indonesian dinner at Tempo Doeloe, Utrechtestraat 75. Try a "rice platter" which includes portions of 18 different dishes. It was among the best meals I have ever had. We've been back in CT for a week and I wish I was in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: gazborangers
Reviews.Content: Went to the Banks Mansion for two nights in April. Went with my brother so we booked two rooms. Hotel looks great from the outside but extremely disappointing inside. It looks as though it has been designed with the cheapest of everything possible. It is certainly not a boutique hotel and infact nothing more than a rather poor bed and breakfast. My room was at the back of the hotel. Woodchip celings and two very small windows that I hd to stand on my tip toes to see out. The furniture in the rooms is of chipboard quality and the complimentary mini bar - well laughable. They advertise that all your drinks are free, yes they are if you want to drink cheap Cava, cheap white wine and cheap red wine. You cannot get spirits in the downstairs bar! The staff are very abrupt and the breakfast room is in the basement of the hotel and is reminiscent of a school lunch room. There is no restaurant facilities in the hotel at other times. I would not recommend it to couples for a romantic weekend - it isn't romantic. I think they have some clever marketing but surely they cannot continue to kid everyone all the time. It may be good value if you can drink 48 bottles of beer a day - I sadly couldn't!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Banks Mansion!”
Reviews.Author: USExPatinUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 3 days in Amsterdam, staying at the Banks Mansion. What a lovely hotel in a very convenient Amsterdam location! The Banks Mansion is a high quality, smaller hotel (48 rooms) that offers exceptional service and accomodations and is in a great, central location. We paid extra for a 'canal view' room and were not disappointed. The room was very nicely appointed with flat screen TV, large comfortable bed (two twins together), fully stocked bar and beverages (complimentary in our room - not sure if this is available in all rooms). The hotel offers only breakfast service, which is an excellent hot/cold buffet with made to order eggs/omelettes, pancakes, and french toast. The hotel lobby stocks beverages and snacks available to all hotel guests 24 hours a day. The hotel staff is very helpful, suggesting and making restaurant reservations, airport shuttle, etc. The hotel is located within one block of Rembrandt Plein, Munt Plein, and Singel Flower Market. The Museum District and Waterloo Plein are 10 to 15 minutes walk. The hotel is approximately a 25 minute walk from Central Station (depending upon 'crowd' level). I would definately recommend this hotel -- we certainly plan on staying there again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: europhile234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel to celebrate our anniversary primarily because of the reviews we had seen here. From the moment we arrived, we were not disappointed. After a grueling overnight flight we arrived well before the published check-in time and within 5 minutes we were shown to our room. Because I had mentioned that we would be celebrating my wife's birthday as well as our anniversary during our first trip to Amsterdam, the hotel had placed several welcome gifts as well as a personal note in our room. The location was great! The beds were extremely comfortable, and the staff was perhaps the best that we have encountered. We will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhoar
Reviews.Content: I loved the Banks Mansion Hotel. I use hotels a lot around the world but this is a true gem. I had a corner room (206) it had 3 double windows that opened up onto the canal, complimentary gin, scotch and cognac in the room and complimentary bar in the lobby. Good breakfast was served and the staff were excellent. The position was great being very close to the flower market. My only gripe would be the bed which should have been a double but it was 2 singles pushed together, not the same however i had a walk in shower and huge bath. I will be staying at the Banks Mansion again ;-) Tip ; ask for a corner room they seem to be the largest.

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: miche_2k
Reviews.Content: Just fabulous!! Clean lovely rooms, polite, cheerful and helpful staff. Worth every penny this hotel and will definately be returning later in the year. Such a relaxed hotel, no rowdy stag or hen do's here! I booked it via hotel club for great price and without specifying was given a lovely room overlooking the canal. Inclusive drinks a big bonus and the breakfast kitchen was wonderful. I will recommend it to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam. It is so central to just about everything, in walking distance of it all. You so wont be disappointed. We went to the supperclub and boom chicago too. A totally brilliant weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: London_canuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Banks last week while on a 3 day business trip and enjoyed it so much that I felt compelled to write a review. It is a great hotel -super location, very friendly staff and a real homey atmosphere with free in-room drinks and a cozy lounge with fireplace and self-serve bar. My room was of a good size, with modern amenities -you can even request a special molded pillow. Breakfast is also included and there is a safe luggage room (bags get ticketed) should you need to check out before needing to leave the city. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “We booked through Finnair's TopClub”
Reviews.Author: Finland.Helsinki
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Finnair's Topclub package. It was worth every penny - the room was great, the compleimentary drinks in the room and in the reception area meant that there was a friendly business-like feeling between the guests. The staff were really friendly and the location caould not be better. Near to the center, right on the tram lines and yet quiet during the night. We ate in the Cafe Amsterdam which is at the end of the number 10 tram line. Strong recommendation along with their other restauarant called the Cafe Restaurant Dauphine. Great places...

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hamaudit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on line after reviewing some reviews - I wasn't disapointed. Its a great hotel in a great location. The staff were fantastic and very helpful and I felt very welcome. The location of the hotel is about 100 meters away from the flower market which leads onto the main shopping streets up to Dam Square - a great location. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and will use this hotel everytime I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JR-Eng
Reviews.Content: I can't add much more to other reviews, I had a great stay Feb25 - 27. The room was brilliant with a canal view and as I had to work in it all day Monday, it was very comfortable. Internet access was $22 for 24 hours and the connection was very fast at 12mb. Everything else was just as reported and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, deserves the 5 star reviews”
Reviews.Author: debbieuc
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Banks Mansion and we were not disappointed. Our room was fairly small (if staying in a canal view room avoid 101/201 etc) but beautifully furnished as were all the other areas of the hotel (with the exception of the garish carpets outside the rooms mentioned in other reviews! ) The free drink and snacks is a wonderful idea and there was plenty available - and good stuff too. Lovely to come back to after a day sightseeing or to sit in the lounge for a cognac before going out. The staff couldn't have been more obliging or friendly and the breakfast was delicious. The hotel is really well placed for sightseeing - accessible by trams 16, 24 or 25 from central but also within walking distance if you miss the last one at midnight. One slight negative is the shower which doesn't seal very well and leads to a very wet floor if you are not careful - but that's a minor moan from an otherwise perfect stay. We thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay here if ever visiting Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llany
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in January, there were 7 of us on the trip. The location was super and so was the hotel, I had a room overlooking the canal which was good, one had a room with windows very high so no view BUT they had a sauna in their bathroom,. The reception staff were very helpful to us and the FREE snacks and drinks were great, especially when you had been out walking all day. The rooms are small, the beds are comfy and the bathrooms great, The choice of pillows was great as I have a bad back and need good support. The only downside was the air con, a bit noisy, but switch it off and open a window instead. We ALL had a great time and the Hotel was GREAT. Would DEFINITELY stay THERE AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, bank on it”
Reviews.Author: jets4hire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend, the front desk staff were excellent , rooms were very well appointed including a flat panel tv and free munchies in the room. the hotel only has 51 rooms so in season you must book early, try and avoid the basement rooms as they have no view and street noise can disrupt a good nights sleep. food was always available 24/7 at no extra cost. the hotel is very clean and centrally located no matter what your in town for. excellent value if priced right( best price by far) Yes I'd stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel if you can afford the rate”
Reviews.Author: howarthshome
Reviews.Content: We booked directly over the internet a room with canal view which cost extra and is definitely not a budget price hotel, however, if it fits your budget We can thoroughly recommend it. our room was No 106 on the 1st floor and was decorated stunningly with 3 opening double tall windows looking out onto the canal and main street. Lovely decor, very comfy bed (2 very wide singles pushed together) air con, tv with 2 free porn channels 69 +70 (spice up your weekend - the dutch are definitely not prudes) a superb double size Rain shower and a bath, haidryer etc, plus FREE whisky, conyac and vodka in cut glass decanters and a mini bar stocked with smoothies, coca Cola, beer and fruit juices. That was just the beginning, the staff are so helpful and will recommend eating out etc based upon their experiences. Once you get your bearings you will soon find that you are located in an excellent location whether walking(as we did) or getting buses, taxis or trams. Some of the best places we went were The Ice bar (expensive but worth it) Ranchos Argentinian steak house, Red light district - you will be amazed (just window shopping) Anyway back to the hotel, the breakfasts were great, choice of cooked scambled eggs, bacon and sausage plus fruit, cooked meats, various breads for toast, or your own personally cooked omelette. And in the Living a lovely fire to chill out to when you returned to your hotel each evening with a FREE bar where you just help yourself to beer, wine, spirits and snacks (if there is a bottle that is empty just ask the staff and they will replace it with a full bottle) Then there is the free internet also in the living, by the time you add all the free booze and internet time you soon realise that although it seems a bit expensive when you first book when you check out and your bill is just the same as when you first booked that this hotel is a real find and is actually a bargain. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know and will definitely stay here next time we visit Amsterdam. I hope the other rooms in the hotel live up to room 106. Personally we will ask for 106 when we go again. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: StubbingtonBob
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the hotel in October 2005 with my wife when I knew I was returning on business with two colleagues of course I booked us into Banks Mansion. I know by far the greater majority of reviews about the hotel on this site laud the welcome, the ambiance, "The Living" etc etc. The rare "negative" entry is only to be expected. Having returned today from 2 nights there I am delighted to report that the standards I experienced in 2005 have in no way declined. The welcome on our arrival from the reception staff including "Sarah Trainee" was genuine. The recommendation for a restaurant that night was spot on. (We went to Gauchos just round the corner on the Amstel Straat.) The hotel rooms were excellent, spotlessly clean, breakfast delightful with a more than adequate choice and freshly cooked. My two colleagues were equally impressed and each said they would return as of course would I, either with work or pleasure. Just as an aside here is a restaurant recommendation. It's called "Sherpa" and as can be guessed by the name it is a Nepalese and Tibetan orientatedn restaurant. Located on Leidsedwarsstraat off Leidesplein if you want to try something different I would urge you to give it a go. Very reasonably priced the food is excellent. To conclude ...well done Banks Mansion - your rating here is more than justified and if I return to Amsterdam I know where I shall be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellaoes
Reviews.Content: We booked via the hotel website based on trip advisor reviews and stayed 3 nights. We cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. Staff bend over backwards to make sure you have everything you desire (we were offered a choice of 3 seperate rooms with different views/layouts). We also arrived about 4 hours prior to check in time and were provided with a room immediately by the super friendly reception staff. The rooms had terrific canal views and noise was blocked out by double glazing. Rooms had a lovely art deco them and were a great size! The free movies and mini bar/snacks were an excellent touch and I highly recommend the breakfasts - dutch pancakes and the likes made to order. All the attractions are within an easy walking distance ie Heineken museum, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Dam Square, Red Light District etc. (although if going to central you might prefer to take a tram - which leave from the front door). The incredibly friendly staff made the stay even more pleasant. If you are going to Amsterdam you absolutely MUST stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great as a hotel with a difference.”
Reviews.Author: nobster666
Reviews.Content: No hesitation in recommending this place. Excellent location: walking distance of all main sights and good bars etc. Room clean and well equipped. Nice to have a minibar that is included in the bill. Staff v helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: just_me_Roma
Reviews.Content: Very good location and very good service. Staff is ready to help and support the guest's needs. The complimentary room frigo bar and the complimentary snacks and beverages in the hall have been highly appreciated. The rooms are very comfortable and quite (mine was on the back). Breakfast is included in the room price and 2 computers with free access to internet are available in the hall. Other hotel consider these services as extra. Negative comment: only the ugly moquette outside the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and good value!”
Reviews.Author: drewyzacky
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff couldn't do enough for us. They made our stay very special. The bathroom was amazing and the room was clean and spacious. The breakfast was good and all the drinks and snacks were free of charge. We would stay there again. Have stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam that were more expensive but not as nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendybug
Reviews.Content: Banks Mansion is not your usual European City Centre hotel. It is much more in keeping with the 'Inns' found in New York City. It is all the better for this. Our stay over new year was excellent - from the friendly, efficient check-in; stylish, modern, clean bedrooms; bathrooms you actually want to use (though many rooms simply have walk-in showers rather than a bath so worth checking if that is important to you); 'The Living' where drinks and snacks are available 24/7 - all complimentary - and internet access is free; to the more than sufficient breakfasts served in the kitchen. If you are looking for pomp and ceremony (you know the sort of thing - your poached eggs brought to you covered in a silver dome at breakfast), then Banks isn't for you. If, however, you are content to request freshly cooked pancakes, french toast and feast of high quality fresh bread, jam, cheese and meat at breakfast and prefer a more relaxed hotel stay, this place is perfect. Re comments below regarding the policy of not taking drinks to your room. This is nonsense. Yes, the drinks are for sharing so it is bad form to take a bottle of champagne up to your room, but we (and other guests) were never stopped from taking glasses of wine & champagne, bottles of beer, cups of coffee etc. to our room. As we stayed over new year, a half bottle of champagne was left on our bed - a nice guesture. There is also a well stocked mini bar in each room along with decanters of gin, congac and whisky. For a City Centre base in Amsterdam, Banks Mansion is faultless. I wish every city had an equivalent hotel to save us from the overpriced misery of bland, outdated, business hotels that charge â‚¬20+ for a substandard breakfast. If I had to critique it would be twofold: 1) our loo roll supplies weren't topped up (thoug remedied by a phonecall) and 2) local taxes payable on checkout were unexpected. That said, as everything else was included in the room rate, the bill on checkout was considerably smaller than is usually the case!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzweise
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that Banks Mansion is rated number 2 among hotels in Amsterdam on the tripadvisor website--it's simply a great hotel. As other reviewers have stated, the hotel staff is friendly and helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations, the rooms and beds are comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast, snacks and drinks only add to make your stay more enjoyable. My husband and I stayed at Banks Mansion in early December 2006 with two friends. Our friends are rather picky about where they stay, so I spent a lot of time researching various hotels in Amsterdam based on the location, cost and amenities. We booked the Christmas Shopping arrangement package on the Banks Mansion webiste at a good rate considering everything that was included with it. We were fortunate to be visiting during Sinterklaasavod (December 5th), when Sinter Klaas, along with his helper, Zwarte Piet, arrive to launch the Christmas season. As a part of this celebration, the hotel left cookies at our door as a gift. I have visited Amsterdam in the summer, spring and winter, and I've found December to be one of the best times there because of Sinterklassavod and the Christmas markets. Moreover, of all of the hotels I've stayed in during those visits, none compares with the comfort of Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gemxx
Reviews.Content: Just returned froma hectic two day break in Amsterdam with hubby celebrating his birthday. It was our first time and let me say a big thankyou to all previous reviews about this wonderful vibrant city that helped us make choices about where to stay. We finally decided on the Banks Mansion and it certainly lived up to all your helpful info. We got a great deal on Opodo-much cheaper than the recommended prices, and the free bar was worth the while. It is the only hotel in Amsterdam that offers this service and it saved us a fortune. The hotel is nicely decorated, with tasteful art deco furniture and furnishings (cept the upstairs carpet which was a bit whacky). The beds are really comfy which is very important to us,and the rooms spotlessly clean. Staff were very helpful and friendly but unobtrusive. The hotel enjoys a great location, and very easy to get to and from, tram stops just outside. Also, our concerns about transport were unfounded as Amsterdam has a very good, efficient, fast, cheap and regular system which makes life very easy. everywhere was easy to walk to from this hotel and although we could have got the tram everywhere we enjoyed the canal walks-even in the rain. The shops are lovely, really unusual and it makes a pleasure to see something different, and quality is good. I took a DK mini guide and the recommendations ofr restaurants ect were spot on, namely BOJO's , an inexpensive Indonesian near Leidisplein (think thats how u spell it ) huge portions so share and save. Jordaan area was funky and interesting too. Well its getting longer by the minute so will sign off now, but abs advise you to go and have fun-we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: eddyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over new year's and couldn't really fault it. The concept, the design and the comfort levels are all worthy of praise, as are the staff, one of whom on seeing us getting out of a taxi in a downpour, met us at the door with a couple of towels. Nice touch. Thanks Sonja.

Reviews.Title: “New Year”
Reviews.Author: misslily2001
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights over the New Year period. The things that need mentioning have already been said i.e. the staff were excellent, the shower to die for, the living area was very relaxing, although hotel was full we never felt it. The special touches, the personal service make this an excellent hotel for a relaxing stay in Amsterdam - it deserves it's ranking on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rl82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early November having read the other reviews here on tripadviser. We loved it and only wished we could have stayed longer (only stayed one night). The staff were very friendly and even rang our room just after we arrived to make sure we were satisfied. The room was great with a really comfortable bed. The free drinks and snacks downstairs was what really made the hotel. After a long day's sightseeing we were able to come back and chill out with wine, beer and even some champagne. The atmosphere was really relaxed and having come back from dinner we sat down for more drinks. We would definitely recomend this hotel and would love to make a return visit someday!

Reviews.Title: “A home aeay from home....”
Reviews.Author: lailugold
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel,the staff is very warm and friendly.Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: di.1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything we expected it to be. The staff are courteous, it is situated in a great area, round the corner from some good restaurants (we highly recommend Teppanyaki Nippon Japanese Grill on Reguliersdwarsstraat, just round the corner) and within easy walking distance of most places to see. The decor is excellent,, everywhere is spotlessly clean and particularly the lounge area is comfortable and has a very relaxing ambience. You can help yourself to drinks and snacks at any time of the day, which adds to the overall atmosphere of luxury. Breakfast is fabulous with a chef on call to do fresh omelettes, porridge etc at your desire. We can't recommend this place enough. Its price totally justifies the whole experience of a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NWJ
Reviews.Content: Took a long time in selecting a hotel, but we got the right one. Friendly staff, lovely room and really comfatable bed. Complimentary bar was a nice touch. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Mimiasovitch
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in various other hotels over the years we booked the Banks Mansion on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. We really weren't disappointed. We arrived early expecting to have to leave our luggage until later, but were shown to our room straight away. The room was a good size, very clean and attractive, and most importantly the bed was VERY comfortable. The staff were all lovely, breakfast was great, the free bar is a lovely idea and the shower was fantastic. Next time I will make sure I book a bath, but that is my only gripe. We had booked a canal view room, but whilst that sounds nice we were out and about, walking around the canals. Maybe its a good idea to ensure that the room is quieter. The location was excellent, within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. The walking also helped stave off the inevitable weight gain that follows too many pancakes. We love this city and visit every year. Next year we'll definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Manchester-England
Reviews.Content: I've only stayed in one other hotel in Amsterdam, a soulless Marriott type...but whilst walking round the city i couldn't see any hotel as nice as the Banks Mansion. Its got something....not especially from the outside...and not especially the area, which whilst central didnt have the best view from the side windows (take aways and graffiti) but the inside is just wonderful! Cosy, warm, beautifully decorated, light, modern but with a twenties style about it. Just lovely! The staff are fantastic. Friendly, helpful and without being forced! We got chatting to some guys who were staying in the hotel who told us that the night before they had asked for a cab to be ordered as it was pouring down outside. The taxi still hadnt turned up ten minutes later so the receptionist actually stood outside and flagged one down for them!! Does that not say it all? The free drinks/food thing is great. Not really free of course as Banks Mansion is pretty expensive...but the concept works...it feels good to have drinks and snacks on tap without the irksome task of totting up your bar bill at the end of the night..... Rooms lovely, breakfast great and again helpful staff here too. The outside areas by the way, i may have been a bit harsh. It is in the nicer parts of Amsterdam, along a canal, and not far from the flower market Anyway, we wouldnt stay anywhere else in Amsterdam, it was pretty near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Banks Mansion -- sometimes two stars, sometimes four”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: After a long flight across the Atlantic and a six hour layover in London, we were pathetically grateful to finally reach the Banks Mansion. Our canal view room, booked weeks before our trip, wasn't available. Instead, we were shown to a dark room facing, well, nothing. Not an auspicious start! Two stars or less. Room 312, however, had its good side. The bed was very comfortable and the Banks Mansion offers a "menu" of five different types of pillows, for any kind of firmness or softness you desire. The four pillows already in the room suited us just fine, and I'm a pillow snob. Four stars. The bathroom was also another definite plus. It was very big. The separate shower was large with a huge shower head and loads of water pressure. The tub was great for a deep soak and you faced away from the toilet. I love my bubble baths but I hate staring at a toilet for the duration of my bath. Four stars. However, the towels were tiny and the soap/shampoo situation was pretty miserly. Also, a face towel that went astray sat at the back of the cabinet floor for four days. The cleaner never spotted it though the rest of the bathroom was sparkling. Two stars. Everybody raves about the free booze and snacks. Yes, there are decanters of cognac, gin and whiskey on the bedside table. If that's your thing then I guess it's pretty exciting. I'm a bit of a cynic and always wonder what other guests may have added to the mixture. But, hey, that's just me. There is a mini bar with water, juice, pop and two Heinekens. I must admit that was a nice touch. Also, the bar downstairs had lashings of red and white wine, beers, pops, sparkling and flat waters, coffee, tea, liqueurs, you name it. Help yourself. Four stars. Breakfast (included) was great. No quibbles there. It was open from 7-10:30 during the week and until 11 on the weekend. Very civilized. The usual ham, cheese, muesli, yogurt mix but also the added bonus of omelets, pancakes and porridge made fresh to order. Four stars. The staff were WONDERFUL. Especially Michel. He deftly saved every two star situation and made it into a four. He knew we were disappointed about our room change and made sure a chilled bottle of champagne was waiting for us the next evening as well as an offer to change rooms as soon as a canal view was available (we elected to stay where we were because it was too much of a hassle to re-pack). Noticing our interest in dining, he gave us a fabulous book on Amsterdam restaurants and insisted we keep it. He also gave us great recommendations. A charming man and a real asset to the hotel. As were the rest of the staff. Five stars! Would we go back? We debated this and decided, yeah, we would. By the way, enjoy Amsterdam. It is a FABULOUS city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - with complimentary perks.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: Set in a beautiful corner building with a canal on one side, this hotel should work well for most travelers. We booked a canal view room but we ended up with a partial view room. Translation, a room overlooking the main street but close to the corner so you could look off to the side and see the canal. This room seemed bigger than the canal view rooms and included two windows not the one found in canal view rooms. We were a little disappointed, but we felt we ended up with a good trade off. The bathroom was nice, black and white with a good shower, but the bathroom was pretty small. As others have said, the complimentary food, wine, newspaper, and internet access in the lobby was great. The lobby has a fireplace and several large windows overlooking the canal, creating a nice setting to unwind and relax for awhile after seeing the sights or returning from business. They even had two computers available to use. I wish more hotels would offer this amenity to leisure travelers that leave lap tops behind, especially since it cost them next to nothing. The breakfast each morning was nice with a good selection of foods (including some made to order dishes), but it is held in a basement room that is cute, but not as attractive as other areas of the hotel. The overall decor of the hotel is nice and things are in good condition. The hotel has a slight art deco feel to it. Although the staff was courteous, we did not find them as friendly as other reviewers have. In addition, when we checked out, we ordered a cab through the front desk on an early Sunday morning. After ten minutes we asked the front desk to call again. The front desk employee did and was surprised the cab had not shown by then. About 6-7 minutes later still with no cab, we went outside and hailed one down ourselves. Not sure why this happened, but it put us off a little. Overall, still a nice hotel with a great location and extra amenities not provided by very many hotels. A nice concept usually not found at city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: leavinrichmond
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and we definitely could have stayed longer. The Staff : Very friendly and attentive. Henry, who was on duty when we arrived, saw us exiting our taxi and struggling with our luggage came outside to assist us. After insisting on taking our luggage to the room, he stayed and explained everything the hotel had to offer in detail. At dinner time we asked the clerk at the front desk about a good restaurant in the area and he directed us to a very good Italian restaurant on the corner, Point Arcata. They were also very helpful in assisting us when we had to ship some of our purchases home going so far as to packing them for us. Rooms: Typical small European room but decorated very nicely. The bathroom was very large with a huge tub for relaxing in. Plush terrycloth robes and slippers are provided for you so all you need are your pajamas. Amenities: An extensive breakfast was included in our room price and it was worth every cent. No simple rolls and coffee here! The food and service was excellent! If you stay here, make sure you take advantage of the coffee and drinks that are free and the good snacks that are put out 3 times a day. Internet access is free and lobby is a beautiful place to sit and enjoy the scenery outside (the hotel is near a canal), or to read a book.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Missyjas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Banks Mansion from Sept. 21-26 on vacation. It truly is a great place. The staff is friendly and helpful. The free internet is a great perk as well as all inclusive drinks in the main lobby and in your room. Breakfast was great as well. The rooms were clean, but very small. There is a nice bureau for hanging clothes and some shelves, but we had no place to store our luggage. The canal view was nice to have, but I wouldn't have been comfortable there for an entire weeks stay due to the small quarters. My only other complaint is that the stand-up shower we had leaked horribly. It would flood the ENTIRE bathroom floor, and when I say entire I mean it! We notified the front desk, but all that was provided to us was extra towels. So, I must admit having 3-4 soaking wet towels on the small bathroom floor after your shower was pretty much a pain. The location is great; within walking distance to most everything and to some great restaurants recommended by the front desk staff. We never used the public transit because we were able to walk everywhere. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is that good”
Reviews.Author: isee1
Reviews.Content: It is classed as the best hotel by users of this site and I have to agree. Excellent location close to the Flower Market and Rembrandtplein, Banks Mansion has an understated cool feel. Whilst my room was small, it had a canal view and was perfectly fine for the duration of my stay. Great breakfast and friendly staff and amazingly free in room drinks (inc. alcohol) as well as free bar in the lounge. No charge for internet use either. Personally, wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for tourists, ok for business”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Mariott for the last several years, I decided to give this hotel a try based on the TA reviews..The rooms were very comfortable, very clean(excpet for a few hairs I found in the tub), and the included mini bar was pretty darn cool. The breakfast was wonderful(get the pancakes - typical dutch). This is not a great business hotel although..The font office desk is VERY friendly but not skilled at handling business requests..We tried to get them to FEDEX a box of samples and they were mystified at the process. Also, the front office person recommended the dry cleaner next to the hotel...BEWARE...the dry cleaner temporarily misplaced my colleagues clothes and when they were found, we had already moved onto London. The owner would not forward them as she stated we had not paid for them..Another colleague had to go and pick them up. The hotel is great, but I would give it a strong recommendation for the vacationer versus the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: damosilvers
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel that I actually booked before reading the reviews. My wife and I spent two excellent nights there on 22 and 23rd September 2006. All the previous reviews were spot on. From the moment we arrived the staff were so helpful and friendly. The room was perfect and the flowers I had ordered were in the room waiting (I have never seen such a fantastic bouquet). The location is fine and the complimentary drinks in both the room and the lounge area were an excellent idea. Would highly recommend and will be staying there again for definite.

Reviews.Title: “Banks Mansion-Great!”
Reviews.Author: lrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banks Mansion after a 9 day Baltic cruise. We were spoiled from the service on the ship and Banks Mansion did not disappoint. Check in was easy. We arrived at the hotel around 10AM. Our rooms were not ready but they happily stored our many pieces of luggage while we toured Amsterdam. Arrived back around 2PM and not only were our rooms ready but our luggage was already in them! Rooms were modern with fabulous sound systems and flat screen TV's. Air conditioning was working well and our room was actually "cold". Service at the front desk, bar area and breakfast was wonderful. The bar has many different options (alcoholic and non) and food choices too. Keep in mind that this hotel is truly "all inclusive". Even the internet access was complimentary. Great location and within walking distance to most everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveler looking for a 3-4 star experience. The only thing missing is room service. Not a problem here. Coffee and light bites are always available. Great restaurants are less than 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ali83
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. My friend and I stayed at the hotel for a week in the middle of August. The staff were consistently helpful and friendly and were happy to recommend restaurants and make reservations whenever needed. The whole "at home" concept is great and the selection of snacks and drinks available could not be faulted. Breakfast was also varied and plentiful. My only slight criticism is that there do not seem to be any true twin rooms in the hotel - the best we could do was to inch our two single beds apart every night which was not easy since they were held together by a top cover; however, I would still have no hesitation in booking into this hotel again if I were spending time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: lorrieuk
Reviews.Content: What can Isay that has not already been said. My husband and I stayed at the Banks Mansion over August Bank Holiday. We upgraded to canal view room which was well worth it. As soon as we arrived we were impressed by the building, the cleanliness of the hotel, how smart and how helpful the staff are. A special thanks to Nina who made us feel so welcome, and always had a smile for everyone. All staff lovely but Nina stood out from the rest. Our room was large by european standards, spotless and as mentioned by others had very well stocked mini bar. The breakfast room was lovely with a good selection of foods, my husband enjoyed his freshly made omelettes very much. Once again everything was spotless. Amsterdam is a lovely place to visit with very friendly helpful people. So easy to get around and we always felt safe. If you are making your way from the station to the hotel by tram make a note to get tram number 24, 25 and I think 16 also goes there. the hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the tram stop. Ask for Herengracht Canal. Thank you Banks Mansion for making our stay a wonderful one. Lorraine and David.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Banks Mansion!”
Reviews.Author: Joteddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Banks Mansion for 3 nights on 25th August 06, for mine & husband's 10th wedding anniversary (without our kids hurray!! - thanks mum and dad for looking after them!). Was very excited about staying at the hotel, especially after reading so many positive reviews on trip advisor. Arrived after a short delay on our flight at around 7 pm, we were greeted by 'Nina' on Reception, who was very friendly. We were given room 201 which had a view overlooking the Herengracht canal, and our window was directly opposite the Mayor of Amsterdam's house!! Lovely room, large bed with a chair/footstool at the side. Nice shower-room in art-deco style with a lovely big shower cubicle. The shower leaked onto the floor each time so we had to make good use of the bath mat, but it wasnt worth complaining about! Loved the plasma tv on the wall, and the dvd player. Also enjoyed the free decanters of drink - gin, brandy and whiskey. We made it to breakfast 2 of our 3 mornings, very nice but found the girl who made the omelettes/french toast etc a bit stroppy. I think she was just a bit stressed as she had been left alone by her colleagues, but even so she was a bit rude! (I only asked if there was another loaf of bread as when we arrived in the breakfast room there was none!). (on Sundays the breakfast room is open until 11, we had arrived at approx. 10:20 - so obviously we expected to have bread available)! However, dont let this put you off, the hotel is great in general! We made good use of the 'living area' where they provide free coffee and pastries in the mornings, alcoholic drinks (more or less everything you can think of) and nuts/doritos/dips etc in the afternoon/evening. Oh, and free use of the internet if you need it. The hotel was in an excellent location, everything we were interested in seeing was within a 10 minute walk. We had a lovely meal (probably the nicest meal we've ever had - and we've eaten in a fair few restaurants!), at Casa di David which is located on the Singel, a 7 minute walk from Banks Mansion. To start we shared bruschetta with mozzarella and pesto - delicious. My husband then had a plain old spaghetti bolognaise - but said it was the best he'd ever eaten! I had kebabs of king prawn & poached salmon, on a bed of green beans with parmesan dressing - gorrrrgeous! This was served with saute potatoes. The food was lovely, the setting lovely, waiters very friendly, lovely atmosphere. (by the way we got Nina at Banks Mansion to reserve us a table as we'd tried to get in on the Friday night but couldnt). We also ate lunch at Cafe de Kroon in Rembrandtplein, just a snack, but it was a lovely sunny day and nice to people-watch for an hour or so! We also tried a 'coffee shop'. We stayed away from the tourist-y ones, and went to a more 'locals' type coffee shop. Had a great atmosphere, with funky dance music playing. Had a wander through the Red Light District - what an eye-opener!!! Also did a canal boat tour, during the day, this was really enjoyable too. We spent one morning shopping in Kalverstraat - a few nice clothes shops (some designer, some high street), everything a bit cheaper than the UK. All in all, will definitely go back to Amsterdam one day, and will stay at Banks Mansion!

Reviews.Title: “You don't get much better.”
Reviews.Author: JKTravel
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site are excellent and almost put you in a mind to be hyper critical. We couldn't be. All hotels should be like this: generous, welcoming and professional. We enoyed our stay here and we are determined to return to the hotel and to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleToesBum
Reviews.Content: This was a truly brilliant hotel. We were stunned to find that not only did we have a FREE mini bar in our room, but you could also help yourself to all the drinks in the hotel foyer too!!!! Plus, the staff brought out snacks throughout the day. The staff were all so helpful and were always polite. Our room was lovely too and I thought great value for money - hooray for "Steam-free" mirrors in the bathroom, bath robes, ice crushing machines in the hallways, free drink in the room decanters etc Two pieces of advice for people visiting though.... 1) Try not to miss breakfast - we managed it once and they were so scrummy. We were so sad that we had missed it the other days 2) I wouldn't bother with the breakfast in bed - it wasn't great! We had no spoons on our tray, we didn't get what we ordered and it was not included in the price (if you go down to the breakfast hall, breakfast is included) We can't wait to visit this hotel again.... it was fantastic, brilliantly located (only a short distance from everything, but far enough away to be quiet and relaxing) and very, very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Loved Banks Mansion”
Reviews.Author: Cardinal80
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was outstanding. All of the employees were helpful and kind. This was a wonderful vacation! My husband and I spend 7 nights at the Banks Mansion and loved the location. There are excellent restaurants nearby and we were able to walk to anything we wanted to see or do. We think this hotel was worth every penny we paid. Our room was very comfortable, fashionable, and clean. The other hotels in the area of similar class didn't offer all of the ammenities the Banks offers. The breakfast was wonderful, the snacks and drinks were thoroughly appreciated. The living area was hospitable and the free internet was fantastic. If we return to Amsterdam, we will return to the Banks Mansion!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Great Staff. Ideas For Your Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Healthysean
Reviews.Content: Well, thank you Trip Advisor Holiday People. I chose the Banks Mansion on the remarks on this site. My wife and I have just come back from 5 nights at the hotel and cannot praise the hotel enough. But first let me explain one thing, we work hard to be able to stay in top quality hotels, with great locations, great rooms etc, and have been lucky to stay in many beautiful hotels around the world. So what was so unique about a hotel that is graded as a three star, but here on trip advisor as a five star, and it deserves it. For the first time I went by reviews here, and made notes of everthying my wife and I did to help you all, and make your stay as good as ours. This hotel does not go for massive luxury, but has massive amounts of friendliness, comfort, service, drinks, coffee's etc. Unique is the word for the all exclusive service, pillows yes lovely, bed yes very comfortable, televisions great, shower well did not want to leave the shower! Our stay was even made better by all the reception staff, especially Frederique and Sonja (hope I have spelt them right) who went out of their way to help my wife find some craft shops. The lounge area was also very nice for the internet, coffee, Baileys, Brandy, Beers, waters, fruit juice, snacks. With also drinks in your fridge in your rooms, and Gin, Whiskey and more. All this and we hardly drink, but I have to admit to enjoying a baileys and coffee at the end of the evening. The area also is perfect, 10 minutes away from shops, rembrandt square (loads of cafes), 20 minutes walk at the most from Grand Central Station, 10 minutes from DamSquare. Highly recommended to you from someone who studies what to do on holidays. 1 Anne Frank House 2 The Red Light Tour 3 Sauna Deco (more in next paragraph)(has it's own web site) 4 Privare hire of driver and his car (with drinks and snacks) (Dennis Van Leerdam phone 0655785832) 5 Canal Bus (14 stops, get on and off canal bus) 6 Candlelight Canal Tour (lindbergh) I really hope this help you, and is not too much reading. Sauna Deco, Wow !! Twenty Minute walk from the hotel, on the same canal, where you can have sports massage, and any massage. But if your not modest it is a unisex sauna, steam , relax , showers, plunge pool , with no clothes, another eye opener and very relaxing. The private car with Dennis Van Leerdam was great to travel to the windmills, Boerk, and the Waterland area. I hope you enjoy your stay , please feel free to mention my wife and my name (Mr Sean Peters and Mrs Tracey Peters), let me know. May post photos later, don't forget to ask for a canal view. I really enjoyed Amsterdam, the old bikes, the great people, and the great coffee shops, beautiful properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TraceyGL
Reviews.Content: What a fab place. It is as described. Its in a good location to be away from too much hustle and bustle but near enough to walk to anything. Lovely air conditioned room. Free drinks, snacks and internet. Great breakfasts. The staff can't do enough for you. Not cheap but well worth splashing out on for the perfect stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jzking
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, especially in regards to its location. Being located on the southern part of Herengracht, it is close to everything. So, this is defenitely a strong point for this hotel. As far as cleanliness and styling, this hotel gets good marks. The rooms have a modern business feel that isn't formulated like many large hotels. The lobby has a nice bar with complimentary cokes, water, juices, snacks, etc. Breakfast was especially enjoyable with a full menu and a chef to make omellets, pancakes, and the like. The customer service is very good for a 3* hotel although, one of the night clerks was somewhat overbearing when it came to getting a water from the mini bar. Definetly has more of a 5* feel than 3*. We got a nightly rate of 199 euros which I thought was very reasonable considering the location and amenities. A lot of people have knocked this hotel on the price but I don't think their complaints have much merit. All things considered such as location, service, and amenities, I highly recommend this hotel to small families, couples, and business traverlers alike.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker11
Reviews.Content: Booking direct with the hotel gives you the best rates, but they are well worth it for a fab hotel in a great location. can't recommend it highly enough, we had a great stay and the staff were really helpful

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stanat
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on-line and if you keep on reading you'll find out why. After booking the hotel through a travel website, we contacted the hotel directly and asked if we could be upgraded because we were celebrating our anniversary. When we arrived we were greeted as if we were old friends. We were told that we had the option of picking from 3 different rooms. When we entered the first room, on the bed was a porcelain figurine of a dutch boy and girl puckering up to kiss and a note stating " Welcome to the Banks Mansion. We are so pleased that you chose us to celebrate your anniversary." The room was beautiful, facing the front of the hotel on the corner with views of the canal in either direction. The room was large even by american standards. The room had double beds pushed together, a large armchair wth footstool, a desk with a mirror, a tall closet and plenty of space to walk around. The bathroom had a shower stall with a refreshing rain showerhead, a bathtub which could also be used for showering and the sink was higher than ordinary making for easier use. The room had AC which we could control which we found to be unusual in european hotels and which we were very grateful for because we hit a hot spell in Europe. Needless to say, we never viewed the other two rooms. The " living" and the mini in roombar along with the three decanters of gin, whiskey and cognac were as advertised and included in the room price, plentiful and useable 24 hours. I shouldn't forget to mention free internet use. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. There was an egg, etc. station where you could order what you wanted. The cook remembered and asked us if we wanted the same order as we ordered the day before. The only drawback is that the "kitchen" has no AC which on some days, because of the hot spell, made it uncomfortable. If that were not enough, the staff was extra-ordinary. They were always pleasant, smiling and very helpful. Nothing that is asked is too much for them. Don't miss this place. It is an unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChicNewYorker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I together with two friends stayed at this cozy Hotel for 4 nights/5 days and we loved it! we stayed in a deluxe room overlooking the canals; our room was spacious with modern fixtures, clean marble bathroom, tub for two and separate shower. The hotels concierge and front desk personnel were extremely helpful, courteous which spoke well about Dutch hospitality! they had great restaurant recommendations and knew what we wanted to a T. Another great addition they had was the free mini-bar, coffee/cocktails and afternoon snacks in the lobby! This hotel comes highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: justfrank
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently spent 9 nights at Banks Mansion. It was a great choice for a long stay, because everyone at the hotel goes out of their way to make you feel like you're in a home away from home. Upon our early morning arrival, the room we'd reserved was still occupied. The desk clerk asked if we'd like to try a different room. We agreed, but soon after that decided we'd like something else (all of the rooms are different). Even so, they let us sleep in the room we weren't keeping for 3 hours before moving us to our actual room. I've never encountered hospitality like that. Our room (210) was spacious, quiet and pleasant, if a bit dark. The bed was comfortable and the A/C kept the desired temperature. The bathroom was lovely.
