There is a complimentary minibar that they will stock with almost anything you ask for, and in the lobby there's complimentary beverages and snacks 24 hours a day. The breakfast room was very hot, but the food was good. The location is on a canal near Rembrandtplein, and it was no more than a 10 minute walk to all of the major tourist sites, and the tram runs right by the hotel. Everything about our stay was excellent, but what made it special was the caring, attentive staff that bent over backwards to help us at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfectly charming”
Reviews.Author: kidfree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Banks Mansion July 6-9th. It was wonderful! Our room was a very nice size with a HUGE bathroom with both a rain shower and a large tub. We loved the free drinks and internet access. We didn't eat any of the "snacks" since we spent a good part of our days in Amsterdam eating. The breakfast was very pleasant and the staff were sweet and helpful. We ate a FABULOUS Indonesian meal at a restaurant suggested by the staff, Indrapura on Rembrandplein. Things not to miss in AMsteram: Van Gogh Museum. Rijksmuseum, Anne Frank House, The Jewish Museum, Maoz Falafel, Indonesian Food, Austailian Ice Cream, Amnesia and Mellow Yellow Coffee Houses, Casis soda, walking along the canals, pancakes, etc. I really loved the city (even more than I did when I was there 20 years ago as a 21 year old). The people are so nice and you can walk the city from top to bottom in a day and the Banks Mansion is located right in the middle without being too congested.

Reviews.Title: “Hurrah for Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Wharfman
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Banks Mansion after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Once again the feedback has come up trumps - what a great little hotel. Loved the friendly surroundings, staff, free lounge bar, free mini bar, decor, rooms (rain shower and steam). What more can you say that hasn't already been said, only that if you want a great stay in Amsterdam book now!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celticx
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Banks Mansion they had no record of our booking, which i booked 4 wks prior, the gentleman on reception was very helpful and located us on the fourth floor overlooking the canal. The room was very small and cramped, but who cares its Amsterdam. The location of the hotel is great and in easy walk of most attractions. When we returned to the hotel in the early hours the front doors were broken and we were left waiting outside until we were allowed enter througt the goods delivery door in the basement. Breakfast was the best of our trip. Overall this hotel would only get a 3 star in the UK or Ireland and is overpriced Euro 230. 00 for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Quatchman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 3 nights at the beginning of July. The hotel is ideally situated and in walking distance to all the main areas. The reviews that I read before we travelled are spot on; this is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it. We used the Connexions shuttle service located at A7 at the airport. Took around 20mins to get to the hotel at a cost of 12 euros each which I didn't think was bad when you consider it drops you right outside the hotel. Will use the tram and train to return just for a different experience. Apparantly the train to the airport runs every 15 minutes and the tram can be picked up about 50m from the hotel. The staff are extremely helpful with plenty of knowledge about the area and things to do and see. The room which features the complimantary minibar was great, a good size and extremely clean and well presented. It was very hot when we stayed and the air-con was a welcome relief from the heat of the streets. The addition of the complimantry bar in the lounge together with snacks and sweets was also a real plus together with the free internet access on which i'm writing the review right now! We were recommended the Dynasty chinese restaurant by the staff who based their advice not only on having visited their themselves but also with the aid of the trusty restaurant guide book they have behind the counter with ratings based on customer experiences. We paid 90 euros for the 2 of us; not cheap but the food and service was exceptional. If the weather is good ask for a table in the rear courtyard garden which is very pretty and away from the hustle and bustle with a great atmosphere. We did what I imagine are the usual museum visits including the Anne Frank house which is about a 25min walk from the hotel. Don't be fooled by what appears to be a queue that stretches round the corner. It moves pretty quick and once inside there is plenty of space to walk around freely. Pretty poignant stuff. Keep your wits about you in the Red Light District and ignore the the drug dealers and you'll be fine. Overall, we had a great time and would highly recommended the Banks Mansion !

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: pitball
Reviews.Content: well, the wife and i have just got back from banks mansion, we spent 4 nights there, from the 3rd july, till 7th july, this was our 5th trip over to the dam, and this hotel is, without doubt, the best hotel we`ve had the pleasure to stay at in amsterdam,the room was stunning, the staff are the the friendliest hotel staff we`ve ever enncoutered, one of the girls on reception, even phoned and booked a lovely meal at INDRAPURA, {a excellent indonesian restaurant}, one of the things we really liked,was how, when youve just got back from sight-seeing/shopping, you could pop into the free lobby bar, have yourself a couple of drinks to wind down, and the bar wasnt abused by anyone, then there was the constant supply of snacks, to sum up, a AWESOME HOTEL, and we will use this hotel for future trips to amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. Could not fault anything. The staff were very very helpful giving advice on where to eat and what to do, nothing is to much trouble. The free bar in the living area is an excellent concept and also the free mini bar in the room is excellent. I would definately be returning to this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: usagirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super value for money. Without exception the staff are polite, friendly, and very helpful, giving the impression that no request is too much trouble. The rooms are comfortable and have good amenities, the location is busy but very central, and the free bar/snacks/internet are very swell perks. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and recommend it without reservation (no pun intended). A personal note to the Australian woman there on business who shared our cab to the airport and didn't even offer to share the cost, shame on you. You know who you are.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheffgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Banks Mansion for 4 nights June 9th to 13th, every thing about this hotel was perfect, the location is excellent, the staff are super friendly and helpful, the rooms though on the small side are very well laid out and tastefully decorated, the free mini bar and lounge bar are a really nice touch and never abused, the inclusive breakfast was excellent with a wide selection of food served in a very homely atmosphere. We loved Amsredam and will definitely stay at Banks Mansion on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kingbingo1
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the pictures do it justice, but we had a wonderful, wonderful stay at Banks Mansion. It is very centrally located where trams #16 and #24 run right by it. It is right on the canal, but our room was located so that right below us would be the street and if we lean just a bit from our window we can see the canal. If you ask for rooms facing the canal, that would be preferable. All the other houses along the same street facing the canal use to be mansions of Amsterdam's elite society similar to our hotel, renovated to be a great value hotel. We usually like decors reflecting the grand old elegance of a past era, but the modern/art deco look was a treat. It is far from the largest hotel we've stayed in around the world, but by European standards and for the price the room is a good size with room for a desk and a lounge chair to relax in instead of having to camp out on the bed to watch TV. The TV sound pipes into the bathroom so that we can listen to the news while getting ready. The staff was friendly, accomodating and it was cute to see a petite girl running to help us carry in our luggage we hauled across France and Belguim, into the hotel entrance. The lobby has 2 PCs with internet connections, comfortable seating areas and one area near a fireplace. The hotel provides snacks, liquor, wine, beer, coffee and tea in the lobby 24 hrs a day, constantly stocked so that we can help ourselves like we were at home. The mini-bar in the room is also complimentary and I think we are still shell-shocked over that one. Gin, Vodka and Gran Marnier were also provided in cut glass ware in the room. Every morning we went downstairs to the Kitchen where a full breakfast is provided, again complimentary. Besides the full continental breakfast items, eggs, sausages and bacon are provided. If you want, there is a cook available to cook pancakes, eggs any way you want, french toast and waffles. At that point we were on the road so long we were glad to eventually go home, but when we stayed at Banks Mansion, it was about the closest thing to home we could get on the road. We felt welcomed and pampered and relaxed. Thanks so much Banks Mansion personnel!

Reviews.Title: “It's good”
Reviews.Author: CroydonBoy
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with added bonus of free room bar and hotel bar. Seemed to have a relaxed attitude to me bringing friends over as well. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pandaEdinburgh_UK
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great; and the staff are extremely helpful - very professional and friendly. The free facilities were a unique feature for us, though we do usually stay in 4 star hotels - everything you consume is provided at no extra charge, and this includes a wide range of drinks (hot and cold) and also snacks/nibbles/pastries etc. The room was comfortable with a lovely view of the canal. A bath would have been nice, in addition to the lovely shower, but we didn't actually request this (would do so if staying again). Only thing that disappointed was the Amsterdam weather - but the hotel can't do anything about that! Great museums, and we also recommend the cheese/wine canal cruise if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff Great Location Free Wine”
Reviews.Author: Alirog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Banks Mansion for 4 nights & had a 1st floor room overlooking the Canal. Although it was close to the main road, the windows blocked out all noise. The room was fairly standard, bathroom has shower only, but was a massive walk-in monsoon shower. Bed was ultra comfy, slept really well. Drinks & snacks included was a bonus, but did tend too encourage hanging round hotel rather than sampling bars of Amsterdam. Breakfast was ok, nothing too thrilling - could do with fresh brewed coffee rather than coffee machine. Plenty of choice though. Location was excellent, easy access to canals & main shopping district, also on main tram rout for easy access to cental station etc. It was my birthday while we were there & the hotel left a nicely wrapped gift for me in the room which was a lovely touch. Overall a good choice for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarkkuOulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights with my wife. Great location "between" the busy city and more relaxed quarters with antique shops, galleries and good restaurants. We didn't need any transportation during our stay due to the location (visited e.g. Rijksmuseum, Anne Frank Huis and Oude Kerk). Very friendly staff. The room was small on US standards, but big enough for a few nights stay. For dinner experience visit Pasta e Basta with singing waiters / waitresses. We learned to visit the museums early in the morning, i.e. before 10 am. The queues were really long in the afternoon. Banks Mansion is one of the best hotels I've stayed at (I'm staying 40 - 60 nights a year in hotels mainly in Scandinavia, US and Asia). If you fancy large 5 star hotels, this is not your place. If you would like to stay in a smaller place with cozy home feeling, this definitely is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidMM
Reviews.Content: We've just returned form three nights in this hotel and I just had to write to agree with the vast majority of reviews it already has on this site. This isn't the cheapest hotel in Amsterdam but the decor, staff and extras make it exceptional value for money. It was great to come back to the hotel late afternoon and relax in the Living area with a tea and some nibbles. And even better was to return in the evening and enjoy a Grand Marnier before retiring upstairs. The staff are incredibly helpful, all speak English and go that exrtra mile to help you enjoy your stay. For example, we asked about booking tickets for the Van Gogh exhibition and the girl did it all for me. We only had a few minor quibbles, for example the thermostat on our shower needed a service and the hairs between our matresses could have been removed before we checked in but overall I'd recommend this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “You can't please all the people all the time!”
Reviews.Author: viagemsespeciais
Reviews.Content: It's clear staff at Banks Mansion enjoy their job. The service during my stay was excellent. Eventhough I continually asked them questions, they allways took time for me. Too bad not everyone can be satisfied. I was present in the lobby when there were some problems with the airconditioning and overheard some people complaining. Staff tried their best too make the sour lemon sweet by offering fans but some people couldn't be satisfied. I was there for a week and saw they resolved the problem within the same weekend. So NOT 'The worst hotel' but one of the better onces I've ever visited. My compliments to all the staff, I will certainly be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsmith
Reviews.Content: I just want to add to the praise for the Banks Mansion Hotel. The perfect place to stay in Amsterdam for either business or pleasure. My husband and I had 3 wonderful nights in May 2006 at this hotel. Our room was a little small and not in the best location, but I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. One reviewer complained about the noise level from the street, but I did not hear a thing and our room was on the street level. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was up-to-date with a very pleasant rain shower. The breakfast was very nice with many choices and the snacks in the lobby where a real treat after a day of touring. I would definitely stay here again if I have the pleasure of returning to Amsterdam. Also the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay which was a birthday treat for my mum. And we had a fantastic time. We go away every year together for a short break and the Banks Mansion is definitely the best hotel we have stayed at! It wasn't cheap, however it was well worth the money for all the 'extras'. Free drinks both in room and 'living' area, free internet, great breakfast, dvds etc.. I have just read the review of the american couple who complained and said it was the worse service they've ever experienced. Well, I find this seriously hard to believe. Were they really staying in the same hotel???? We found the staff extremely attentive and helpful and obliging to every request. And everything with a smile! And everything really has been well thought out in the rooms... right down to the 'pillow menu' to ensure that you get a good nights sleep! The location is also great and having now stayed at the Banks Mansion I can't imagine wanting to stay at another hotel in Amsterdam when I go back next! Incidentally, we also went to a lovely restaurant called Zuid Zeeland - just about 100m along the herengacht canal. It wasn't cheap, but service and food were both excellent. We also tried Gaucho on Dam Trak and although neither of us are big meat eaters and were initially a bit put off about eating in an Argentinian restaurant, they don't just serve steak! And the food was very good and reasonable value, especially considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: foreman41
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice three day stay in this Hotel, We dicided to walk from the Station and it took us around 25 mins dragging a suitcase, so you might want to take a Taxi or jump on a Tram. Upon Checking in (and the rest of our stay) we found the Staff very polite and friendly. We where shown around the lobby and Breakfast room, and told about the free drinks and snacks bar. The room on the 2nd floor over looked the Canal was a little small but thats normal for European Hotels in General, it was clean and the bed very comfortable you even get several choices of pillow, we had no bath just a Shower, but that had a very nice Rainshower head which was very refreshing after a long days siteseeing, The Mini bar which is free was quite depleted by day two and to our surprize wasnt restocked by the evening, but a quick call to the Front Desk and 5 mins later room service arrived to fill it. We found the Hotel to be the perfect location and walked to all the main attractions, I was very surprized to read the ONE bad review on this Hotel all I can say is we didnt find anything to complain about and would recommend it to anyone and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLowder
Reviews.Content: Stayed there at the end of April and we absolutly loved this hotel. All the reviews below document the details and are spot on. I would add that EVERYTHING in this hotel is very well thought out. All the details are planned and considered for your pleasure. We also stayed at the NH Krasnopolsky which is a fine hotel closer to the red light district. We did enjoy our stay there, but I would return to Banks Mansion due to: Lobby Open Bar, free in-room bar with soda, beer, etc..., DVD player with free movies, absolutly perfect rooms and service and the abundant breakfast. Oh, I did forget the free internet in the looby! I could not recomment this hotel more - if you can - stay there. We paid a little over $200 per night and it was worth every penny if not more.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: citychicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from April 28 - May 2. It was such a treat! There are two internet computers free to use in the lobby near the free bar. Along with drinks (wine, alcohol, sodas, water, coffee...) they also had candies and other snacks throughout the day. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We were never up early enough for the free breakfast that goes until 11 am but I am sure it is good. The room was large enough to feel like a comfortable place to be for 5 days with a desk tv, dvd, sitting chair, couch and wardrobe. The bathroom was very nice with a relaxing rain shower. The location is PERFECT for walking anywhere you want to go. And as the previous reviewer said, the bar and the lobby make it a treat to come home from a night out; you can relax and have a nightcap before returning to bed without spending any more money. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. I did a lot of research before choosing the banks mansion and I'm glad I found this place. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: MnMManchester
Reviews.Content: Just to confirm everything the previous reviews have stated. The hotel is well situated for walking round Amsterdam and also has a tram stop virtually outside the door for easy access to anywhere in the city. Staff, although mainly young, are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are a delight with comfortable beds, flat screen T.V., free mini-bar, decanters of spirits, etc. Our particular room had a wonderfully refreshing rainshower. The concept of free drinks and snacks in The Living made returning after sightseeing a pleasure. The hotel was not cheap but in our view was great value for money. We would stay here again without any hesitation whatsoever and will be recommending it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel and Quality location”
Reviews.Author: BASS174
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last week.It was absolutely top quality.The staff were extremely helpful and courteous.The bedroom was very comfortable and the free mini bar and decanters of spirits were a novelty. The lounge area with complimentary refreshments and snacks was just fantastic.Having stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam previously, we will definitely return to Banks Mansion, it is so good that I can't think why anyone would wish to stay elsewhere. In addition, I don't think that the location could be bettered. First class all round!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SIMPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during easter weekend and never had any problems. The Breakfast was v-good, the double room was a good size for two and a thought the free mini bar and bar down stairs was a nice extra. I would definitely stay here again coz of how good the hotel was and with it being in a great location( next to rembrandtplein)!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: aitchjayes
Reviews.Content: I have just spent the Easter weekend at this hotel and totally agree with the reviews on this site. The room was lovely we had one with walk-in rain shower and although our room didn't have a canal view, it didn't matter as how long do you actually spend in a room? The lounge area is good with the hospitality area excellent. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul082
Reviews.Content: Short review but everything about this hotel is first class, the staff, the rooms, the location. Probably the best foriegn hotel for all round satisfaction i have stayed in. The two restaurants they recommended to me were excellent both within about 300 yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: daisyuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great. I go to Amsterdam every year at the same time and have been staying in another hotel, but on our last visit is was just not up to standard. I decided to try this one after reading the reviews and this is where I am going back too. The staff are very friendly and very helpful, the room was very clean and very comfortable. The free mini bar in the room and the free bar downstairs were great. The breakfast was great, fresh fruit, cereals, bacon and eggs was all available. If you stay here I would recommend two restaurants near by, Weinders which is on Prisengracht and Pygma-Lion which is on Nieusw Spiegelstraat. I just want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this one!”
Reviews.Author: lmandpb
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of which hotel to choose - this is a dead cert. Lovely place, terrific room (with great bathroom), and best of all, loads of complimentary drinks and snacks any time of the day. This is great after a hard days exploring, or when you come in at night and want to help yourself to a coffee or wine,etc. Really lovely place with very helpful staff -couldnt fault it. Location is great, close to everywhere without being in the middle of too much noise. Try the Chinese restaurant directly opposite - also the indonesian across the street pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of the future”
Reviews.Author: alatbish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Banks Mansion 17 % 18 March. Scaffolding up outside as they paint the building but didn't spoil our stay - spring visitors will benefit. Everything was excellent. Staff young, trendy, friendly and couldn't be more helpful, atmosphere - cosy & relaxed. Drinks and nibbles are an excellent idea. Room modern-TV, video, CD player - fantastic rainwater shower. Comfy bed. Breakfast good. Drinks bar and whisky, gin & brandy decanters. Just couldn't ask for more. Prices not particularly cheap (420 Euros 2 nights double) & I would be tempted to phone to get their quote to compare with online rates, BUT you will reap the benefits of a great, fairly small (50 rooms) hotel with personal service. good location too - short walk to most things. Recommend the red light walking tour - you learn so much more, Anne Frank museum, the trams and the Bangkok thai restaurant - just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel.....so cosy!”
Reviews.Author: gilliani
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in December last year as a last minute break. We booked directly through the hotels website as this was the best price....contrary to what we had read on various travel company sites! We arrived at the hotel at around 10.30pm but had let the hotel know that our flight didn't arrive till late...they were very friendly and helpful and didn't seem hassled by our late arrival. We ended up getting the train to the centre of amsterdam as the shuttle bus was very expensive and told us it did not pass our hotel....even though the sign said it did! The hotel room was really clean and well decorated though was not the hugest room it was fine for the two of us. The beds are comfortable and you have a choice of pillows. The tv is plasma screen- wall mounted and the movies/ all channels are free. The mini bar in the room is well stocked with lager,coke,diet coke,fruit juices,water and you have large decanters of brandy,whisky and gin too. We drank much of this on the first night (oops!) but returned to our room the next day-after shopping!- to find that these had all been restocked. The bar area in the hotel recpetion was lovely...cosy fireplace and christmas tree! There are also lots of free drinks availible here...as well as snacks such as nuts/olives/cheeses etc. Overall we had a great time and found the hotel very welcoming and a lovely place to hang around in both during the day and at night. It is a little expensive though worth it for a treat! The only thing we thought it could improve on was food...maybe restaurant or room service could be offered?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bocey
Reviews.Content: We have returned from 2 days at this wonderful hotel.The hotel is in a great location,all attractions easily accessible. The hotel is in the Art Deco style.Downstairs there is an open fire,seating and the 'honesty' bar.The whole atmosphere of this hotel is summed up by the free bar and free mini bar in your room,they say they want it to feel like 'home from home'and it does.The free bars are a wonderful idea,you have no large overpriced drinks bill to collect on checking out,but this privilege was never abused on our visit. The hotel room was lovely,flat t.v on the wall,dvd player,free movies and a great bathroom.The bathroom has a huge walk in shower with rain head shower. Breakfast was good also,agood choice of food,cereal,fruit,cold meat,cheeses and the normal bacon,eggs and sausage,simple but great. The staff were excellent throughout our stay,very helpful.They recomended a french restaurant for us on the saturday night,we had the taster menu(as recommended by an earlier review)and it was the best meal we have ever had. To sum up,this is a great hotel,in a great location at a reasonable price. We booked through Opodo and paid Â£225 for the 2 nights. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Heaven”
Reviews.Author: yardley
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at Banks Mansion, very impressive !! Staff could not do enough for us and we extremely warm and friendly, no problem providing any information required. Rooms were very good, complimentary decanters of gin, brandy and whisky and the fridge was also stocked with beers and mixers. Although there was a free bar downstairs in the lounge with cakes and snacks and a coffee machine. (My 1 bugbear was that there were no facilities to make tea and coffee in the rooms) The bathrooms are wonderful, a bath big enough to swim in and a'rain shower' to wake you up in the morning. The food was plentiful, we ordered room service on the sat morning for 2 of us and there was enough food to feed at least 4 people. Location wise it was ideal, less than 10 mins away from Dam Square so all attractions easy to find. All in all, a wonderful hotel with excellent facilities and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay here. I had stayed there previously when it was called the Canal Crown, and things have improved a lot since then. Great location close to some main attractions. Free bar & minibar is a good idea and works well. For the price, I found the room could have done with a little fixing up as some fixtures were showing wear & tear, but overall a nice room. Large rainshower in particular a great feature. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mit_and_biny
Reviews.Content: Location: great location, we could see a canal from our window and we never used public transport once apart from to get there from the train station. Its in walking distance of everything else. Hotel:Stunning. The reception is set in a lounge type area with free hot and cold drinks and an array of snacks all completely free-fanastic! Staff: upon arriving our room had not been cleaned-the staff immediatly moved us to another and put a huge vase of lilies in our room to apologise. They are always friendly and helpful-including sending someone to help when I couldnt open my suitcase! One night we asked directions to a resturant which we gave in detail and they even asked how our meal was when we got back that night. Food: breakfast is set in a sweet little dining room, mainly cold stuff but they will cook you gorgeous pancakes and ommelettes. Room: The most gorgeous hotel room I've ever stayed in. The decor and furniture are stunning, huge comfy beds, stocked fridge, flatscreen tv, gorgeous bath room with tv speakers.

Reviews.Title: “a big thankyou”
Reviews.Author: fredthecat
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say a big thankyou to all at the Banks Mansion, all the staff were excellent which I have not always found in other higher rated hotels. My wife and I have just returned after a perfect and very enjoyable stay at the hotel and all the drinks were FREE! If I could make one comment, having spoken to some other guests during our stay, the details that the hotel website and other booking websites give as to the "concept of Banks Mansion" is not very clear and does not explain how good the facilities/drinks/snacks etc are, take no note of the odd bad review, they do not do the hotel justice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central Boutique Hotel with ' at home' experience”
Reviews.Author: Search4Paradise
Reviews.Content: Quick version - this is THE hotel to stay at in Amsterdam, book it if you like quality finishes and easy access. The quality and extra features (breakfast, all drinks, snacks) easily make up for the slight increase in cost over other hotels. Longer version - My wife and I spent my 30th Birthday at the Banks Mansion hotel and had a fantastic time. We used Trip Advisor for reviews and advice of where to stay so thanks to all for taking the time to comment. Although we have been to Amsterdam twice before, both stays right next to Dam Square, we wanted a quality hotel with attention to detail whilst being central enough to get around to the sites easily. We booked direct through the hotelâ€™s website (cheaper than Expedia etc) received confirmation promptly and any requests were confirmed upon providing a credit card number. Looking at the map it appears that Banks Mansion is a little far from the attractions â€“ but once you get there and take a look at the map you realise you could not be in a better location. You are simply right in the middle of the most popular areas - the Dam Square area to the north where you will find the tourist spots of Red Light District, souvenir shops, Madame Tussauds, coffee shops etc; East to the Artis zoo, the Leidesplein to the South West (restaurants etc) and then South to the Reiks Museum, Van Gogh museum and Heineken Experience. Oh and you are 50 yards from the flower market and the Rembrandtplein. Banks really is in the right spot - central AND quiet - it is in the old finance and lawyers district which means beautiful old historic bank buildings in traditional Dutch fashion, and is right on the canal. It took us 15 minutes to amble down the Damrak and Rokin taking in the sites and to arrive at the corner plot of the Banks Mansion with a decadent entrance warming you to the fact that you have chosen wisely ;o) Check in was easy and an upgrade to a small suite was offered to celebrate my birthday. Note in no way has the upgrade swung my vote on this hotel as it is so much more than that. The suite was on the ground floor and was a great size. More importantly the decor was just right, comfy and plush with clever lighting. Massive 7 foot square bed, 2 arm chairs, widescreen TV and DVD, large desk/dresser, Private Bar, lots of storage space in pretty art deco wardrobe, separate toilet and a big bathroom with deep bath and a separate, powerful rain fall shower. The BIG benefit of this hotel is the 'At Home' experience. So rather than spending a nice day seeing the attractions of Amsterdam and then coming back to your hotel and crashing out in your room and watching TV, waiting to go out not wanting to spend money on the mini-bar and not wanting to go to a bar just yet, here at Banks you can come back, dump your coat and chill out in the large lounge area with free self serve drinks and snacks. Every drink you could ask for is here including branded spirits in decanters, bottle beers, coffee machine and soft drinks. Snacks consisted of sushi, expensive nuts, pesto and bread. Just enough to get your appetite going for a nice meal out and plenty of magazines and papers to recommend the best nights (and days) out. In case you were wondering â€“ does a free bar mean everyone gets wrecked â€“ Not whilst we were there, it seems the hotel attracts the right type of guest who has better things to do than abuse a great feature of the hotel. So we ate at the Indonesian across the road (very tasty), Ocho's a Brazilian Grill near Leidesplein (great steaks) and Bangkok, a Thai recommended by the hotel again round the corner (which was very good and very popular with the locals - worth booking). Breakfast in the hotel is very good, full continental selection plus fruit, pancakes and the staple eggs, bacon and sausages (cooked well for a change) â€“ plenty to get you through and avoid the need for lunch. If you are not a great lover of walking then a cab (hotel ordered us a very nice Mercedes MPV with chauffer) to the train station is less than 10 Euros perhaps a normal cab is even cheaper, and there is a Tram stop 50 metres from the hotel. But as the city is flat and there is so much to look at and take in I would strongly recommend an amble around this interesting city. For a third trip to Amsterdam this hotel served us incredibly well. We wanted something different (stayed in the Swissotel before which although pleasant is not even in the same league as Banks Mansion), something with a bit more attention and thought whilst still being affordable and within easy reach of the sites. We found it all in the Banks Mansion and would not hesitate recommending it for couples, business trips or small groups of friends. There is no point staying anywhere else in Amsterdam, perhaps it will be harder to get availability next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sonialovesmum
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night break at Banks Mansion and totally recommend it. We booked it direct and spoke to henry who was so helpful and friendly as were all the staff. We paid 184 euros per night. The hotel is ideally situated and immaculate. The living room is a lovely setting and the free drinks and snacks a great idea. Rooms are great, big beds and nice bathroom. Breakfast was so so. We didnt go down till 10 so hot food was a little cold. Would definately encourage people to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely little place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: napple
Reviews.Content: It's the staff that makes this place just that little bit special. They go out of their way to make you happy. From checkin to checkout, their attitude and performance were great. The room I had was lovely, with a nice view over the canal. The little touches like the free drinks in your room and four choices of pillow type are very welcome. There are some flaws though... the housekeeper forgot to to leave fresh towels and more worryingly... didn't close the door of the room properly behind them!! Luckily nothing was missing from the room but this really shouldn't happen. I'm willing to forgive this though as the rest of the experience was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, no room when I arrived”
Reviews.Author: sanfrantraveler
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with Hotels.com at the Banks Mansion in Amsterdam, and paid in advance with my credit card. When I arrived they told me they were overbooked and didn't have any rooms at all, even though I had prepaid. They put me in a cheaper hotel but I didn't get any refund of the price difference. The Swissotel where I had to stay instead was okay, but I saw they only charged the Banks Mansion 100 Euro, whereas I paid 150 to Hotels.com. I think it is inexcusable to overbook. It was a hassle and I did not get what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “What a weekend”
Reviews.Author: MellowmanEngland
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Free bar - with cold bottles of Becks, wine, Baileys + Gin, Whisky, Brandy in the room, again all included in the price. Great breakfast - included in the price. Great staff - Henry was very helpful (sorry about the goat - we had been in the coffee shops. Great rooms - great for sleeping in - what else do you need the room for, superb bathroom. Really don't see how anyone can complain about this hotel. Close to some great restuarants, bars, coffee shops and with a canal bus stop just outside the hotel. Thoroughly recommend - cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Superb Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauliepaul10
Reviews.Content: Well...after everything else that has been written about Banks Mansion, I think all we can do is agree say you should stay here if in Amsterdam! Banks Mansion lies in an extremely convenient location, just outside of the main shopping area and a minutes walk from the Flower Market. We walked from Central Station to the hotel when we arrived and it only took us 20 minutes (not walking particularly fast either) to get there. The hotel is virtually in a straight line from the station and could not have been easier to find. It was very easy to get back to the hotel from any direction in order to freshen up and grab a quick coffee during the day. From arrival to departure, all members of staff were extremely courteous and wanting to make your stay as pleasant as possible. On our day of departure we had left our luggage at the hotel whilst we enjoyed our last few hours in the city. When we returned to collect them at the end of the day, we were welcomed to enjoy one last drink from the house bar and to relax before departing for the airport. The rooms were of a first class quality and suprisingly big for European standards. As other reviewers have mentioned, everything is included in the price of the room, even the minibar in the room. What gave it that extra touch is that there were decanters in the room containing three different spirits to choose from and mixers in the fridge, rather than spirits in little plastic bottles!! Our room looked out onto the Herengracht canal and had windows that opened right up. Gave a lovely feel to the room. The only thing about our room was the cold tap on the shower...it had a tendancy to turn itself off slowly, making the water extremely hot! We would, without a doubt, stay at this hotel again. In fact, we are hoping to go back later this year and will be sure to contact the hotel for their availablilty and price. If you want an all inclusive hotel room, in a great location, with attentive staff, attractive art deco features and a friendly atmosphere, then definately choose Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice and an excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTee
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewers who liked Banks Mansion. It is an excellent value - we got a relatively low rate directly though the hotel, and were very happy with a canal view room that was quiet if the windows were closed. We found the staff very helpful and nice, the room was narrow but decent in size and very nice in decor and furnishings (art deco look, with a big bathroom), particularly for Europe where narrow and eclectic rooms are typical even in more expensive hotels. The room was charming, if you like contemporary and spare European sensibilities. There were a lot of amenities included with the room (free in-room mini-bar, free alcohol in room and in lobby, inlcuding bottled beer and soft drinks, free snacks, complimentary breakfast which did include custom egg and waffle making, etc.) -- all of which was quite excellent and unique in our experience for any contemporary hotel in the US or Europe -- they are simply not out to strip you of every dime you bring in this place. With the decent nightly rate (180E for the two of us), for a canal view room and all of the amenities, we thought it was an excellent value. The hotel is extremely well located, in the central part of the canal belt near the Amstel River, the Rembrandtpelin and the flower market, yet its not too inner city (where it can get a little sleazy). It was a 5 minute or less walk to the Joordan, the Spui, Dam Square, Leidseplein and the Museum area. It's very close to Tempo Doloe and other excellent Indonesian restuarants, several of our favorite coffee shops (Damkring, Rokerij and Tweede Kamer), 2 or 3 trolley lines within a block of the front door, so it is ultra-convenient. This is a relaxed hotel with a relaxed attitude in an excellent location. We have stayed in hotels in Amsrterdam where we felt ever so slightly unwelcome, but not here. I guess I can understand how some people might find it underwhelming, but we really liked the combination of location, value and amenities. We will definitely stay here again when we come to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fab weekend in Amsterdam at Banks Mansion !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a fab weekend in Amsterdam at a newish 4* hotel called Banks Mansion - it was very much to be recommended (with amazing free bar in the lounge and free booze in the room). We booked through lastminute and the rate was about GBP330 including breakfast, tax and service for 2 nights. Amsterdam was especially pretty decked out in Xmas decorations. Went to the Rijksmuseum (very good although part of collection was in storage due to building renovations), Van Gogh museum (excellent and you can buy your tickets at the hotel desk), Anne Frank house (interesting in a macabre way), and walked through the flower market (pretty) and red light district (strange!). We found several good restaurants, mainly informal places in the neighborhood where we were staying (Grachtengordel south) such as the Piet de Leeuw steakhouse which is a couple of blocks from the hotel, and one on Egelentiersstraat in Jordaan that was great because it had live music - called Claes Claesz. I also recommend the newly published (July 2005) Rough Guide to Amsterdam. I'll definitely be going back to Banks Mansion. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Dec 2nd & 3rd 2005. This was a really great choice of hotel - literally 5 mins walk from great shopping in Kalver-straat and Flower Market, 10 mins from Dam Square, with the option of heading down to the Jordann in the evening for bars/food etc., if you don't fancy the centre of town. We had a deluxe double, which although slightly dark at back of hotel, was immaculately appointed, huge bathroom, fab shower, minibar well stocked, and any drink you didn't have in your room was readily available in the free drinks area in the lobby. The self-service lounge/lobby area is a fab idea, and you can even get a cappucino and danish in the morning if you miss breakfast! If you've never been to Amsterdam before make a canal cruise and a trip to La Place Mangerie for food [5 mins from hotel; but closes @8pm], must-do's as part of your stay. There's also a good chinese directly across the road. We have already been raving about this hotel to our friends as the place in Amsterdam to stay and worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed in banks mansion for a few days and did not want to leave, the rooms are comfortable and very clean, the bath room was lovely and the staff are extreemely friendly, i was delighted to find out that all drinks in the room and in the lounge downstairs were included within the room price! would not think of staying anywhere else when i visit amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “fulfills the recommendations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Needing a place to stay, in the tad-expensive Amsterdam, the previous reviews of this hotel convinced us to reserve our room. Lucky we did! Very central, very clean, very comfortable, and very inclusive. I can only confirm what has been told before: Bed with pillow choices, free minibar, GRREAT rain-shower, delicious and plenty breakfast, and the very welcoming lobby drinks & snacks. Also, the luxury of an elevator, against the steep staircases of Amsterdam, is the killing blow! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a regular in Amsterdam, and I recently spent a week on business there and stayed at the Banks Mansion. As mentioned elsewhere, the location is superb - convenient for the museums and Leidesplein in particluar. The shower is absolutely spot on, and the free bar/snacks are a great idea. The only minor flaw is that the hotel is on quite a busy street so you can hear traffic. Overall excellent, would recommend to any visitor. PS Take some CDs and take advantage of listening to music in the shower!

Reviews.Title: “Banks Mansion an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffMiami
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Banks Mansion in July - this was our second stay at this amazing hotel. We had stayed there in March 2005 for a few days and liked Amsterdam so much we decided to go back in the summer and we immediately booked our room. We love the rooms - this time we had a deluxe room with view on the canal - the bed was very confortable and the shower with steam function is particularely nice after a full day of walking. I had read previous reviews about the fact that the lobby bar was not re-stocked in the evening but this was not our experience. There was always wine, beer and snacks available in the evening but what we particularely enjoyed was the espresso/capuccino maker we could use anytime. We also loved the complimentary internet access (2 stations in the lobby). The breakfast was excellent and most of all, all the staff we encountered was extremely helpful and would go out of their way to make our stay perfect. We will definitely be back in Amsterdam and certainly will stay at the Banks Mansion.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal via an Internet site for my first trip to Amsterdam, and was very satisfied indeed with the Banks Mansion. Very conveniently located in the attractive Grachtengordel area on one of Amsterdam's finest canals (Herrengracht), and only a short walk from the Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum, old town centre, flower market and Rembrandtsplein. Tram stop very close by for those who wish to go further afield. The hotel is Art Deco and nicely furnished; contemporary design style room was absolutely fine with comfortable bed, good bathroom, flat-screen TV, free minibar; the public area including the lounge also featured free food and drinks; the breakfast room (and breakfast) also perfectly acceptable. Staff were friendly and service was good. Really can't understand why anyone would be unhappy with the place; enjoyed a great stay and would recommend to anyone. It may not be 5 star but it's certainly a very good 4 star. Would definitely stay there again when I next visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at Banks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stumbled across this hotel by chance on the internet and are very glad we did! It is located centrally within easy walking distance of all the main sights/museums and shopping/eating areas, as well as easy to get to from the airport by public transport. The building itself is beautiful from the outside, and the bedrooms, whilst not enormous, were certainly big enough for the two of us. The art deco/macintosh style interiors were very stylish. Breakfast was included and was of an excellent standard - but my favourite part was the complimentary mini bar in the bedrooms and the complimentary hotel bar in the lobby. During the day the fully stocked bar also offered cakes and chocolates, which gave way to nuts, nachos etc in the late afternoon/evening! Very welcoming after a long day sightseeing to fall into a big armchair with a complimetary glass of wine or beer and nibbles! The staff were helpful even calling up to the room to check we were happy following check in.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am sorry for the previous reviewer who ended up with an unsatisfactory room, but I have to agree with the majority and say that my perception last weekend was of a friendly and welcoming place. I have a weakness for Art Nouveau and Art Deco and so I very much liked the decor of this splendid hotel-others might find it a bit "over the top". The desk and waiting staff were helpful and efficient and everything was spotlessly clean. The bedroom and bathroom were both of a good size (my room had a pleasant outlook onto the Herengracht) and the power-shower was much appreciated. I made little use of the flat screen TV, DVD/CD player or free computer access but it was nice to know that they were there. The free bar (and free mini-bar in each room) is an excellent idea-the extortionate mini-bar prices in most hotels are a regular source of irritation-and I did not see anyone the worse for these facilities, though obviously someone with a weakness in that direction would do better to stay elsewhere. The breakfast was ample and served in an agreeable room with a relaxing atmosphere. The hotel's location is convenient for most parts of the city centre. I think that it offers good value for money in its price range and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gus1221
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon and all I can say is this is a great Hotel The free mini bar and the service of the staff is very good . We only got put on to this hotel by mistake when out travel agent booked the wrong dates for us . We could only stay 2 nights here and they found us another hotel close by and arranged our baggage to be taken over there . A very very very nice and new and flash hotel . The bathroom is exceptional and the Plasma screen that swings round to you can watch it in he Toilet just toped it off for me Location easy walking to everywear or there are tram stops outside the door . Beds so comfy and the Menu of pillows you can choose from depending on how you want to sleep is a great idea . Breakfast they will cook you pretty much whatever you feel like.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with unhelpful staff. Dont let the expensive prices dupe you into thinking you will be staying at a deluxe hotel it is " re assuringly expensive" The staff are few and far between. Better value for money can be had at a larger 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: spursone
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this hotel. My wife and I found the hotel to be excellent. This was our 6th trip to Amsterdam. We felt that this was the best value for the money. The room was air conditioned. The included breakfast was as good as any you could find in town. And we made several trips to the lobby bar for drinks, coffee and snacks. Overall, all of the added extras for this hotel make it an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “the best room I have stayed in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BM for a long weekend at the end of may, had a great room at the back of the hotel service was top class and the staff were very helpfuland helped arrange the small things to be available for me in my room, Champs & Flowers the works, really realyy nice, excellent location just of the main streets but very close to everything I recomend this place to EVERYONE

Reviews.Title: “try elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1976
Reviews.Content: small hotel lacking real quality and expensive for what it is staff unfriendly and unhelpful

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was undoubtably the most disappointing, but not the worst, hotel I have ever visited. It touts its style and free bar but falls down on the basics. The rooms on the ground floor, we were lucky enough to catch two of them, are literally 2 metres from the pavement and three from the trams. Despite the double glazing there was far too much noise from both outside the hotel and inside from the reception area. The rooms themselves were constantly gloomy and the hotel doesn't seem to be able to afford lighting above 25 watts. One room, 008, is so small the wardrobe door only opens 45 degrees and the bathroom is so small you have to sit on the toilet sideways! The water is constantly boiling and with cold water taps in the shower that slowly turn themselves off, it makes for interesting bath times. The breakfast is merely adequate, not what you expect at 210 euros per person per night. There is a free bar and 2 computer terminals that are free to use but that in no way makes up in the deficencies of this hotel. Most of the small team of staff are pleasant, the leas helpful being the Genaral Manager who showed no interest in offering an alternative room. If you haven't booked, don't, there are far better hotels in this price category, if we hadn't paid in full before arrival we would have walked out, something I have only done once before in neraly 30 years of travelling on business and pleasure.

HotelInfo.Name: Banks Mansion
HotelInfo.Address: Herengracht 519-522, Amsterdam 1017 BV, The Netherlands
